She was born in Magoreh village, seven miles from Makeni. She is married and has five children. Her husband is also a businessman. Kadiatu has sold dried fish for the past 10 years. She buys fish in a village called Tombo which is about 10 miles from Freetown. With this loan, Kadiatu is expecting an increase in her profits, which will enable her to provide better for her children. One of the great challenges Kadiatu faces as a dried fish seller is that they sometimes unknowingly buy a basket of fish that is mixed with some rotten ones. And when this happens, they have to throw away the rotten fish, which causes losses in her business.

loan.use: Expand their businesses

loan.name: Sevinj

texts.en:
Sevinj A. is a 21-year-old woman who works as sales person in local medicine store. She has been in this business since 2005. Because she is from very poor family, she was pushed to start working at a very early age. Now she is only 21, but she is quite an experienced young lady. She also attended courses in medicine to be better prepared for her current job.
After being in this business for such a long time, Sevinj has decided to open her own business. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of $1000 USD. She will use this loan to open a store on her own corner, where she will be selling different kinds of medicine. Your help and support will be very much appreciated.

loan.use: To open her own pharmacy

loan.name: Zowadan Koffi

texts.fr: N le 31/12/1939 Mission Tov, Mr H. Zowadan Koffi est mari et pre de dix 10 enfants. Sa femme est cultivatrice. Ils habitent le quartier Djosse Kpodji. Il sollicite ce crdit pour acheter et installer un moulin dans quartier qui souffre du manque dun moulin grain. Ce crdit lui permettra d'avoir un revenu substantiel pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1939 in Mission Tov, Mr. Zowadan Koffi H. is married and the father of 10 children. His wife is a farmer. They live in the Djosse Kpodji district. He is requesting this loan to buy and install a mill in this neighborhood which suffers from a lack of a mill to grind grain. This loan will permit him to have a substantial income to cater for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase and installation of a mill for grain

loan.name: Gulnare

texts.en:
Gulnare H. is a 51-year-old woman who is married and has five children. She has a store in the local bazaar where she sells home supplies, such as as kettles, tea trays, and kitchen clocks. She tries very hard to meet her family's needs, because it is very hard to keep such a large family. Her husband helps by purchasing new supplies, which he brings from Baku every week. She dreams of providing a good education for her children.
Gulnare has applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase more supplies and increase her income. Lets do our best to support her in her very hard life!

loan.use: To purchase more supplies

loan.name: Daliborka

texts.en: Daliborka Jovanovi was born in 1979. She lives in the village of Lipac near Doboj. She has two children. Unfortunately, her husband died last year. He had supported their family, and they now live on his retirement of 150 KM ($112 USD). Fortunately, Daliborka has her garden and a field where she grows different kinds of vegetables, some of which she uses to feed her family and the rest she sells. Daliborka wants to produce more vegetables for selling, so she decided to take out her first loan from Women for Women International in the amount of 600 KM ($450 USD). She will use this loan to buy seeds for autumn sowing. Daliborka hopes that she will be able to earn enough money to pay all her familys expenses.

loan.use: To buy a seeds

loan.name: Ayva Marie

texts.fr: Ayva Marie K. est ne le 20.04 1967 Amgnran. Elle est mari et a sept (07) enfants. Son mari est grant dune pharmacie villageoise. Ils habitent un petit village lintrieur du TOGO environ 70 km de Lom la capitale appel Zafi Hetchavi. Elle sollicite ce crdit pour faire le commerce du ptrole lampant qui est trs recherch dans le village. Elle compte sur ce financement pour amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayva Marie K. was born on April 20, 1967, in Amgnran. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is the manager of the village pharmacy. They live in a little village called Zafi Hetchavi in the interior of Togo, about 70 km from the capital Lom. Mme K. is requesting this loan to trade kerosene, which is in great demand in the village. She is counting on this financing to improve her familys living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy and sell kerosene

loan.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 30-year-old single woman who lives in a small village in the Mount Lebanon region. Dalal has a beauty shop and is trained in cosmetics and makeup application. Dalal's ambitions to expand her business led her to Al Majmoua, and she has requested a loan of $900 in order to purchase new tools that will enable her to provide a wider range of services for her customers. With this loan, Dalal will be able to grow her business and provide a better standard of living for her family. This is the first time Dalal has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loan.use: To purchase supplies for her salon

loan.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin M. is a 21-year-old market vendor. Since 2004, he has bee selling men's clothing in the local market. Because his mother is a housekeeper, his business is the only source of income for his family, which consist of his elderly parents, a younger brother and sisters. For this reason, he works hard to bring sustenance back to his home. Elchin wants to get married and have children, but he needs to improve his life conditions first.
To grow his business, Elchin is requesting a loan of $1200 USD. He will use the loan to purchase merchandise so he can offer a wider selection to his customers and increase his income. With the rotation of supplies in his business, he plans to repay the loan within 15 months. The well-being of Elchin's family and his business are in your hands. Elchin and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loan.use: To purchase men's clothing for the winter season to sell

loan.name: Rhoda Group

texts.en:
These are Alimany B. and Zainab B.. (Other members of the group are now receiving loans from SMT as individual clients.) They named their group Rhoda. They have been with SMT for over five years now. Their previous loan with SMT was Le 1,000,000.00. This loan was a great help to these entrepreneurs. These people's businesses have been growing as a result of the continuous access to loans they have been getting from SMT. But they still need new loans as they are aware of the fact that it is the continuous access to financial services that can eradicate or reduce poverty.

Alimany B. is the leader of this group. Alimany owns a provisions shop at Pamlap, a village around the outskirts of Makeni. He has been in his current business for over 15 years now. Alimany was born in Binkolo, a village 7 miles from Makeni. He is 47, married with 4 children. Two of his children are in secondary school and the other two are in primary school. His previous loans with SMT helped Alimany a great deal. Out of the proceeds of his business, he was able to solve his numerous problems. He could send his children to school, attend to them when they fall sick, feed and clothe them. Though he faces some few challenges in his business, like that of bad debtors, Alimany is nevertheless expecting a lot of improvements in his life with this new loan. His immediate goal he told me is to start building himself and his family a house. Even if he can not accomplish this desire now, he continued, with continuous loans from SMT, Alimany is optimistic that he will be able to accomplish his goal.

loan.use: Expand their businesses

loan.name: Ndye Salimatou

texts.fr: Ndye Salimatou S., 38 ans, marie avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkan Viviane Wade depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des graines darachide pour les transformer en pte darachide et vendre. Les revenus tirs de son commerce lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Elle sollicite un prt qui sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance.<b/>
texts.en:
Ndye Salimatou S., 38, married and raising 5 children, has been a member of the village bank of Kounkan Viviane Wade for 6 years. She wants to purchase peanuts to make into peanut butter for sale. The income from her business will allow her to help support her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment./b>

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: sale of peanut butter

loan.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman N. is 34 year old and is married with two sons. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells women's clothes and shoes. Elman's family is actively involved in helping with the business. Elman is requesting a loan of $1000 USD to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to become a successful entrepreneur. Elman`s main goal is to educate his beloved children so that, someday, they'll become successful entrepreneurs themselves. We believe his perseverance and clear vision are key factors in the success of his small business.

loan.use: To increase his stock

loan.name: Zahar

texts.en: Zaher is 35 years old and the father of one child. Zaher lives in the Mount Lebanon region, near the town of Aley. A hairdresser by trade, Zaher owns a salon for women. Zaher believes that a confident vision for the future is essential to the success of his business, and has recently asked for a loan of $1000 improve the decoration of his salon, as well as to purchase several new salon chairs. Zaher is confident that these improvements will increase his client flow. Over his past four loan cycles, Zaher's honesty and punctuality with his payments have helped him earn the trust of Al Majmou's loan analysts.

loan.use: To help fund the purchase of new salon chairs and decoration for Zahar's salon.

loan.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa N. is a 43 year old man who owns a veterinary medicine shop. He started his business in 1992. Musa is married and has 2 children. It is very hard to meet his family's financial needs, so Musa has applied for a loan of $1000 USD to expand his current business.

loan.use: To expand his current business.

loan.name: Koffi

texts.fr: N le 18/11/1983 Vogan, Mr Koffi A. est mari et pre de famille avec quatre (04) enfants charge. Sa femme est une tresseuse. Ils habitent le quartier Hdzranawo Lom. Il sollicite ce crdit pour ouvrir un studio de photo et de reportage vido. C'est un jeun homme trs dynamique qui mrite d'tre appuy.
texts.en:
Born on November 18, 1983 in Vogan, Mr. Koffi A. is married and raising 4 children. His wife does hair braiding. They live in the Hdzranawo district in Lom. He is asking for this loan to open a photography and videography studio. He is a very dynamic young man who merits support.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: opening a photography and videography studio

loan.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim S. is a 45-year-old man who is married with 2 children. He has owned his veterinary medicine shop since 2000. This is very popular product among farmers, because majority of people keep livestock and need to give them injections every two to three months. He needs $1200 USD to increase number of medicines that he sells.

loan.use: To increase number of medicine he sells.

loan.name: Haisam

texts.en: Haisam is 28 years old and the father of one child. He lives in the town of Aley, situated atop Mount Lebanon. In Aley, Haisam owns an auto-body repair shop and has asked for a loan of $1000 to help purchase new tools. Haisam's current tools are outdated and force him to spend long periods of time doing work that could be finished quickly. His new instruments will allow him to service more customers in less time, hopefully increasing his business's profitability. This will be Haisam's second loan with Al Majmoua.

loan.use: To purchase new tools

loan.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, 47, is married and has seven children between the ages of 3 and 30. She has been a bites (snacks) seller since 1991. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Asha is requesting a loan to improve her business.

loan.use: To improve her business.

loan.name: Wahida's Wanawake Na Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Wahida is 27 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 7 and 2. She has sold charcoal, bites (snacks), and juice since 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

Wahida is looking for a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Farida, who sells with perfumes.

loan.use: To improve her businesss.

loan.name: Diarry

texts.fr: Diarry K., 49 ans, veuve avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkan Viviane Wade depuis 3 ans. Elle veut acheter et revendre des tissus teints. Son activit secondaire est la vente de pte darachide quelle produit par la transformation des graines quelle achte sur le march. Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charges les besoins de sa famille. <b>Diarry sollicite un prt qui sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance.<b/>
texts.en:
Diarry K. is a 49-year-old widow with five children under her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkan Vivane Wade for three years. She wants to purchase and resell dyed fabrics. Her other job consists of selling peanut butter which she makes with peanuts that she buys at the market. Her income allows her to support her family. Ms. K. is requesting a loan which will be repaid in one lump sum in six months time.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Selling of dyed fabrics and peanut butter

texts.en:
Asadulla N. is a 40 year old father of two children. Asadulla opened his business selling clothing for men four years ago to support his family. Sacrificial and hardworking, he supports not only his two children, but his elderly parents as well.
Asadulla has invested countless hours and efforts to develop his business and establish a strong client base. Now his wife is helping him with the business. With the beginning of a new winter season, Asdaulla wants to add new seasonal stock to his inventory. He applied for $1200 USD. With this loan, he will be able to make a good profit by having the right inventory in stock to meet demand as the season changes.
Asadulla and his friendly family would like to express their gratitude for everyone supporting him.

loan.use: to buy men's clothes for the winter season

loan.name: Assitan

texts.fr: Madame Assitan Sidib a 50 ans et vit avec ses sept( 7) enfants et son poux dans une famille nuclaire Sogomougou un des quartiers de la ville de koutiala(troisime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali) Nayant jamais t lcole comme la plupart des femmes de son ge, Madame Assitan Sidib fut initie aux activits commerciales depuis sa tendre enfance par sa mre. Evoluant dans le secteur de la nourriture, notamment la vente de la pte darachide, elle a un grand sens des affaires grce une trentaine danne exprience accumule dans lexercice de cette activit. Pour obtenir de la pte darachide, les graines darachides sont tries, grilles dans un four (trs souvant frabriqu localement), pluches, vannes puis amenes au moulin (pour avoir la pte). La pte ainsi obtenue est mise dans des seaux en plastiques. Pour largir son activit Assitan Sidib decida dintgrer le programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso il ya de cela 4 ans. Aprs 4 prts solidaires (prt de groupe) tous correctement rembourss ; elle est son troisime prt individuel. Elle compte utiliser ce prt pour acheter, 1.000 kg darachides et 50 seaux en plastique (pour le conditionnement de sa pte darachide). Elle sapprovisionne sur place Koutiala auprs des commerants grossistes faisant le stockage des crales. Elle vend sa production en dtail, au comptant et crdit son domicile et dans les diffrents services une clientle gnralement compose de femmes (mnagres et revendeuses) et de salaris. Son cycle dactivit (achat, transformation et vente) est dun mois. En raison de la qualit de sa pte darachide, Madame Assitan Sidib jouit dune grande rputation dans cette activit de transformation des graines darachide en pte. Elle reoit beaucoup de commandes surtout auprs des revendeurs et des familles dsireuses de faire un stock afin de palier aux fluctuations de prix. Elle compte raliser un bnfice de 90.000FCFA par mois quelle envisage utiliser pour rembourser les intrts du prt et participer aux dpenses quotidiennes de la famille.Dans lavenir , elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique afin de faire le grosssiste dans la vente de la pte darachide.
texts.en:
Ms. Assitan Sidib is 50 years old and lives with her seven children and her husband in a nuclear family in Sogomougou, one of the districts of the city of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Never having gone to school, as is true for most women of her age, she was initiated into commercial work at a tender age by her mother. Developing in the food sector, notably in selling peanut butter, she has much business sense, thanks to 30 years of experience accumulated through doing this work. To obtain peanut butter, the peanuts are sorted, roasted in an oven (very often built locally), peeled, winnowed, and then taken to the mill (for converting into a paste). The peanut butter obtained in this way is then put into plastic buckets. To expand her business, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program four years ago. After four solidarity loans (group loans) that were all correctly repaid, she is on her third individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy 1,000 kg of peanuts and 50 plastic buckets (for conditioning the peanut butter). She gets her supplies locally in Koutiala from wholesale merchants who stock grains. She sells her production at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, out of her home and with the difference public services, to customers generally composed of women (housewives and retailers) and salaried workers. Her business cycle (purchasing, production, and sales) is one month in length. Because of the quality of her peanut butter, Ms. Assitan Sidib enjoys a great reputation in this business of making peanut butter. She receives many orders, especially from retailers and from families wanting to stock up against price fluctuations. She intends to realize a profit of 90,000 francs per month that she envisions using for covering the loan interest and for helping with the day-to-day expenses of the family. In the future, her ambition is to open a shop to become a peanut butter wholesaler.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy sacks of peanuts

loan.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz A. is 36 year old and is married with two children. He sells men's clothes. The store is located in the central local market and has been open for 8 years.
In order to have a wide range of goods for any taste and any price, Ramiz travels every month to the capital of country, Baku, to purchase new goods. While he travels, Ramizs wife helps him sell in the market.
Ramiz has managed to increase his clientele, but he is not able to fully meet their demands. He is requesting a loan of $1000 USD. He would like to increase his inventory to earn more income so that he can provide his children with a good education and a better future. Your generosity can help change their lives.

loan.use: To purchase men's clothes for the winter season

loan.name: Tamaraneh Traders Association Group

texts.en:
This group is called Tamaraneh Traders Association. Tamaraneh is a Temne word meaning "Let us help each other". They are business women in Makeni, the northern provincial headquarters town. They have been together as a group with SMT for the past three years

Previously, SMT loaned these women Le 600,000.00 each. This they have repaid successfully and are now requesting a new loan. The previous loan made a lot of impact on their lives, but they still need more loans to further empower themselves in their businesses.

Their leader is Kadiatu T. (on the right). Kadiatu was born in Port Loko, a town in the north of Sierra Leone. She is 44 years of age. She is married with three children. Two of her children are in primary school and the one is in secondary school. Both she and her husband are responsible for their schooling and welfare. For the past four years, Kadiatu has been in the local produce business (she sells items like palm-oil, ground nuts, rice, etc.). Through her business, Kadiatu is able to meet most of her financial needs.

loan.use: Expand their businesses

loan.name: Rehema's Tusitengane Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 35 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 18 and 5 years old. She has been a vegetable seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Rehema is now looking for a loan to buy more vegetables and bananas for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asha, who has a business dealing with charcoal, firewood and coconut sales.

loan.use: To buy more vegetables for re-sale

loan.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Mari et pre dun enfant, T. Koffi est n le 23/11/1983 Agbodjan Kop dans la prfecture des Lacs. Sa conjointe est femme au foyer sans revenu. Ils habitent le quartier Dabara Kondji Lom. Il sollicite ce crdit pour ouvrir un magasin dalimentation gnrale et vente de produits pharmaceutiques gnriques. Ce crdit lui permettra d'amliorer ses revenus et les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Married and the father of one child, Koffi T. was born on November 23, 1983 in Agbodjan Kop in the Lakes Prefecture. His partner is a housewife who does not earn an income. They live in the Dabara Kondji district in Lom. He is requesting this loan to open a little general store where he also plans to sell generic medicines. This loan will permit him to improve his income and the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: opening a general store

loan.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer A. is a 43-year-old man who lives with his wife and two adorable children in the small village of Saatli region. He sells women's clothing in the local bazaar. He started his business in 1996. He is not alone in his business; his wife actively helps him to sell clothes.
Selling clothes is the only one financial source in his family. Azer goes to capital of Azerbaijan, Baku, to purchase new clothes every week. He has applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase women clothes for winter season.
Let's wish Azer good luck in new season!

loan.use: To purchase women's clothes for winter season

loan.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 35 years old, married and has two children, ages 10 and 4. She has made a living selling charcoal and bread since 2003. Every day, she works from 7:15 a.m. to 2 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $25.

Zainab is looking to improve her business with a loan to buy more charcoal and bread to sell.

loan.use: To buy more charcoal and bread to sell.

loan.name: Akofa

texts.fr: Clibataire et mre dun enfant, Akofa K. est ne le 02/10/1982 Lom. Elle habite le quartier B Ahligo . Elle a un salon de coiffure qui ne rpond pas aux normes pour la satisfaction de ses clients et lui fournissant suffisamment de revenus pour subvenir ses propres besoins et celui de son enfant. Elle sollicite ce crdit pour squiper en matriel de travail et en produits cosmtiques et rnover son salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
A single mother with one child, Akofa K. was born on Oct 2, 1982 in Lom. She lives in the B Ahligo district. She has a hairdressing salon that is unable to satisfy its customers or provide her with enough income to meet her own needs or those of her child. She is requesting this loan to equip herself with work materials and cosmetic products, and to renovate her hairdressing salon.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase work materials and renovate her hairdressing salon

loan.name: Djnbou

texts.fr: Madame Djnbou T. est ge de 33 ans et vit avec ses 5 enfants et son mari dans une famille monogame au troisime quartier de Sgou (quatrime rgion administrative de la rpublique du Mali.) Elle se consacra trs rapidement aux activits gnratrices de revenus, notamment le commerce des articles de fte (tel les boucles doreilles). En plus elle vend aussi des trousseaux de cls, des habits et des chaussures. Elle a son tale sis au march journalier du chteau de Sgou (situ au centre ville sur lartre principale reliant Bamako au Burkina). Dans le souci daugmenter la taille de ses activits elle dcida de collaborer avec le programme crdit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Aprs avoir boucl 4 prts de groupe (prt solidaire) tous correctement rembourss avec une association de son quartier, elle est son deuxime prt individuel. Elle compte utiliser ce prt pour acheter, 8 paquets de boucles doreilles (autrement appels garanties en provenance de Douba) et 300 paires de chaussures auprs des grossistes spcialiss dans le domaine des articles de femmes Bamako (capitale de la rpublique du Mali) Disposes sur une table, les marchandises de Madame Djnbou sont vendues gnralement au comptant une clientle compose dhommes et de femmes. Elle envisage raliser un bnfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA. et ambitionne de se construire une maison dhabitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djnbou T. s 33 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a monogamous family in the third district of Sgou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She quickly dedicated herself to profitable activities, in particular the sale of party items such as earrings. She also sells key chains, clothing and shoes. She has set up a stall at Sgous daily Chteau market (located in the center of town on the main road linking Bamako to Burkina). Wishing to expand her business, she decided to work with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago now. Having successfully repaid four group loans (solidarity loans) with an association from her district, she is now on her second individual loan. She plans to use this loan to buy 8 packets of earrings (labeled as being guaranteed to come from Dubai) and 300 pairs of shoes from wholesalers who specialize in womens items in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). Mrs. Dejnbous merchandise is laid out on a table and generally sold for cash to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make a monthly profit of CFA 40,000 and her ambition is to build a home for herself.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy earrings and shoes

loan.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa, 27, is married and has three children between the ages of two and eight. She has run her own shop since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Arafa is looking for a loan to buy more commodities for the expansion of her business.

loan.use: To buy more commodities for the expansion of her business.

loan.name: Binasa

texts.en: Binasa K. is 59 years old. She is married and lives in Visoko, a little town near Sarajevo. Binasa lives with her husband who is employed. Binasa is a farmer who works a lot in the fields. Binasa wants to be prepared for autumn sowing so she decided to take a loan from Women for Women International (WWI) in amount of 1500 KM. This is not her first loan in WWI, every year she take a loan to invest in her business. She will rent one more field for sowing wheat. Binasa will extend her business and she will be happy to the extra work. Work gives her satisfaction and provides her and her husband with food to eat and to sell.

loan.use: To buy seeds

loan.name: Hamisa's Mungu Mkubwa Group

texts.en:
Hamisa is 36 years old. She is divorced with 4 children, ages between 17 and 2 years old. She has been a clothing seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 9 am to 4:30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.
Hamisa now requesting for a loan to improve her business by increasing her current stock.She will share this loan with her subgroup member Nuru, who also has business dealing with clothing sales.

loan.use: To improve her business by increasing her current stock.

loan.name: Hokn

texts.fr: Ne le 23/11/1986 Anho, M. Hokn est une clibataire avec un enfant charge. Elle vit avec son enfant dans le quartier Forever Lom et travaille actuellement comme serveuse dans un bar de la place faute dargent pour faire le commerce dans lequel elle excelle. Elle sollicite ce crdit pour faire des achats et la vente de produits cosmtiques et de chaussures pour reprendre son ancienne activit quest le commerce.
texts.en:
Hokene M. was born on November 23, 1986. She is single and is responsible for one child. She lives with her child in the Forever district of Lom and is working as a waitress in a local bar to earn income to maintain her business, at which she excels. She is requesting this loan to purchase and sell cosmetic products and shoes to re-establish her former commercial business activity.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase and sale of cosmetic products and shoes

loan.name: Rauhia

texts.en:
Rauhia is 28 years old. She is divorced with 2 children aged 8 and 6 years old. She has been a bites seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 9:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Rauhia is now looking for a loan to improve her business.

loan.use: To improve her business

loan.name: Asha's Mungu Muweza Group

texts.en:
Asha is 24 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 3 years old. She also takes care of one other person aged 26 years old. She has been a clothes and chicken seller since 2004. Daily, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 175 from her sales.

Asha is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes and chickens for her businesses. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatma, MwanaK. M., Mgeni and MwanaK. M..

loan.use: To buy more clothes and chickens for her businesses

loan.name: Massaran

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Massaran D. est ge de 32 ans. Clibataire avec un enfant, elle vit dans le quartier lafiabougou Selingu (une des sous prfecture de Yanfolila troisime rgion administrative du Mali). Ds son jeune ge, elle dmarre une activit gnratrice de revenus notamment la vente de produits cosmtique. Malgr son courage et sa volont de russite, elle est rapidement confronte un problme de ressources financires. Pour rsoudre cette difficult, elle intgra un groupe de prt solidaire de linstitution Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant trois (3) ans. Avec laugmentation rapide de son commerce et de sa clientle, elle passa au prt individuel et est son quatrime prt. Sa boutique est situe au bord de la route principale de Selingu et est bien achalande.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prt beaucoup de flacons de parfum, de perruques et autres articles de beaut de femme pour anticiper les grosses ventes lies la fte de ramadan et la rentre scolaire. Elle sapprovisionne Bamako une fois par mois et vend selingu dans son magasin au comptant et crdit une clientle compose de femmes de selingu et celles des localits environnantes. Elle jouit dune bonne rputation en raison de son exprience et de la matrise des techniques de commerce.
Elle envisage raliser un bnfice mensuel de 95.000 FCFA quelle utilisera pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et dsire la longue instaurer un salon de coiffure qui est une demande pressante de sa clientle.
texts.en:
Miss Massaran D., 32, is single and has one child. She lives in the Lafiabougou district in Selingu (one of the sous-prefectures of Yanfolila, third administrative region of Mali). Since her youth, she began earning money, notably by selling cosmetics. Despite her courage and will to succeed, she quickly ran into financial difficulties. To solve this problem, she joined in a group loan through Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. As her business and her clientele grew rapidly, she moved on to requesting an individual loan and is presently on her fourth loan. Her little shop is located on the main road of Selingu and is well-patronized.

With this loan she intends to buy a lot of bottles of perfume, wigs, and other beauty products so as to be ready for the increased sales around Ramadan and the new school year. She does her buying in Bamako once a month and makes her sales in Selingu in her shop, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of the women of Selingu and those coming from surrounding towns. She has a good reputation because of her experience and mastery of her business.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 95,000F CFA which she will use to increase her working capital and she would like to start up a beauty salon which is a pressing need for her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: buying cosmetics and lingere to add to her stock

loan.name: Remza

texts.en:
Remza Halilovi was born in 1986. She is married and has two children, ages 4 and 1. Remza lives with her family in Mahmutoviima near Kalesija. Her husband has constant work but he doesn`t earn much, only about 450 KM (~ $330 USD). It is not enough to pay all costs for his family.
Remza and his husband are busy with farming. They produce several kinds of vegetables and they have a corn field so they can produce food for their cattle.
Remza has borrowed from Women for Women International several times in the past. Every time that she has taken a loan, she invests the proceeds in her business, as she will this time.
She has saved some money, but not enough to buy another cow, so Remza will use this loan of 1000 KM ($750 USD) to buy a cow. In this way Remza`s family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loan.use: To buy a cow

loan.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Madame Hawa T. est ge de 43 ans et mre de 2 enfants. Elle vit avec son poux ses enfants dans une famille monogame au quartier Mdine de la ville de Sgou (quatrime rgion administrative du Mali). Ds son plus jeune ge elle sadonna aux activits gnratrices de revenus pour aider ses parents supporter les charges de la famille. Devenue majeure, elle opta depuis 15 ans pour le commerce du bois de construction. Installe au march de Mdine sur un des boulevards le plus frquent de la ville et tant la seule femme soccupant de la vente des bois de la construction, Madame Hawa T. fait lobjet dune curiosit et dune notorit hors du commun Sgou. Afin de mieux rsister la concurrence, dans un secteur domin par les hommes, elle dcida de travailler avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans. Elle est son deuxime prt indivuduel, aprs avoir boucl quatre prts de groupe (prt solidaire) tous correctement rembourss.. Elle compte utiliser ce prt, pour acheter, 1.500 units de bois de construction. Zantiguila (un des marchs de bois situ aux abords dune fort classe) auprs dexploitants forestiers agres par le gouvernement du Mali. Avec une clientles constitue exclusivement de grossistes venant des grandes villes, Madame Hawa T. ralise ses ventes gnralement au comptant et quelque rare fois crdit. Elle envisage raliser un bnfice par cycle (qui dure en moyenne quatre semaines) de 100.000FCFA.qui la permettra de venir en aide sa vieille mre.
texts.en:
Ms. Hawa T. is 43 years old and the mother of two. She lives with her husband and children in a monogamous family in the Mdine district of Sgou (fourth administrative region of Mali). From her earliest years, she devoted herself to income-generating work to assist her parents in supporting her family. Once she became of age, she opted at the age of 15 to do commerce in lumber. Settled in at the Mdine marketplace on one of the busiest boulevards in town, and being the only woman busy selling lumber, Ms. Hawa T. is a focus of curiosity and unusual fame in Sgou. In order to better stand up to the competition, in a sector dominated by men, she decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. She is on her second individual loan, after having settled four group loans (solidarity loans), which were all correctly repaid. She intends to use this loan to buy 1,500 pieces of lumber in Zantiguila (one of the marketplaces for lumber located on the edge of a closed forest) from woodsmen traders authorized by the government of Mali. With customers made up exclusively of wholesalers from big cities, Ms. Hawa T. generally makes her sales in cash and rarely on credit. She envisions realizing a profit per cycle (lasting four weeks on average) of 100,000 francs which enables her to come to the aid of her elderly mother

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy wood for constructon

loan.name: Kazija's Mkorofi Si Mwenzetu Group

texts.en:
Kazija is 32 years old. She is married with 2 children, ages 6 and 1 year old. She has been a firewood and juice seller since 2006. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.
Kizija now looking for a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Farida, Mariam and Sharifa.

loan.use: To expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loan.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Balimaya sont des femmes maries avec une moyenne dge de trente cinq (35) ans et cinq (5) enfants. Elles vivent dans des foyers monogames et rsident toutes au quartier Odioumabougou Oulssbougou (deuxime rgion administrative se la rpublique du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens de parent et daffaire. Elles exercent la mme activit savoir la vente de miel.
En raison de la rentabilit de cette activit et de la forte demande du miel, elles dcidrent de se regrouper et adhrer au programme de crdit Soro Yiriwaso. Avec ce prt de 25.000 FCFA par membre, elles comptent acheter chacune 30 litres de miel. Elles sapprovisionnent chaque quinze (15) jours Bougouni et vendent sur les marchs de la localit au comptant ou crdit une clientle compose dhommes et de femmes amateurs de produits naturels.
Elles comptent raliser un bnfice prvisionnel moyen de 12.000 FCFA par membre. Avec ce bnfice, elles dsirent aprs remboursement de lintrt du prt, investir le reste dans leur affaire.
texts.en:
The members of the Balimaya group are married women with an average age of thirty five and five children. They come from monogamous homes and all live in the Odioumabougou neighborhood of Oulssbougou (a second-level administrative subdivision of the Republic of Mali). They met through relatives and business connections. They all work in the same business - selling honey.

For reasons of profitability and the high demand for honey, they decided to get together and join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. With this 25,000 FCFA ($56) loan per member, they each intend to buy 30 liters of honey. They stock up at Bougouni every fifteen days and sell the honey at local markets, for cash or credit, to a clientele of men and women who are fond of natural products.

They expect to make an average profit of 12,000 FCFA ($28) per member. After repaying the interest on the loan, they want to invest the remainder of this profit in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy honey

loan.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has five children between the ages of 8 and 22. She has sold clothing since 2003. Daily, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Asha is requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loan.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loan.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, 40, is divorced and has two children, ages 10 and 15. She has been a charcoal and bites (snack) seller since 2003. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Asha is looking for a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loan.use: To expand her business by increasind her present stock.

loan.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana inici el negocio porque siempre le ha gustado el comercio. Comenz su negocio al verse en la necesidad de mantener a sus dos hijitos, hace 5 aos empez a buscar opciones par salir adelante, y lo encontr en la venta de zapatos por catalogo y con sus ahorros posteriormente puso su tienda y empez a crecer y a tener un mayor ingreso combinando ambas actividades.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $575 que pagara en 1 mes para a tener un mayor surtido en su tienda y consecuentemente mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Juana launched her business because she has always liked to make deals. She started her business five years ago after looking for opportunities to get ahead, since she knew that she needed to support her two young children. She decided to sell shoes by catalog, and with her savings she later set up a store. The combination of these two activities has allowed her to grow and to earn a greater income.

She needs a loan of US $575, which she will use to buy a wider variety of goods for her store so that she can sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy merchandise for store

loan.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria inicio el negocio para proveerse de dinero para la manutencin de sus hijos, ya que tuve que hacerse cargo de sus 4 hijos. Comenz hace aproximadamente 5 aos cuando decidi junto con una comadre a poner un estanquillo de venta de tacos, quedndose posteriormente sola con el puesto y gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima, para tener un surtido adecuado de productos y que los clientes se sientan satisfechos con su servicio.
texts.en:
Maria launched her business in order to earn money for her children's basic needs, since she has to support all four of them. It began about five years ago, when she and a friend decided to set up a taco stand. Maira was later left as the sole owner of the stand, and thanks to her efforts her family has been able to get ahead.

She needs a loan of $575 to buy raw ingredients so that she can offer a wide variety of products in order to leave her customers satisfied. She will repay the loan in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy raw ingredients to make tacos

loan.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes maries avec en moyenne vingt huit (28) ans et deux (2) enfants vivant dans des foyers monogames et rsident toutes dans le quartier filabougou Oulssbougou (Rgion de koulikoro 2 rgion du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens de parent et de voisinage.
Lactivit dominante du groupe est la vente de fruits et boissons gazeuses non alcoolises (selon la saison), en plus de cette activit, elles vendent divers articles tel que : le charbon de bois, les vtements pour nourrissons (chaussures et layettes).
Aprs plusieurs activits menes lindividuel sans russite, elles se sont regroupes pour intgrer le programme de prt solidaire de Soro Yiriwaso et sont leur premier prt.
Avec ce prt de 25.000 FCFA par membre, elles comptent acheter 150 kilogrammes de fruits, 60 cannettes de boissons et dautres divers articles. Elles sapprovisionnent sur place chaque quinze (15) jours auprs des grossistes et vendent en ambulant et au comptant. Les femmes du groupe Benkadi envisagent raliser chacune un bnfice par cycle de 8000 FCFA qui sera utilis pour satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Elles veulent dans les jours venir, diversifier leur commerce en embrassant la vente des lgumes et condiments.
texts.en:
Membership in the Benkadi group is comprised of married women who are on average 28 years old and have two children. They live in monogamous households, all residing in the Filabougou quarter of Ouelessebougou (Koulikoro, Mali). They are known to one another by ties of kinship and proximity. The groups primary area of endeavor is the sale of fruit and seasonal non-alcoholic carbonated beverages; in addition, they sell a variety of other items, including charcoal and infant clothing (shoes and layettes). After a series of individual setbacks, they formed a group to join the Soro Yiriwaso group loan program and this will be their first loan. With this loan of approximately $55 (25,000 XOF) per member, they intend to buy 150 kilograms of fruit, 60 cans of drinks and various other articles. They do their purchasing from local wholesalers every 15 days and engage in traveling and cash sales. The women in the Benkadi group hope to realize a profit of $17 (8,000 XOF) each every two weeks. They will use these profits to meet the needs of their families. In the days to come they want to diversify their business, branching out into the sale of vegetables and seasonings.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of fruit, beverages and a variety of other items

loan.name: Marisa

texts.es:
Marisa inici el negocio para tener un ingreso extra y generar empleos. Desde su temprana edad ha sido muy inquieta y emprendedora por lo que hace 5 aos viendo que su mama tena un terreno vio la oportunidad de poner un negocio para generar un ingreso extra y empleos para la gente de su comunidad, instalo un auto-lavado, con el apoyo de su familia ha ido sacando adelante su negocio.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para darle mantenimiento a las herramientas de trabajo y compra otras que le hacen falta.
texts.en:
Marisa started her own business in order to earn extra money, as well as generate employment. From a young age, she has always been very eager and enterprising, which is why 5 years ago, knowing that her mother had a plot of land, she saw a chance to set up her own business so that she could generate an income and employment for the people of her community. She set up a car wash, and with her familys support, she has beed able to help her business move ahead.

She needs a loan of $575.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to give maintenance to her work tools and purchase other equipment that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase work tools

loan.name: Filiberta

texts.es:
Filiberta inicio el negocio para ayudar a su marido con el gasto familiar. Comenz hace aproximadamente 7aos y con los ahorros que tenia, resultante de ventas que hacia por catalogo, decidi poner una mini-tienda en una habitacin de su casa y con el apoyo de los micro crditos ha hecho crecer su tienda lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar ms mercanca en su negocio. Con tu ayuda saldr adelante.
texts.en:
Filiberta started her own business in order to help her husband with the family expenses. She began approximately 7 years ago with the savings that she obtained as a result of her catalog sales. She decided to set up a mini market in her home. With the support of these micro loans, she has been able to make her store grow, which has allowed her to help her children get ahead in life.

She needs a loan of $950.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase more merchandise for her business. With your help, she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase goods

loan.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores inici el negocio porque siempre le ha gustado estar activa, adems de poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos econmicos. Empez su negocio hace 5 aos vendiendo gorditas y tacos en el pasillo de su casa y posteriormente ofreciendo comida entre sus vecinos situacin que empez a darle mejores ganancias.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $125 que pagara en 1 mes para comprar materia prima a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Dolores started her business because she has always liked being active and also to be able to help her husband with household expenses. She started her business 5 years ago selling gorditas (like tacos with thicker shells) and tacos in the corridor of her home, more recently offering food among her neighbors. This situation started to provide her with better income.

She needs a loan of $125 that she will repay in one month to purchase raw material at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of Raw Material

loan.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores inici el negocio ya que necesitaba tener una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos. Comenz hace aproximadamente 15 aos ofreciendo entre sus amistades tortillas que ella hacia a mano y que viendo que el negocio era bueno y prospero solicito un micro crdito y de ah empez a prosperar su negocio.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $650 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y as poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Dolores launched her business because she needed a source of income to support her children. About 15 years ago, she began to offer hand-made tortillas to her friends. After realizing that it would make a good, lucrative business, she asked for a microloan and her business has prospered ever since.

She needs a loan of US $650, which she will use to buy raw ingredients to make tortillas and maintain her business. She will repay the loan in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy ingredients to make tortillas

loan.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel inici el negocio porque requera de ingresos para mantenerse ella y sus padres. Comenz hace 2 aos cuando rento un local, en el cual puso un pequeo estanquillo para vender frituras y refrescos, pero viendo que la gente le solicitaba vveres se decidi a solicitar un micro crdito y con estos hizo crecer y ha mantenido surtida su tienda.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercanca y as resurtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Raquel started her business because she needed income to support herself and her parents. She started 2 years ago when she rented a space where she set up a small table to sell fruits and juices, but noticing people requested groceries she requested a micro credit and her business grew. She needs a loan for $475 to pay in 6 months to buy products and increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde inici el negocio para ayudar a su esposo para que el dinero rindiera lo suficiente para mantener a la familia. su esposo fue el que inicio el negocio de la fabricacin de los tabiques, pero como en ocasiones no tenan para comprar material, el decidi hace 4 aos meterse a trabajar de obrero y la seora Bermdez solicito un micro crdito para continuar con la fabrica logrando levantarla y as hacer de esta actividad una forma de obtener ingresos adicionales.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material y continuar con su labor. Con tu ayuda ella saldr adelante.
texts.en:
Matilde began her business in an effort to help her husband financially support their family. Her husband had originally launched a business building interior partition walls, but since he did not have the money to buy materials at times, he decided to begin a different job as a worker four years ago. Mrs. Bermudz requested a micro-loan to keep the family business going, and was able to turn this activity into an additional source of income.

She needs a loan of US $475 to buy materials so that she can continue with her work. With your help, she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy construction materials

loan.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia inici el negocio para poder apoyar en el estudio de sus hijos, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba. Comenz hace cuatro aos despus que le ayudaba a su hermana a vender haciendo demostraciones, ella le empez a pasar ropa para que la vendiera, y hasta la fecha ella es la que compra y le surte.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para poder surtir mercanca de temporada.
texts.en:
Celia started her business in order to help pay for her children's educations, when her husband's salary wasn't enough. She began helping her sister with wardrobe demonstrations about 4 years ago, and from there, her sister began giving her clothing to sell. Since then, she has been the one who sells it and supplies it.

She needs a loan of $575 US ($1 US = 3 soles, approx.) which she will repay in 6 months so she can stock up on merchandise for the season. Celia inici el negocio para poder apoyar en el estudio de sus hijos, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba. Comenz hace cuatro aos despus que le ayudaba a su hermana a vender haciendo demostraciones, ella le empez a pasar ropa para que la vendiera, y hasta la fecha ella es la que compra y le surte.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para poder surtir mercanca de temporada.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: La Isla Group

texts.es:
Rosario inicia el negocio hace 2 aos vendiendo ropa y zapatos por iniciativa propia, fueron a un viaje Len-Morolen-San Juan de los lagos y surti mercanca para poderla vender y as ayudar con los gastos de la casa, ya que como su esposo nunca ha tenido un trabajo fijo, siempre ha trabajado por su cuenta hay ocasiones en que ella es la que tiene que sacar adelante a su hijo y los gastos de la casa.

Martina inicio el negocio por invitacin de una compaera, ya que su esposo los dejo por irse con otra y ya no se hizo responsable de la casa, y ella sola tuvo que ver de que manera poder cuidar a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante. Comenz su negocio hace 2 aos impulsada por una amiga para que vendiera joyera.

Hortensia inici el negocio por problemas de salud que ella tenia, padeca asma bronquial y a raz de eso se le suba mucho la presin, empez como cliente a consumir producto naturistas y mejoro mucho su salud, hace poco mas de 1 aos se hizo distribuidora independiente para que mas gente pueda aprovechar los beneficios de los productos.

Ellas son el Grupo La Isla y necesitan un prstamo por US $850 que pagaran en 3 meses para poder invertirlo en su negocio comprando mercanca.
texts.en:
Rosario began selling clothing and shoes two years ago on her own initiative. She and her husband took a trip to Len-Morolen-San Juan of Lakes and bought a variety of merchandise to sell to help pay for household expenditures, since Rosario's husband has never had a salaried job and has always worked odd jobs. Sometimes, Rosario is the one who has to work to help her son get ahead and pay for household expenditures.

Martina launched her business at the invitiation of a friend, since her husband left her for another woman and no longer helps support the family. She had to see for herself what the best way to care for her children and help them get ahead would be. She decided to start selling jewelry two years ago with the encouragement of a friend.

Hortensia started her business because of some health problems she was having. She was suffering from broncheal asthma, and her blood pressure went up dramatically as a result. She began taking natural remedies and they greatly improved her health. A little over a year ago, she became an independent distributor of these products so that more people can enjoy the benefits of natural remedies.

The three women make up the La Isla ("The Island") group and are requesting a loan of $850, which they will repay in three months, to buy more merchandise for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy merchandise for individual businesses

loan.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana es la coordinadora del Grupo El Castillo, ella inici el negocio por necesidad ya que era madre soltera y el nico sostn de sus 2 hijos por eso decidi trabajar por su cuenta. Comenz hace un poco ms de 5 aos ayudndole a un familiar con la venta de comida, y ahora ya tiene su propio negocio.

Blanca inici el negocio por necesidad para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares dado que no era suficiente con lo que el ganaba. Comenz hace 6 aos con la venta de ropa de segunda vendiendo solo a amistades pero con el tiempo ha ido incrementando su cartera de clientes y as sus ventas y pedidos.

Rosa inici el negocio para salir adelante dado que no era suficiente con lo que ganaba su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos. Comenz hace 3 aos solo vendiendo ropa sobre pedidos y pequeas demostraciones entre los vecinos y amigas o casa por casa, ahora se estableci en varios mercados incrementando sus ventas.

Ellas necesitan un prstamo por US $1125 que pagaran en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y mercanca y poder as continuar con sus negocios. Con tu apoyo ellas saldrn adelante!!.
texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of the group El Castillo (The Castle). She started the business because of necessity, given that she was a single mother and the only means of support for her two children. For this reason, she decided to work for herself. She started a little more than five years ago helping an acquaintance with food sales, and she now has her own enterprise.

Blanca started in business to help her husband support their household expenses, since his wages were not enough to cover them. She started six years ago selling second-hand clothing only to acquaintances but, over time, she has increased her customer base and therefore her sales and orders.

Rosa started in business to get ahead, given that her husbands earnings were not enough to cover their household and child-related expenses. She started three years ago selling clothing on order, giving small demonstrations at the houses of friends and neighbors or door-to-door. Now, she has established herself in several of the markets and has increased her sales.

These women need a loan of $1,125.00 USD, to be repaid over six months, in order to purchase raw materials and merchandise so they can continue with their endeavors. With your help, they will get ahead!!


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase raw materials and merchandise.

loan.name: Praxadis

texts.es:
Praxadis inicio con este negocio ya que necesitaba dinero para pagar los gastos de la casa y de su familia. Inicio con este negocio desde hace 2 aos vendiendo ropa y regalos en mercados rodantes cercanos a su casa y en su domicilio, y poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio.

El necesita un prstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para invertirlo comprando mas mercanca ya que se acerca una buena temporada
texts.en:
Praxadis started in this business because he needed money to pay his family's household expenses. He started the business two years ago selling clothes and gifts in local travelling markets and in hishome, and little by little he has grown his business.

He needs this loan of $950 which he will repay in 6 months to invest it buying more merchandise now that the good season is coming.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying merchandise

loan.name: Envera

texts.en: Envera M. anovi was born in 1965. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family in M. A.ima near Kalesija. This area is well known as a farming and animal husbandry area. Envera`s husband is employed, but they are also involved in agriculture. They produce feed for cattle and poultry. The cultivation takes them a lot of tiM. because they do everything manually, but they are happy to have their garden and their corn field. Envera has requested a 1200 KM ($900 USD) loan from Women for Women International to buy a cow. The cow will provide them with milk for their children and for selling.

loan.use: To buy a cow

loan.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria luisa inicio con este negocio ya que vive en una avenida principal de su colonia y era un buen punto para iniciar un negocio y ella decidi iniciar con la venta de comidas. Ella necesitaba tener un negocio que le dejara buenos ingresos para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y as darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija. comenz vendiendo en una mesita afuera de su casa aproximadamente hace 15 aos y conforme fue creciendo el negocio las ventas se fueron incrementando y as pudo acondicionar el frente de su casa para establecer su negocio.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar algunos utensilios que le hacen falta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa started her business because she lives on a main avenue in her residential area, so it was a good location for her to get into food sales. She needed to have a business that would bring in good profits so that she could help her husband with the household expenses, thus giving her daughter a better quality of life. She started out by selling food on a little table outside her home approximately 15 years ago. As her business grew, her sales increased; hence she was able to fit out the front of her house in order to properly set up her business.

She needs a loan of $475.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase some kitchen utensils that she needs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase kitchen utensils

loan.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia inici el negocio por iniciativa propia, salir adelante en la economa de su hogar y ayuda a esposo con gastos de escuela y manutencin ya que el sale de viaje y para no estar esperanzada a que le deposite dinero, busco una actividad que le generara ingresos. Comenz hace 1 ao cuando una hermana la canalizo con una distribuidora de cosmticos y la dio de alta, entonces ella empez a vender estos productos.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un kit de la nueva temporada y poder as ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Katia took the initiative to launch her business so that she could help her husband pay for household expenses and to help improve the family's economic situation. Her husband travels frequently, and Katia wanted to find her own source of income so that she wasn't constantly waiting for him to deposit money. Katia began her business a year ago, when her sister introduced her to a cosmetics distributor who supplied her with merchandise, which she then began to sell.

Katia needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in three months, to buy this season's cosmetics kit and start selling these new products.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy this season's cosmetics

loan.name: Gloria Irma

texts.es:
Gloria inici el negocio por que esta separada de su esposo y no le gusta esperarse a que le den la pensin ya que tiene necesidades con su hijo y necesita atencin especial ya que presenta parlisis cerebral. Esto fue lo que la orillo a vender ropa y zapatos con sus familiares y amigos de la colonia desde hace mas de 28 aos.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $575 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar de zapatos de temporada de otoo-invierno.
texts.en:
Gloria launched her business because she is separated from her husband and doesn't like to rely on her pension since she has to provide for her son, who needs special attention because he has cerebral palsy. This is what drove her to begin selling clothing and shoes with her friends and relatives more than 28 years ago.

Gloria needs a loan of US $575 to buy shoes for the fall/winter season. She will repay the loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy fall/winter shoes

loan.name: San Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita inici el negocio porque su hijo estaba estudiando la universidad y no tenia para pagar las cuotas escolares adems de gastos del hogar, ya que es viuda. Comenz hace mas de 6 aos elaborando y vendiendo tamales y tacos a vapor en su casa a sus vecinos y conocidos, hasta que logro hacerse de clientela.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima ya que tiene un pedido especial y necesita surtir los ingredientes para este.
texts.en:
Juanita started the business because her son was studying in university and she didn't have money to pay tuition as well as the household expenses now that she is a widow. She started more than six years ago making tacos and tamales in her house and selling them to neighbors and acquaintances, until she was able to build a clientele.

She needs a loan of $750 which she will repay in 6 months to buy material now that she has a special order and she needs to get the ingredients for this.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying materials

loan.name: San Juana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Juany inici el negocio porque lo que gana su esposo no le alcanza ya que trabaja como soldador y tiene ingresos variables, ante la necesidad de pagar recibos de servicios y manutencin de sus hijos. Comenz hace ms de 3 aos vendiendo productos naturales entre vecinos y familiares, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercanca en general. Con tu apoyo ella saldr adelante.
texts.en:
Juany started the business because what her her husband makes wasn't enough, since her husband works as a soldier and has variabl wages, to meet the need to pay their bills and raise their children. She started selling natural groceries to her neighbors and families 3 years ago, which has permitted her to move forward. She needs a $250 loan which she will pay in three months to buy general merchandise. With your support, she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying merchandise

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase of ingredients to produce sweets and arepas for her clients.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase of materials for a small motorcycle tire shop.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To invest in cosmetics products for her small business.

loan.name: Roxana Gloria

texts.es: La seora Roxana, trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, ambos, se dedican a la fabricacin de zapatos de todo tipo, pero ms especficamente se dedican a la fabricacin de zapatos para nios, que a su vez venden en uno de los mercados ms populares de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia. En todo el tiempo que la conocemos ha demostrado ser una perona muy trabajadora, que adems se ocupa de sus dos nios que an estn en edad escolar. se trata de una cliente con un ecxelente Historial Crediticio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Roxana works with her husband and together they manufacture shoes of all sorts, but mainly they produce shoes for kids, which they sell to one of the most popular markets in La Paz, Bolivia. As long as we know her, she has demonstrated to be a hard worker, she also takes care of her two children who are in school. She is a client with great credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase working capital

loan.name: Sante Se Riches Group

texts.en:
"Sante Se Riches" is a group of 15 members coming from one of the poorest countries in the world - Haiti. Every member in this group is desperate to change their lives, and have come into this with absolutely nothing.
Pauline F. is the group representative, and wants to start her very own business selling fish. Pauline is a very determined mother of three young children, and wants to change the lives of those children, and also the lives of her future grandchildren. Her only dream is to improve the life of her children. She believes that starting this business is the first step to reaching that goal.
On behalf of Pauline, the group, and Esperanza International---- We thank you for your support!!

loan.use: Fish Vendor

loan.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna D., 39 ans, marie avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkan Viviane Wade depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des graines darachide pour les transformer en pte darachide et vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Elle sollicite un prt qui sera rembours au bout de six mois en une seule chance.<b/>
texts.en:
Maimouna D., age 39, is married and has five children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkan Viviane Wade for six years. She wants to buy peanuts to make into peanut butter to sell. Her income enables her to help with family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To sell peanut butter

loan.name: Miguel Aparicio

texts.es:
Miguel tiene una empresa de serigrafa llamada Maranatha desde hace 9 aos, l se dedica a hacer todo tipo de articulos de publicidad en serigragia como lo son: tazas, llaveros, impresin de lapiceros, camisas y uniformes escolares, deportivos. El es casado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos estn estudiando. Su esposa ademas de las labores de cuidado y atencion de su casa, le ayuda en la atencin y administracion del negocio. El prstamo l lo necesita para comprar materia prima como lo es telas y otros materiales para impresiones, ya que en esta poca hay muchos pedidos.
Su deseo es hacer cada da ms grande su empresa, y brindarle a toda su familia la proteccin econmica y apoyo que ellos necesitan.

loan.use: Compra de materiales para su empresa de serigrafia, como telas y otra materia prima,

loan.name: Miguel Aparicio

texts.es: Miguel tiene una empresa de serigrafa llamada Maranatha desde hace 9 aos, l se dedica a hacer todo tipo de articulos de publicidad en serigragia como lo son: tazas, llaveros, impresin de lapiceros, camisas y uniformes escolares, deportivos. El es casado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos estn estudiando. Su esposa ademas de las labores de cuidado y atencion de su casa, le ayuda en la atencin y administracion del negocio. El prstamo l lo necesita para comprar materia prima como lo es telas y otros materiales para impresiones, ya que en esta poca hay muchos pedidos. Su deseo es hacer cada da ms grande su empresa, y brindarle a toda su familia la proteccin econmica y apoyo que ellos necesitan.

loan.use: Compra de materiales para su empresa de serigrafia, como telas y otra materia prima,

loan.name: Miguel Aparicio

texts.es: Miguel tiene una empresa de serigrafa llamada Maranatha desde hace 9 aos, l se dedica a hacer todo tipo de articulos de publicidad en serigrafia como lo son: tazas, llaveros, impresin de lapiceros, camisas y uniformes escolares, deportivos. El es casado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos estn estudiando. Su esposa ademas de las labores de cuidado y atencion de su casa, le ayuda en la atencin y administracion del negocio. El prstamo l lo necesita para comprar materia prima como lo es telas y otros materiales para impresiones, ya que en esta poca hay muchos pedidos. Su deseo es hacer cada da ms grande su empresa, y brindarle a toda su familia la proteccin econmica y apoyo que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
Miguel has a printing business called Maranatha for the last 9 years, he creates all type of advertising articles like: cups, key-rings, pens, t-shirts, school and sport uniforms. He is married, has 3 children, two of them are in school. His wife besides taking care of the children and their house, helps him attending and managing the business. He needs the loan to buy material like cloths and printing materials, because there is high demand this season. His wish is to grow his business and provide his family all the economic support they need.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy materials for his printing business like cloths and printing materials

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy clothing to sell

loan.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama D. is 45 year old. She is divorced and the mother of six children. She is a local manufacturer of soaps. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods, and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She also sells palm oil for cooking. She is not able to produce soap in large quantities because of the lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to improve her income so she can support her childrens education. She belongs to the community group called St. John Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loan.use: To purchase raw materials

loan.name: Vinicio Policarpio

texts.es: Vinicio en la actualidad es encargado de produccin de una empresa de serigrafa, desde hace mas de 2 aos l se dedica a la fabricacion de toda clase de playeras y trabajos de impresin en serigrafia. Con la experiencia y conocimiento que l tiene, ahora l quiere poner su propio negocio de serigrafa y por eso necesita el prstamo. El esta dispuesto a trabajar duro y seguir luchando por la vida. Su sueo es seguir estudiando en la universidad y llegar a convertirse en un profesional de xito. En la actualidad l esta soltero, pero es una persona muy formal y responsable.
texts.en:
Vinicio is currently in charge of production at a printing company, for the last 2 years he had worked creating t-shirts other printing materials. With his experience and knowledge he wants to set up his own printing business so he needs a loan. He is willing to work hard to progress. His dream is to go to College and turn into a successful professional. He is currently single but is a very formal and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To start a printing business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase of meat and fruits for her small business.

loan.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail K., 38, is married and has two children. She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets, and plates. She makes her sales by 'hawking,' which is door-to-door sales. Abigail is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to build a shop to house her goods. She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets.
She is a member of the community group called Judah Trust Group. In this group, the members assist one another to guarantee repayment of the loans. This photograph was taken after a group meeting.

loan.use: To buy additional items to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To invest in shoes and pants for her small business.

loan.name: Axel Leonardo

texts.es: Axel Leonardo tiene un pequeo negocio de veterinaria que se llama El Arca de Noe. Tiene ms de 1 ao de haber iniciado este negocio. Tambin se dedica a brindar sus servicios como tcnico en el cuidado y atencin de animales, para lo cual l hace visitas a sus clientes. El prstamo l lo necesita para poder tener mas mercadera en su negocio, como lo son alimentos de animales, medicinas y todo lo que se necesita para el cuidado de animales, tambin con el prstamo l quiere ampliar su local. El esta muy conciente que con este negocio es presta un importante servicio a su comunidad. En la actualidad l es soltero, y su sueo es tener mejores ingresos para poder seguir estudiando la carrera de Ingeniero Agrnomo en la Universidad. El cree que en Guatemala se puede desarrollar como persona y como profesional.
texts.en:
Axel Leonardo has a small veterinary clinic called "El Arca de Noe" ("Noah's Ark") which he opened more than a year ago. He also makes house calls as a veterinary technician to attend and care for animals. He needs this loan to offer more merchandise at his business, such as pet food, medicine and everything else that is necessary to care for animals. He would also like to use the loan to expand his business. He is very conscious of the fact that with this business, he is offering an important service to his community. He is currently single, and his dream is to earn more so that he can continue to study agronomy at the university. He believes that in Guatemala, he can develop as a person and as a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Expand veterinary clinic, buy pet food and medicine

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To aquire a larger stock of clothing to sell in her community

loan.name: Haggai

texts.en:
For the past eight years, Haggai B. has been trading in the local market of Obuasi in Ghana. She is 54 years old, married, and has eight children. Four of them are currently on their own and the other four are in school. She is a busy petty trader who sells palm kernel oil, vegetable oil, tin tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, and so forth in the local market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run her business. The loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She says she is grateful for your assistance.
Haggai is a member of the group called Glory. Members agree to guarantee repayment of loans for one another.

loan.use: To purchase products to sell

loan.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys O. is 37 years old. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks such as Coca Cola, Pepsi, Malta, etc. in the local market of Obuasi, Ghana. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of canned foods and drinks, milk, etc. to expand her business.
Gladys hopes to make good income from the expanded business to enable her to provide support in taking care of her children.
She belongs to the community group called Glory Trust Group. The group guarantees a loan through a repayment pledge.

loan.use: She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of canned foods and drinks, milk, etc.

loan.name: Dora Elia

texts.es:
DORA ELIA G. S. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.
LA SEORA DORA ELIA ES UNA PERSONA DE RAICES INTEGRAS, CON DESEOS DE SUPERACION, ELLA PERCIBE UN INGRESO MENSUAL MEDIANTE SU PENSION Y A PESAR DE QUE ES UNA PERSONA GRANDE DE EDAD SIGUE TRABAJANDO PARA UNA FAMILIA CUIDANDO A UNAS PERSONAS ADULTAS ENFERMAS, ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA CONSTRUIR UNA BARDA Y PONER UNA CERCA EN SU CASA YA QUE CON ESTO SENTIRA MAS SEGURIDAD PARA ELLA YA QUE VIVE SOLA.
texts.en:
DORA ELIA G. S. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. Dora Elia is a person of integrity with a great desire to get ahead.
