She receives monthly income from her pension and, despite the fact that she is now of advanced age, she continues working for a family by taking care of some adults who are sick. She is seeking this loan to continue construction on a wall, and also to add a gate in her house since with this she will feel more secure as she lives alone.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Construction of a wall and adding a fence for more security.

loan.name: Susana

texts.es:
The communal bank "Vigrencita del Carmen de Huychu" was founded in September of 2002 and is currently in its sixth cycle. It is made up of 12 female clients.

This is a communal bank that was formed by members that live in the district of Guayllabamba in the community of Huychu, which is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, 50 minutes away from the city of Cuzco

The clients are female villagers dedicated mainly to agricultural work (cultivating corn, potato and other vegetables and raising small farm animals). The majority of the clients combine their agricultural work with commercial businesses (selling agricultural products and small farm animals) selling their products in local markets in small cities and as traveling salespersons in surrounding cities.

One aspect of the program that the clients appreciate is that Arariwa gives them the possibility to access credit, teaches them a culture of savings, and gives them monthly trainings.

Translated by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

El banco comunal VIRGENCITA DEL CARMEN DE HUYCHU, se fundo en septiembre del 2002, actualmente se encuentra en el VI ciclo, esta conformada por 12 socias mujeres. Es un banco comunal conformado por socias que viven en el distrito de Guayllabamba, comunidad de Huychu, ubicado en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Las socias son mujeres campesinas dedicadas a labores agrcolas principalmente (cultivos de maz, papa y hortalizas, crianza de animales menores), la mayoria de las socias combinan las actividades agrcolas, con las comerciales (venta de productos agrcolas y animales menores) realizando las transacciones en las ferias locales de los centros poblados y comunidades aledaas como vendedoras ambulantes.

A decir de las socias, un aspecto importante que resaltan del servicio que la UMF. Arariwa les brinda es haberles dado por primera vez la oportunidad de acceder a un crdito, les ensean a tener cultura de ahorro y reciben capacitaciones mensualmente.

loan.use: The clients use the loan to promote their agricultural and secondary commercial activities / Las socias utilizan el prestamo para la principal actividad la Agricola y actividades secundarias comercio.

loan.name: Antonieta

texts.es: Antonieta tiene 42 aos de edad, es casada y tiene 8 hijos de diferentes edades y nivel de estudios. Anteriormente se dedicaba solo a los oficios domsticos, y acompaaba a su esposo en la actividades agrcolas, viendo ella la dificultad de que con los ingresos del esposo no le alcanzaba para cubrir todos los gastos de la familia, logro tener una pequea crianza y venta de pollos, esto le ha ayudado a darles educacin a sus hijos. Tambin ha criado marranos, y tambin cuenta con una vaca lechera. Adems aprovecha esto para hacer queso, y los fines de semana hace y vende tamales, atol y comida. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora, hasta su esposo la admira y aprecia por el xito que ha tenido en sus negocios. Ella no tiene estudios acadmicos, pero se ha superado gracias a su esfuerzo y que tambin ha aprovechado todas las oportunidades que ha tenido. Con su prstamo ella quiere invertir en la compra de marranos y en el alimento, es una actividad que le puede dejar muy buenas ganancias. Su sueo es ver a todos sus hijos como profesionales con un buen estudio, que logren terminar sus carreras, y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Antonieta is 42 years old, married, and has eight children of different ages and educational levels. Previously, she focused only on domestic duties and accompanied her husband with agricultural activities. Seeing the difficulty her husband had covering the family's expenses with his income, she started a small breeding business and selling chickens. This has helped to provide her children with an education. She has also bred pigs and has a dairy cow, which she uses to make cheese. She also makes and sells tamales, atol (a beverage made from corn flour), and meals. She is a very enterprising person and her husband admires and appreciates the success she has had with her businesses.

She doesn't have any formal education, but she has succeeded thanks to her effort. She has also taken advantage of all of the opportunities that she has had. With this loan, she wants to invest in pigs and feed, which will provide her with very good earnings. Her dream is to see that her children have a good education, become professionals with successful careers, and are good people.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase 12 pigs for breeding and sale and feed for the pigs.

loan.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen tiene 49 aos. Ella actualmente se dedica a la venta de juguetera para fiestas infantiles, negocio al cual le dedica mucho tiempo, ya que es la nica actividad que le produce ingresos. Carmen cuenta que tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar. A ella le preocupa la futura educacin de sus hijos. Ella quisiera expandir su negocio, para lo cual necesita un pequeo capital que le permita comprar en mayor volumen los productos que vende y tener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen is 49 years old. She sells children's party toys and supplies and dedicates a lot of time to it as it's the only source of income she has. Carmen has two school-aged children and worries about their future education. She'd like to expand her business and needs some capital to be able to increase the volume of product that she sells and have an increased margin of gains.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy products in order to increase stock

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy tiene 20 aos. Actualmente estudia obstetricia. Hace unos aos aprendi de su mam a trabajar el cuero. En su tiempo libre, ella elabora carteras y monederos, los cuales vende a sus compaeros y conocidos de la universidad en la que estudia. El crdito que anteriormente recibi Cindy lo emple en comprar materiales para seguir produciendo sus carteras y monederos. A ella le gustara continuar con su pequeo negocio e incrementar su produccin para lo cual necesita un pequeo capital para adquirir materiales.
texts.en:
Cindy is 20 years old. She is studying obstetrics. A few years ago she learnt from her mother how to make crafts with leather. In her free time, she makes purses and wallets, and she sells them to her friends and acquaintances at the university. Cindy used a previous loan to buy raw materials so that she could continue making purses and wallets. She would like to continue with her small business and increase her production, and that is the reason why she needs capital to buy raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy raw materials to make leather purses and wallets.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Mara Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mara tiene 54 aos. Ella es una persona que se dedica ntegramente a trabajar. Ella labora en una fbrica de cueros, donde proporciona alimentos a los trabajadores. Ademas por las noches se dedica a cuidar a personas de edad avanzada. Asimismo, trabaja manualmente el cuero, produciendo carteras y monederos.
A Mara le gustara seguir con sus actividades laborales, pero tambin le gustara tener una bodega en su casa, para lo cual necesita un pequeo capital para comprar los productos que en un futuro vender.
texts.en:
Mara is 54 years of age. She is someone who is fully devoted to working. She works in a leather factory where she provides food to the workers. Also, at nights, she works by taking care of the elderly. Also, she works with leather by hand, making wallets and coin purses.

Mara would like to continue in her work activities, but also would like to have a store in her home. For this she needs a little capital to buy the products that she will sell in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Acquire products to have in a store

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Hilario De Jess

texts.es:
El seor Hilario M. se caracteriza por ser muy esforzado ya que se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria fuente por el cual alimenta a su pequeo hijo y a su esposa.

El seor M. especficamente se dedica a la produccin de ganado lechero y la produccin de granos bsicos. Hoy en da la necesidad que l atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir el recurso financiero para la compra de vaquillas para su respectiva crianza y adems para la inversin en el cultivo. Por esta razn es que l acude a Ceprodel para obtener un crdito y de esta manera salir adelante en su actividad econmica y continuar brindndole el apoyo a su amada familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Hilario M. is a very hard worker engaged in farming activities, which is how he provides for his young son and his wife.

Mr. M. specifically raises dairy cattle and grows basic grains. Currently, he urgently needs financing to purchase heifers and to invest in his crops. For this reason, he has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to proceed with his farming activities and continue supporting his beloved family.


Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase dairy cows and invest in crops.

loan.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El caballero Ignacio V. se dedica desde que era un nio a la actividad agropecuaria dedicndose a la produccin de ganado lechero y a la produccin de granos bsicos y de oleaginosas. Es originario del municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega donde habita junto con su cnyuge y con sus dos pequeos hijitos en edad escolar.

Hoy en da ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crdito que le permita la compra de insumos para la siembra de ajonjol. Por esta razn espera que su crdito le sea otorgado y as continuar con su actividad econmica y continuar manteniendo a su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Caballero Ignacio V. has worked since he was a boy in agriculture, in the production of cows milk and staple grains and oils. His is originally from the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega where he lives with his partner and their two little, school-age children.

Today, he has turned to Ceprodel to get a loan that will allow him to purchase supplies for the sowing of sesame. For this reason he hopes that his is granted the loan to continue with his work and to support his family that so needs his support.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The Purchase of Supplies for Sowing

loan.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
El seor Jos Santos Ordoez desde muy jovencito se ha dedicado al negocio agropecuario en el municipio de Somotillo perteneciente a la ciudad de Chinandega. Por medio de esta actividad logra mantener a su familia brindndole a su pequeo hijo los estudios que se merece.

El motivo por el cual hoy en da ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crdito con el cual comprar las herramientas necesarias para la construccin de una cerca y de igual manera para brindarle asistencia tcnica a sus cultivos. Muy confiadamente espera en Ceprodel sabiendo que su crdito ser otorgado y as lograr construir la cerca para su actividad agropecuaria.
texts.en:
Seor Jos Santos Ordoez, since he was very young, has worked in agriculture in the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. By way of this work, he succeeds in supporting his family, providing his little boy with the studies he deserves.

The reason that he is turning to Ceprodel today is to get a loan with which to buy needed tools for the construction of a fence and also to provide technological assistance to his crops. He trusts that he will be given a loan and that way he will succeed in building the fence for his agricultural work.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Construction of a Fence for his Agricultural Work

loan.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo M. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de Chinandega especficamente del municipio de Somotillo. Es padre de cuatro pequeos hijos siendo ellos la razn por la cual se esfuerza grandemente en su actividad para suplir sus necesidades.

El seor M. hoy en da ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de obtener el capital financiero para la compra de terneros de desarrollo y adems para invertir en sus cultivos. Es de importancia destacar que por medio de este crdito se beneficia tanto l como su familia. Actualmente se ha mantenido como fiel cliente de Ceprodel y son sus sueos mejorar su actividad econmica.
texts.en:
Reinaldo M. is from the city of Chinandega, specifically from the municipality of Somotillo. He is the father of four little children who are the reason why he works so hard to furnish what they need.

Seor M. today has turned to Ceprodel with the goal of getting financial capital to buy calves to raise and also to invest in his crops. It is important to emphasize that, by means of this loan, his family benefits as much as he does. Now he has become a loyal client of Ceprodel and his dreams are to improve his work.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The Purchase of Calves to Raise

loan.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 47 aos. Ella tiene una bodega en su casa, lo que a ella le favorece, ya que tiene que cuidar a sus dos pequeos hijos. En su tienda ofrece gran variedad de productos. Nelly cuenta que hace algn tiempo se malogr la congeladora que ella tena en su tienda y que le permita vender bebidas heladas. A ella le gustara recibir un crdito para poder financiar la compra de su congeladora.
texts.en:
Nelly is 47 years old. She has a shop in her home which she prefers now that she has to take care of her two little children. In her shop, she offers a great variety of products.

Nelly says that it has been some time since the freezer in her shop that had allowed her to sell chilled drinks broke down. She would like to receive a loan to be able to finance the purchase of a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The Purchase of a Freezer for her Shop

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Aracely es una persona que inicio con venta de joyera y sobresali con venta de batera de cocina, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de sus 2 pequeos hijos de 5 aos y 9 meses. Ella ha logrado hacerse de clientes y ha mejorado sus ventas, lo que le ha permitido ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $325 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercanca. Con tu ayuda ella saldr adelante.
texts.en:
Aracely is someone who started with the sale of jewelry and stood out in the sale of cookware sets to support her husband with the household expenses and those of her two young children, a five year-old and 9 month-old. She has succeeded in bringing in customers and has improved her sales which has allowed her to offer a better quality of life to her children.

She needs a loan of $325 that she will repay in 6 months to buy merchandise. With your help, she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The Purchase of Merchandise

loan.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, el caballero Roberto S. con gran ahnco se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria la cual desde hace varios aos la ejerce con el fin de mantener su humilde hogar de habitacin.

Los sueos del seor Roberto S. son mejorar su condicin de vida por medio de la mejora de su actividad agropecuaria. Por este motivo es que contina apoyndose de los crditos brindados por Ceprodel para as brindarle una mejor condicin de vida a su familia y mejorar las condiciones de su actividad econmica agropecuaria. El destino del crdito el cual solicita es para asistencia en los cultivos y para la compra de terneros para su respectivo desarrollo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Caballero Roberto S., with great devotion, works in agriculture which he has done for many years. He does this work with the goal of keeping his humble home.

Roberto S.s dreams are to improve the quality of life by improving his agricultural work. For this reason, he continues to rely on the loans provided by Ceprodel so that he can provide a better quality of life to his family and to improve the quality of his farming. The loan he requests will be used to tend to his crops and for the purchase of calves to raise.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Tending to Crops and the Purchase of Cattle

loan.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto inici el negocio ya que anteriormente era empleado repartidor de una empresa se sali para distribuirle producto a una panadera que actualmente ya cerro, por esta razn comenz su negocio hace 4 aos y actualmente distribuye apasteladas, galleta fina y polvorn, directamente a una panadera; un amigo le presta el carro para llevar la mercanca y le paga la gasolina que le gasta, con la desventaja de que esta limitado a cierto horario.

El necesita un prstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir una camioneta usada la cual le servir para la distribucin de su producto, y tener la facilidad de poder adquirir mas clientes ya que el vehculo que utilizara ser propio.
texts.en:
Humberto started the business after leaving his previous job as a delivery man for another enterprise to distribute products to a bakery that is now closed. For this reason, he started his business four years ago and he currently distributes sweets, cookies and shortbreads directly to a bakery. A friend of his lends him a car to use to deliver his merchandise, for which he reimburses him for the gas he uses. This has a disadvantage in that it limits him to a certain schedule.

He needs a loan of $575 USD, to be repaid in six months, to buy a used truck with which to distribute his merchandise. This will provide a great deal of relief in that he can attract more customers, since the vehicle would be his own.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of a small truck.

loan.name: Elisea

texts.es:
Elisea tiene 50 aos. Ella se dedica desde hace algunos aos a vender desayunos, para lo cual visita muy temprano por las maanas a sus vecinas que le compran lo que ella prepara.
Elisea tiene 3 hijos, uno de los cuales an asiste al colegio, adems ya esta por terminar la secundaria. Elisea comenta que su hijo desea estudiar en la universidad, cosa que a ella le enorgullece, pero le preocupa por los fuertes gastos que eso implica.
El crdito que anteriormente recibi Elisea, le servio para poner un negocio ambulante de venta de ropa, sin embargo ella quisiera poner una jugueria en su casa, para lo cual necesita un pequeo capital para empezar con su proyecto.
texts.en:
Elisea is 50 years old. Since a few years, she prepares breakfast which she then sells to her neighbors during her daily early morning visits. Elisea has three sons; one of them still goes to school and will soon finish junior high school. Elisa says her son would like to go to the University and she is very proud of it; however, she is worried about the expenses this would represent. Elisea had already taken a credit once and she used it to start a little business selling clothes as a street vendor. Now, she would like to sell juices at her house, so she requests a small amount of capital in order to start her project.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Empezar un negocio de venta de jugos y pasteles.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Santos Henry

texts.es:
El seor Santos Henry Parecedes desde hace varios aos con mucho esfuerzo se ha dedicado a su actividad econmica como lo es la agropecuaria la cual ejerce en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. A pesar de la difcil situacin econmica que ha atravesado ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar y brindarles los estudios a sus tres hijos pequeos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo.

Para desarrollar su actividad econmica el seor Parecedes ha hecho uso de los crditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha utilizado para la asistencia tcnica en los cultivos. Una vez ms busca el apoyo crediticio en Ceprodel para obtener el recurso econmico para invertir en sus cultivos para luego levantar su cosecha y as poder subsistir junto con su familia.
texts.en:
For the past several years, Mr. Santos Henry Parecedes has put much effort into his agricultural activities in the town of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. Despite the difficult economic situation that he has gone through, he has managed to support his family and provide an education for his three small children who so desperately need his support.

To develop his business, Mr. Parecedes has made use of loans provided by Ceprodel, which he has used toward technical assistance for his crops. Once again, he seeks loan support from Ceprodel to invest in his crops, later raise his harvest, and survive along with his family.


Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To invest in crops.

loan.name: Ogla

texts.es:
La seora Ogla S. es una dama digna de imitar por ser muy trabajadora ya que se ha destacado en su actividad agrcola dedicndose a esta desde muy jovencita en el municipio de Somotillo de Chinandega.

Como toda actividad en desarrollo necesita de inversin, la actividad Agrcola de la seora Ogla necesita de inversin en la siembra y es por este motivo que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crdito con el cual poder comprar insumos para la siembra y as lograr una buena cosecha para continuar con el sustento de su hogar compuesta por ella y su amada familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ogla S. is a hard-working woman worthy of being emulated. She has excelled at agricultural work and has dedicated herself to this since she was a very young girl in the town of Somotillo in Chinandega.

Like any growing business in need of investment, Olga's agricultural business needs investment for the planting season; therefore she has sought the support of Ceprodel to obtain a loan to buy farming supplies and thus ensure a good harvest to support her household, which consists of herself and her beloved family.


Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase farming supplies.

loan.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina inicio el negocio ya que tena tiempo libre y deseaba aprovecharlo en alguna actividad, y como siempre le han gustado las ventas, una e a una amiga le recomendando ayudarle a vender cosmticos, ella acepto y tiempo despus se independizo ya que tenia sus clientes y le era mas rentable hacer sus propias ventas.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $325 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercanca y tener otros productos que ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo ella saldr adelante.
texts.en:
Marcelina started her business in her spare time after wanting to take advantage of the opportunity to start something. And as she has always liked sales and her friends encouraged her to do so, she started to sell cosmetics. Some time after she started she made herself independed given that she had a client base and it was better business to conduct her own sales.

She requires a loan in the amount of $325 US, which will be returned in a term of 3 months. The funds will be used to purchase merchandise and have other products to offer her clients. With your support she will continue to enjoy her success.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase merchandise.

loan.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 49 aos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. golosinas en un puesto ambulante, que ubica en la puerta D. un colegio D. su localidad. Ella va tres veces al da a vender sus golosinas, por las maanas, por las tarD. y por las noches.
El ltimo crdito que Carmen recibi le ayudo a comprar productos para surtir su negocio ambulante. Sin embargo, ella cuenta que el negocio D. venta D. golosinas no es muy rentable, por lo que a ella le gustara poner una tienda D. abarrotes, para as tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 49 years old. She is a street vendor and has a stand outsiD. a school in the area where she lives. She goes three times each day to sell her sweets: one in the morning, once in the afternoon and once at night.

The last loan that Carmen took out helped her buy a wider variety of products to stock her stand with. Still, she tells us that selling sweets is not very lucrative, so she would like to set up a dry goods store instead to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Launch a dry goods store

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel empez vendiendo cosmeticos primero porque necesitaba un ingreso extra ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no le alcanzaba, y si trabajaba en una empresa no podria pasar tiempo con su familia, por eso empez a dedicarse a trabajar por su cuenta, y poco a poco logro resultados positivos obteniendo buenas ganancias de sus ventas.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante.
texts.en:
Isable started selling cosmetics because she needed the extra income and because her husband's income was not enough to cover everything. And if she were to work for a company she would not be able to pass time with her family, which is why she started to work on her own account. Slowly she started to see positive results and she was seeing good earnings with her sales.

She requires a loan in the amount of $950 US which will be repaid in a term of 6 months. She will use thse funds to purchase merchandise. With your support she will continue to enjoy her success.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: comprar mercancia

loan.name: Cinthia Gabriela

texts.es:
Cinthia siempre ha estado trabajando por su cuenta ya que no le gusta estar sometida a un jefe y tener un horario establecido, ante la necesidad de salir adelante con su hija y que no le faltara nada, ya que ella es divorciada, fue que decidi emprender su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, actividad que le ha permitido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $1125 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercanca. Con tu ayuda ella podr continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Cinthia has always worked for herself as she doesnt like to be subject to a boss and have a fixed schedule. In order to ensure her daughters future and make sure her needs are met, as Cinthia is divorced she decided to start her own business selling clothing, a profession that has enabled her to be successful. She needs a loan for US $1125, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help she will be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy clothing

loan.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 18 aos. Ella actualmente estudia con miras a ingresar a la universidad. En su tiempo libre ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a la preparacin de bombones de chocolate.
Para mantener su negocio, Raquel necesariamente tiene que vender sus productos a crdito, lo cual hace muy lento el crecimiento de su negocio y algunas veces hasta le provoca deudas.
El ltimo crdito que recibi Raquel lo emple en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, as mismo ella cuenta que le gustara ampliar su negocio, para lo cual necesita un capital mayor para trabajar.
texts.en:
Raquel is 18 years old. Currently, she is studying for her college entrance exams. In her spare time, she sells beauty products and prepares chocolates. To maintain her business, Raquel needs to sell her products on credit, which slows business growth and occasionally leads to debts. Raquel used the last credit that she received toward her beauty products business. She would like to expand her business, but requires a greater financial investment to do so.


Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To increase her stock of beauty products.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrin tiene 39 aos. l tiene un taller en su casa donde se dedica a fabricar instrumentos musicales de viento, como flautas y zampoas, desde hace ms de 10 aos, con la ayuda de su esposa y de un empleado.
Antes, Adrin, tena una tienda donde venda sus instrumentos musicales, pero por falta de dinero tuvo que cerrarla. Ahora slo trabaja a pedido. Adrin cuenta que le gustara continuar con su taller. El necesita un crdito que le permita seguir comprando materiales para continuar su produccin.
texts.en:
Adrin is 39 years old. For more than 10 years, he has a workshop in his house where he makes wind instruments, like flutes and zampoas (traditional Andean flutes). He has one employee, and his wife also helps him out with this business. Before, Adrin had a store where he sold musical instruments, but because of a lack of income, he had to close the store. Adrin tells us that he would like to keep his workshop running. He needs this loan to buy more materials, so that he can continue to make wind instruments.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy materials to make wind instruments

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola tiene 50 aos. Por las noches tiene un negocio ambulante de comida , por las maanas se dedica a diversas labores, como lavar ropa o limpiar casas. Adicionalmente ella alquila los cuartos de su vivienda. El ltimo crdito que Lola recibi, le ayudo con su negocio ambulante de comida. A ella le gustara continuar con su negocio de comida, adems ella quiere terminar la construccin de su casa para poder alquilar ms cuartos y asegurar un ingreso fijo mensual.
texts.en:
Lola is 50 years old. She works as a food vendor at night, and during the day she does different kinds of work, like washing clothes or cleaning houses. She also rents out the rooms of her house. Lola used the last loan she received to help her food vending busness.

She would like to keep her food business up and running, and also wants to finish construction on her house so that she can rent out more rooms and secure a fixed monthly income.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Home construction to increase rental income

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 27 aos. Hace algn tiempo ella empez un pequeo negocio de bordados artesanales. Ahora, ella trabaja en su pequeo taller que logr implementar gracias a los crditos que recibi. Sin embargo ella cuenta que le gustara comprar una mquina de coser para poder incrementar su produccin y poder contratar una empleada que le ayude con el trabajo.
texts.en:
Raquel is 27 years old. Some time ago she began a small handmade embroidery business. Now, she works in her small workshop that she successfully started thanks to the loans that she received. However, she now would like to buy a sewing machine to increase her production and hire an employee who can help her with her work.


Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 60 aos. Ella tiene un negocio familiar, junto a sus 3 hijas. Se dedican al bordado computarizado en su taller que funciona en su vivienda. Actualmente el negocio de mercedes tiene gran produccin gracias a la maquina de coser industrial que lograron adquirir con los crditos que recibi anteriormente.
Mercedes cuenta que desea incrementar su produccin y hacer crecer su negocio. Ella requiere un crdito para comprar materiales que necesita para trabajar.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 60 years of age. She has a family business with her three daughters. They do computerized embroidery in their shop which is in their home.

Currently, Mercedes's business has great production thanks to the industrial sewing machine they succeeded in buying with the previous loans she has received.

Mercedes reports that she wants to increase production and make her business grow. She needs a loan to buy materials that she needs to work.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase materials for her textile business

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Luz Morayma

texts.es: Luz tiene 29 aos, es casada y tiene un pequeo hijo. Ella es parte de un negocio familiar que tiene con su madre y hermanas. Ellas se dedican al bordado textil y produccin de prendas de vestir. El crdito que luz recibi anteriormente lo emple en la compra de material textil. Ella cuenta que desea incrementar la produccin de su taller, para lo cual necesita comprar otra maquina de coser industrial.
texts.en:
Luz is 29 years old, is married and has a little boy. She is makes part of a family business that she shares with her mother and her sisters. They all work at making needlepoint design and produce articles of clothing.

'The loans Luz has received in the past have been used to purchase textiles.

She says that she wants to increase the production in their shop, for which she needs to purchase another industrial sewing machine.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase an industrial sewing machine.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Yovana Elizabeth

texts.es: Yovana tiene 32 aos. Desde hace siete aos ella administra su taller de fabricacin de accesorios de grifera. El esposo de Yovana trabaja manejando un mototaxi desde hace tres aos. Con su trabajo duro ellos aseguran los ingresos mensuales que les permiten mantener a sus tres hijos. Sin embargo, Yonvana cuenta que hace algunos meses el mototaxi de su esposo tiene problemas mecnicos. Yovana necesita un capital para comprar materiales, como el bronce, para su taller de grifera, adems para apoyar a su esposo con la reparacin de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Yovana is 32 years of age. For seven years she has run a shop where she makes accessories for faucets. Yovana's husband has worked driving a "mototaxi" (a motorcycle with a covered seated area attached to carry passengers) for the last three years. With her hard work, they have been able to insure that they have the monthly income needed to support their three children.

However, Yovana reports that it has been some months that her husband's "mototaxi" has had mechanical problems. Yovana needs capital to buy materials, like bronze, for her faucet shop, and also to support her husband in the repair of his "mototaxi."

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase material for the making of faucet accessories and to repair her mototaxi.

loan.name: Riziki's Tuwe Na Moyo Group

texts.en:
Riziki is 24 years old. She is married with 1 child 5 years old. She has been running her own salon since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Riziki is now looking for a loan to buy more salon items to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatma.

loan.use: To buy more salon items to expand her business

loan.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 32 years old. She is single, with one child aged 10. She has been a hairdresser since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125.

Beatrice is now looking for a loan to expand her business.

loan.use: To expand her business.

loan.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 25 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 1 year old. She has been a decorations seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Halima is now looking for loan to buy more decorations items for the expansion of her business.

loan.use: To buy more decorations items for the expansion of her business

loan.name: Abdullaeva

texts.en:
Abdullaeva B. was born in 1973 in the Spitamen region. She is married and has four children. She works in the Human Resources Department but she also is involved in the livestock purchasing and selling. She is experienced in the livestock business for five years and has the special skills.

Mrs Abdullaeva B. applies to Kiva with a request for the business development loan of 2100 STJ ($US625) for six months to increase the scope and turnover of her business.

loan.use: To increase the scope and turnover of her livestock business.

loan.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is married, and she is a food seller. Every day, she works at her business and earns a small profit from her sales.

Khadija is requesting a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loan.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loan.name: Abdurozokova

texts.en: Mrs. Abdurozokova N. sells children's clothing in the local bazaar. She has worked in this kind of business for 4 years. She works as the bookkeeper; the business provides income for her family. Mrs. Abdurozokova N. is requesting a business support loan of 1800 STJ ($550 USD) for 6 months to import a new seasonal assortment of clothing. Abdurozokova N. took her first loan from MicroInvest in 2008. Thanks to the previous loan, she was able to improve her existing assortment. She is a reliable client who trusts our loan procedure and intends to co-operate with us fully.

loan.use: importing a new seasonal assortment of clothing

loan.name: Oisanam

texts.en:
A. Oisanam applied to MicroInvest in 2008 for the business development loan. She used the previous loan in order to improve her business terms because she was in a crisis situation. Thanks to the previous loan she improved the existing livestock business and started one more business in rice growing.

Now Mrs A. Oisanam applies to Kiva with a request for the business loan of 2800 STJ ($US825) for six months to purchase a pedigree bull.

loan.use: For pedigree bull purchasing.

loan.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano A. was born in 1965 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Rano is engaged in commerce selling food products. She has been working in this business for 6 years.

Mrs. Rano A. has a stall in the local bazaar and she has a good assortment. Selling at prices that are very low, she has a lot of customers. Rano is applying to KIVA for financial support, in the form of a business development loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months to expand her inventory.

loan.use: To expand her inventory to satisfy her customers

loan.name: Jamila's Usinitupe Group

texts.en:
Jamila is 33 years old. She is married and has a two-year-old child. She has sold food since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

Jamila is looking for a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize, flour, and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fikira and Salamuu.

loan.use: To buy food such as rice, maize, flour, and bananas.

loan.name: Mwanaisha's Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married. She has been a dressmaker since 2003. She works daily at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $145 from her sales.
Mwanaisha is now looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Tatu.

loan.use: To expand her business.

loan.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
Gulnoza A. is 26 years old and lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. Gulnoza sells manufactured flowers and creams, shampoo, and soap. She has a good assortment and repeat customers.

Gulnoza is applying to Kiva to ask for financial support in the form of a business development loan of $550. With this loan, she will acquire more products to sell and broaden her assortment of products.

loan.use: To purchase a larger assortment of products to sell

loan.name: Alieva

texts.en: Alieva D. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008 but she recommends herself as a serious and reliable client. D. trades flour and it brings her general income. She works straight with suppliers so she trades at low prices. She has repeat customers and appropriate business skills. Mrs. Alieva D. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 3600 STJ for 5 months to improve her business.

loan.use: Alieva would like to improve her flour business.

loan.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is married. She has run her own general store since 2005. Currently she earns a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Khadija is now requesting a loan to expand her stock.

loan.use: To buy more items for her general store.

loan.name: Bahrinisso

texts.en: Mrs. A. Bahrinisso lives in the Spitamen region. She grows and sells cucumbers, tomatoes, rice and wheat. Her 5 children help in this family business. Mrs. A. Bahrinisso applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 3800 STJ ($1125 USD) for 6 months. She will use the loan for seasonal work to ensure a good crop next year.

loan.use: seasonal work to ensure the success of next year's crop

loan.name: Salma's Tujikwamue Group

texts.en:
Salma is 38 years old, is married, and has three children between the ages of 11 and 4. She has run her own general store since 2005. She works every day from 6 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.
Salma is now seeking a loan to buy more products for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwana.

loan.use: To buy more products for her business.

loan.name: Bashorat

texts.en: Bashorat B. has been engaged in selling household wares in the bazaar with her mother for the past 15 years. They live poorly in spite of the fact Bashorat does her best to help her family. While Bashorat does not have a good education she has acquired appropriate business skills. Bashorat works honestly with suppliers and has a good reputation as a trader. She has many repeat customers and good assortment of goods. Bashorat now applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 2100 STJ for a 5 month term to purchase new materials for sale.

loan.use: To purchase new materials for sale

loan.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 23 years old. She is married with 1 child 5 years old. She has been a movies, tapes, and DVD seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Sakina is now looking for a loan to expand her business.

loan.use: To expand her business

loan.name: Mwanahuri's Mungu Muweza Group

texts.en:
Mwanahuri is 24 years and she is married with one 6 month old child. She has sold shoes and clothes since 2005. She works every day at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.
Mwanahuri is now looking for a loan to buy more shoes and clothes for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Hati, Lailat, Fatma, and Halima.

loan.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for the expansion of her business.

loan.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is married with 1 child who is 8 years old. She has run her own shop since 2003, and she works every day from 8 am to 8 pm, earning a minimum profit from her sales.
Tatu is now seeking a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loan.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loan.name: Fatma's Apewae Hapokonyeki Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 36 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 18 and 10 years old. She has owned a small food vendor store since 2003. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fatma is now looking for a loan to buy more products for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Rehema and Safinia.

loan.use: To buy more products for her business

loan.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is 33 years old, married and has one child who is five years old. Since 2005, she has made a living by running a small beauty salon and by selling chickens. She works every day of the week and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Zena has applied for a loan to buy items for her salon and chickens to resell.

loan.use: To buy more items for a beauty salon and chickens to resell.

loan.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 50 years old. She is married with 2 children. She has owned a small general store since 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175.

Asha is now looking for a loan to buy more products in order to expand her business.

loan.use: To buy more products in order to expand her business.

loan.name: Maua's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Maua J. is 25 years old and is single. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7 am to 6 pm at her business, and she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Maua is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes for resale to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Tatu F..

loan.use: To buy more clothes for resale to expand her business

loan.name: Azamjon

texts.en:
Azamjon A. is a self-sacrificing, loving father, who is 56 years old with four children, all of whom are independent. In spite of his age, he continues to fight to get his beloved family ahead and improve their economic situation. Ever since he was very young, Azamjon has been around people who have raised animals; and, thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the business of purchasing and selling cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Azamjon harbors in his heart is to increase his capital in order to invest in acquiring more animals. In turn, by selling these animals, he can generate more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved grandchildren, who always supports him unconditionally in his daily work. Accordingly, he requests $1,000 for the term of 6 months. Please get behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing much-needed stability and security to the members of his family.

loan.use: To increase and expand his business by purchasing additional cattle

loan.name: Ismoiljon

texts.en:
A. Ismoiljon is 30 years old. He is married with two adorable children. Ismoiljon has been breeding cattle since he was a young boy. He is a purposeful person. He likes animals and enjoys looking after them.
His mother, who is pictured in the photo, and also his wife help him with his business. Day by day, they wait for their cattle to grow, watching the fruits of their investment with satisfaction. In order to house the new members of this small business, they plan to improve the facilities of their farm and become better prepared in order to obtain better results. That is why they are asking for a loan of $1000 USD, which they are planning to repay within 6 months.
Lets support this friendly family, who are a fine example of family strength. Your contribution is very important.

loan.use: Purchasing of cattle and small cattle to expand the business.

loan.name: Gayratjon

texts.en:
E. Gayratjon is 26 years old. He is married with three children. Gayratjon raises and sells cattle. He purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds and cares for them, and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. Gayratjon has been in this business for 5 years. He is an expert in choosing and caring for the animals. He gets up every morning at five oclock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful, generating a considerable, stable income for his large family.
Gayratjon is planning to enlarge his stock by purchasing more small cattle. For this purpose he requests 3500 Somoni ($1050 USD) for the term of 12 months. Gayratjon has already taken one loan from IMON and has shown himself to be a responsible borrower with a positive credit history. You could become an important part of Gayratjon family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loan.use: Purchasing small cattle to expand the business.

loan.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo K. is the happy mother of one child. For two years she has been selling foodstuffs such as sweets, macaroni, preserved foods, juices, soft drinks, tea, coffee, and many others in a grocery store which is situated in the market of Djabbar Rasulov.

Shahlos wish is to increase her business, offering a variety of types of foodstuffs to her customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved child, who is only 5 years old, who is the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts.

With this opportunity and with the immense love she feels as a mother and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (1175 USD) in order to increase the range of her goods. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months. By supporting her, you can be an important link in the growth of this business.

loan.use: Purchasing foodstuffs in order to expand her inventory

loan.name: Muhamadjon

texts.en:
Muhamadjon N. is a 33-year-old married man with three children. Muhamadjon is a hard-working man who, while continuing to work another job, started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business ten years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales and he is proud to say that the business has been running well, but he now needs additional capital to expand his business.

Therefore, Muhamadjon is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase additional cattle to sell; more specifically, he will reinvest the loan proceeds and grow the business, as he has been doing. He is offering to repay the loan in 12 months. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loan.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional cattle

loan.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza S. is 28 years old, and she comes from a large and humble family. She is married and is the loving mother of 3 children. Her father's hard-working and demanding nature showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, which has served her well because she has been successful in various activities throughout her life.

Now, she dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle. With the income she generates from this business, she is able to provide a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and her best friends. Consequently, she is seeking a 12-month loan in the amount of 3,500 Somoni ($1,050) in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment, she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Please support this dedicated mother's proposal.

loan.use: To expand her business and to improve her family's living conditions by purchasing additional cattle

loan.name: Second Hand Clothes Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs includes Joseph M. B. (pictured on right), Mohammed K., John K. and Saffie K..
Joseph M. B. is the leader for this group; he has a business selling second-hand clothes. He was born in Loko Masama, a village very close to Lungi and about 70 miles from Makeni. He is now 40 years old and married with three children.
Joseph has over 20 years of experience in the second-hand clothes sales business. With previous loans from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) he was able to add to his initial capital. He is now constructing a house that will have five rooms, a parlor and a store. With this current loan he plans to buy two more bales of clothing inventory (each bale costs Le 450,000), as he is expecting increased sales as the Islamic end-of-fasting celebration is getting close. With his increased profits, Joseph plans to see the completion of the house he has begun and to ensure his children receive a good education.
This group -- collectively known as Second Hand Clothes -- has been working with SMT for four years. This will be their fifth loan from SMT. Each time they receive a loan they have been able to expand their businesses, and they are very thankful to Kiva for this support.

loan.use: Expand on their businesses

loan.name: Sapolaneh Group

texts.en:
Aminat B., Fatmata B., Aminata K. and Fatmata K. have all teamed together in a group called Sapolaneh. They have successfully repaid previous loans from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) and are now applying for a fourth loan. This, like their previous loans, will help them in improving their businesses and therefore improving the living standards for them and their dependents.
Aminata (pictured at left) is the leader for this group. She was born in Mile 91, a small town in the Tonkolili district, north of Sierra Leone. She is 25 years old and married with two children; one child is in primary school and the other is too young to start school.
Aminata has been selling cottons for three years. With her previous loan, she was able to buy 15 bales of cottons at a village called Bamoi (at a cost of Le 28,000.00 per bale). With this loan, Aminata will increase the amount of cottons she buys to 25 bales. Her aim now is to buy these cottons from Bamoi at a cheaper rate, and then supply her colleagues here in Makeni. This will allow her to make more of a profit, which, she said, means happiness for her.

loan.use: Buy more bales of cottons

loan.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Alhaji M. is the leader of Trust, a group consisting of three other members: Aminata K., Aminata M. and Isatu M.. Having repaid their previous loan, they are seeking a new one in the amount of $1100 to improve their businesses and their families living standards.
Alhaji M. is 26, and was born in Kabala, Koinadugu District, North of Sierra Leone, but he and his wife, a businesswoman who sells cigarettes, now live in Makeni. For the past five years, Alhaji has owned and operated a kiosk (a telephone-centre) where he makes calls for people, sells top-up cards for all 4 mobile networks, charges mobile phones and sells mobile phone accessories. He also sells drinks and cold water at his kiosk, and with this loan he will increase the volume of drinks he sells. This will certainly generate more income, the profits of which he will reinvest in his business.

loan.use: To expand their businesses.

loan.name: Marian's Group

texts.en:
The Marian Group is named after the group's leader. All the members are businesswomen in Makeni, the northern provincial headquarters town. They have been a group with SMT for the past two years now and are now in their fourth cycle. Previously, SMT loaned these women Le 600,000.00 each. This they have repaid successfully, and they are now requesting a new loan. The previous loan made a big difference in their lives, but they still need more loans to further empower themselves in their businesses.

The group leader is Marian C.. Marian was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili District, in northern Sierra Leone, 38 years ago. She is married with two school-going children, both of whom are in secondary school. Both she and her husband, who is a businessman, are responsible for their children's schooling and welfare. Through her groundnut trade, Marian is able to meet most of her financial needs. She has been in the groundnut business for the past 15 years. Marian is doing fine in her business, but she still faces a lot of challenges. First, the amount that SMT's credit officer approved for her and her group members is not enough. She had wanted Le 1,000,000.00. This would have enabled her to purchase more bags of groundnuts, and as the dry seasoning is fast approaching, she expects a boom in business. Second, sometimes some of the groundnuts within a bag may be rotten, which means some losses for her business. However, with this loan of Le 800,000.00 approved for Marian, she will be able to buy at least three bags of groundnuts to add to her current stock.

loan.use: To expand their businesses

loan.name: Tamtamneh Group

texts.en:
This group is called Tamtamneh. They are all business people in Makeni, the Northern provincial headquarters town. They have been together as a group with SMT for the past two years now and are now in their 4th loan cycle. Previously, SMT loaned these entrepreneurs Le 500,000.00 each. This they have repaid successfully and are now requesting a new loan. The previous loan made a lot of impact on their lives, but they still need more loans to further empower themselves in their businesses.

Their leader is Ahmed K. (on the left). Ahmed was born in Mambolo, in the Kambia District, in the North of Sierra Leone. He is 36 years of age. He is married to a business woman and the two have 4 children; one is in secondary school, two are in primary school, and the last is still very young.

Ahmed sells items like: chains, cosmetics, pastes and toothbrushes, batteries, and so on. Through this business, he is able to meet most of his financial needs. He has been in this business for the past 12 years now. Ahmed is doing fine in his business. His immediate goal is to build himself and his family a house. And he is very much optimistic that through his business, he will one day achieve this goal.

loan.use: Expand their businesses

loan.name: Flores De Loreto Group

texts.es: La pollera es la vestimenta tpica de las muchas mujeres (Cholitas) en algunas regiones del pas, esta va acompaada de mantillas y otros accesorios caractersticos segn la regin. Esta pollera es el elemento principal de negocio dentro la asociacin F. de Loreto ellas se dedican a la venta de polleras y mantillas usadas, otras de ellas se dedican a la confeccin de centros (falda interior a la pollera) y de las polleras mismas, tambin realizan tejidos de mantillas, trabajo que lo realizan con la ayuda de sus familias, La asociacin F. de Loreto pertenece al centro focal Los Andes ubicado en la zona de Villa Tunari de la ciudad de el Alto. Trabajan con la ilusin de poder ahorrar para obtener casas propias ya que actualmente viven en alquiler y quieren ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus hijos. Ahora ellas necesitan contratar ayudantes para aumentar su produccin, de este modo aumentar las ventas y obtener mayores ganancias con el objetivo de ahorrar para el bienestar de sus familias.
texts.en:
The "pollera" is the typical skirt of many women (Cholitas) in some regions of the country, this is accompanied by shawls and other characteristic accessories depending on the region. This skirt is the main element of business within the association "F. de Loreto". Most of the women in this group sell used skirts and shawls, while others work at setting up the businesses themselves. And others actually knit the shawls, with the help of some family members. The "F. de Loreto" group belongs to the central region of Los Andes, located in the area of Villa Tunari in the city of Alto. These women work with the hope of being able to save money in order to buy their own homes (since many are renting), and in turn, bring more conveniences to their children. With this loan they will hire assistants to help them increase their production, which will increase their sales and reap greater profits with the goal of saving for the welfare of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: capital so they can hire helpers and increase their production

loan.name: Rosales Group

texts.es: Rosales es la denominacin que adoptan 10 mujeres, agrupadas para trabajar junto a la institucin de Pro-Mujer. Ellas se renen cada 14 das en el centro focal Los Andes ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto. Varios son los negocios de ste grupo, por ejemplo alguna de ellas se dedica a la venta de plantas, Emiliana teje chompas en lana, otras de ellas se dedican a la confeccin de busos y chaquetas deportivas. Estas prendas son comercializadas al por menor en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Ellas necesitan capital para la compra de materia prima para poder aumentar su produccin y vender al por mayor, de esta manera generar mayores ganancias y conseguir mejores ingresos para sostener econmicamente a sus familias.
texts.en:
"Rosales" is the name of a group of 10 women, working together with the institution Pro-Mujer. They meet every 14 days in the center of the Andes in the city of El Alto. This group has a variety of trades. For example, one woman sells plants, Emiliana weaves wool sweaters, and the others focus on making clothes such as sweatshirts and sports jackets. These products are sold retail in the street market 16 de Julio in the city of El Alto. These women need capital for the purchase of basic materials in order to increase production and sell their products at wholesale. In this way, they can generate more profit, continue improving their affairs, and economically support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: These women need capital for the purchase of basic materials in order to increase production and sell their products at wholesale

loan.name: La Unin Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es:
El Grupo denominado LA UNIN HACE LA FUERZA; se conform en fecha 25 de agosto de 2008, dicho grupo fue organizado gracias a que la actual Presidenta Mara Rossana C., quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, se acerc a la asesora en una reunin semanal que tenia la misma en la zona, para informarse de como funciona el programa del Comit de Mujeres Emprendedoras. La Sra. Mara habl a sus vecinas y amigas y logr juntar a 15 mujeres las cuales integran hoy da este comit.

Las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta de ropas, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comidas, venta de carbn, ventas de artculos de plsticos, venta de bijouteri, venta de sbanas y manteles, venta de carnes, panificados, azcar, yerba, arroz, etc. y a la venta de artculos de merceras como remeras, medias, lenceras, binchas, etc.

El grupo trabaja en forma conjunta, demuestran compaerismo y solidaridad. Todas las integrantes del grupo asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien comn del grupo.

Las actividades que desarrollan cada una se especifica a continuacin: 1. Mara C.. Venta de ropas.

2. 2-Juana R.. Venta de comidas.

3. 3-Elodia V.. Venta de artculos de plsticos.

4. 4-Jorgelina Snchez. Venta de bijouterie.

5. 5-Marina G.. Venta de sbanas y mantel.

6. 6-Dora F.. Despensa.

7. 7-Herminia R.. Venta de carbn y despensa.

8. 8-Antonia R.. Venta de miel y chipa.

9. 9-Nery S.. Venta de bebidas.

10. 10-Sonia D.. Venta de carne.

11. 11-Mara R.. Venta de frutas y verduras.

12. 12-.Diana M.. Venta de sbanas.

13. 13-Amelia T.. Venta de frutas.

14. 14-Cinthia C.. Venta de merceras.

15. 15-Mara I.. Venta de comidas.
texts.en:
The group LA UNION HACE LA FUERZA was founded on August 25, 2008. It is said that the group was organized thanks to the current President Maria Rossana Cespedes, a woman with a career in selling clothes. She contacted the adviser of a nearby weekly meeting that informed people about the program called Committee of Women Entrepreneurs. Maria talked to her neighbors and friends and put together a group of 15 women who now make up this committee. The committee members take part in various activities such as the sale of clothing, fruits and vegetables, carbon coals, plastic products, trinkets and jewelry, sheets and blankets, meat, pastry, sugar, herbs, rice, etcetera as well as the sale of clothing like T-shirts, stockings, lingerie, hair bands, and etcetera. This group works together as a team, demonstrating camaraderie and solidarity. All of them help with the weekly meetings and with the fulfillment of duties in order to raise money for the common wellbeing of the group. The activity that each woman performs is specified as follows: 1. Mara C.. Sale of clothing 2. Juana R.. Sale of food. 3. Elodia V.. Sale of plastics 4. Jorgelina Snchez. Sale of jewelry and trinkets 5. Marina G.. Sale of blankets and sheets 6. Dora F.. Household items 7. Herminia R.. Sale of carbon coals and household items. 8. Antonia R.. Sale of honey and chirpa 9. Nery S.. Sale of drinks 10. Sonia D.. Sale of meat 11. Mara R.. Sale of fruits and vegetables 12. Diana M.. Sale of sheets. 13. Amelia T.. Sale of fruit 14. Cinthia C.. Sale of clothing. 15. Mara I.. Sale of food.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of clothes, fruits and vegetables, ingredients for food preparation, plastics, jewelry and trinkets, sheets and blankets, groceries (rice, sugar, pastries, candy, herbs, meat, etc.), drinks, carbon coals, clothing (t-shirts, lingerie, wallets, hair bands, etc.)

loan.name: Alaxpacha Group

texts.es: Alaxpacha, Traduccin el Espaol: 'Espacio del ms all, cielo' . Es decir, es el espacio superior donde se encuentran el sol, la L. y las estrellas. El tejido de chompas, mantillas y otras prendas, en lana de alpaca es la actividad principal de 13 mujeres ansiosas de crecer en sus negocios. Agrupadas en una asociacin denominada Alaxpacha, trabajan en el centro focal Los Andes que pertenece a la institucin Pro-Mujer. Ya finalizados sus trabajos los venden a pedido, en tiendas de artesana y ferias de la ciudad de La Paz. Ellas quieren exportar sus productos al interior y exterior del pas, por lo que necesitan mayores crditos para la compra de materia prima, (fibra de alpaca) adems de acceder a capacitaciones donde aprendan a promocionar sus productos de manera mas calificada. De esta manera lograr crecimiento personal y econmico, para el bien de sus hogares.
texts.en:
"Alaxpacha", the English translation: 'from beyond space, sky'. Which means the the space where you find the sun, moon and stars. Knitting sweaters, shawls, and other garments out of alpaca wool is the main work of 13 women eager to grow their businesses. Their group is in an association called Alaxpacha, and they work in the region of Los Andes for an institution that belongs to Pro-Mujer "Pro-Women". Once they complete their work, they sell them in craft shops and fairs in the city of La Paz. These women now want to export their products inside and outside the country, so they need a larger loan for the purchase of raw materials, (alpaca fiber) in addition to access training where they can learn to promote their products. This way, they will be able to achieve personal growth and economic development for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase alpaca fiber/material

loan.name: Las Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se conform en fecha 04 de agosto del 2008, resultado de promociones hechas por la asesora en la zona. Dicho grupo fue organizado gracias a que la Sra. Delia Gonzlez de Gonzlez, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, se comunic posteriormente con la asesora, comunicando que logr conformar un grupo de 15 mujeres, quienes ahora se encuentran trabajando con el programa del Comit de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

El grupo eligi el nombre de Las Unidas, ya que todas ellas son amigas y vecinas.

Las integrantes del Comit LAS UNIDAS se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como se detallan a continuacin:

1-Esmilce Gonzlez. Venta de productos de limpieza.

2-Delia de Gonzlez. Venta de comidas.

3-Norma Gonzlez. Venta de comidas.

4-Clara Garca. Venta de ropas.

5-Estelvina Gonzlez. Venta de remedios refrescantes.

6-Roco Gonzlez. Venta de remedios refrescantes.

7-Mirian S.. Venta de carne.

8-Graciela A.. Venta de cosmticos.

9-Delia G. Gonzlez. Venta de comidas.

10-Mirian Gonzlez. Venta de remedios refrescantes.

11-Flora A.. Venta de frutas y verduras.

12-Brgida Snchez. Venta de remedios refrescantes.

13-Basilisa F.. Despensa.

14-Soledad C.. Costurera.

15-Marta S.. Venta de tortas.

Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien comn del grupo. El grupo trabaja en forma conjunta, demuestran compaerismo y solidaridad.
texts.en:
This group was formed on August 4, 2008 resulting from the promotional works of the local partner adviser. The group was organized by Delia G. de G. who has made a living by selling groceries. She contacted the adviser, communicating that she had organized the group of 15 women who now work for the program called Committee of Women Entrepreneurs. The group named themselves Las Unidas as these women were already friends and neighbors. The committee members of Las Unidas are pursuing a variety of activities, such as the following detailed below: 1-Esmilce Gonzlez. Sale of cleaning products. 2-Delia de Gonzlez. Sale of groceries. 3-Norma Gonzlez. Sale of groceries. 4-Clara Garca. Sale of clothing. 5-Estelvina Gonzlez. Sale of drinking teas and herbs. 6-Roco Gonzlez. Sale of drinking teas and herbs. 7-Mirian S.. Sale of meat 8-Graciela A.. Sale of cosmetics 9-Delia G. Gonzlez. Sale of groceries 10-Mirian Gonzlez. Sale of drinking teas and herbs. 11-Flora A.. Sale of fruits and vegetables. 12-Brgida Snchez. Sale of drinking teas and herbs. 13-Basilisa F.. Sale of groceries. 14-Soledad C.. Seamstress 15-Marta S.. Sale of sandwiches. All of the women pursue these activities to bring about the common wellbeing of the group. This group works as a team, demonstrating camaraderie and solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of materials for the production of cleaning products, food preparation, clothes (t-shirts, blouses, wallets, etc.), drinking teas and herbs, fabric to make clothes, fruits and vegetables, ingredients for making sandwiches, cosmetics, groceries (rice, sugar, herbs, pastries, candy, dairy products, etc.), meat, etc.

loan.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es: La asociacin Fortaleza se dedica a la elaboracin de almuerzos y servicios de t, estos distribuidos en oficinas pblicas de la ciudad de El Alto. Dicha asociacin se rene en el centro focal de Villa Exaltacin, a la fecha esta integrada por 14 socias que trabajan con Pro-Mujer hace ms de cuatro aos. Casi todas cuentan con familias bastante numerosas, es as que todos ayudan en el negocio, desde la preparacin de los alimentos, hasta la distribucin de los almuerzos ya realizados. La asociacin Fortaleza quiere obtener mayores pedidos para obtener mayores ganancias, por lo que quieren contratar ayudantes, es por eso que ellas solicitan mayores crditos para este fin. Luego de llegar a sus objetivos de venta, estn seguras de mejorar la actual difcil situacin econmica por la que estan atravesando.
texts.en:
The association "Fortaleza" (Strength) is a lunch and tea services business, mainly working to serve government offices in the city of El Alto. This group of 14 women meet in the city center of Villa Exaltacion, and have been working with Pro-Mujer (Pro-Women) for over 4 years now. Almost all of the women have large families, and count on their family members for help with the business services, such as food preparation and distribution of lunches. The group has requested this loan because they want to hire helpers in order to obtain higher profits. They believe that reaching new sales targets will improve the current difficult economic situation which they are going through.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To hire helpers

loan.name: Ybysuu Group

texts.es:
El Grupo denominado Ybysun se conform en fecha 22 de enero del 2008, dicho grupo fue organizado gracias a que la actual tesorera contacto con la Asesora del programa, se convoc a una reunin donde asistieron todas vecinas y conocidas, las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crdito a diferentes actividades tales como:

Dionicia Vernica Ibez Venta de mercera.

Leoncia Ibez Venta de frutas y verduras.

Eusebia Martnez Venta de Gallinas.

Saturnina D. Venta de Gallinas.

Elva N. Venta de Gallinas.

Blanca A. Venta de Frutas.

Olga Prez Venta de Ropas.

Sara Vern Venta de Comidas.

Elisa P. Venta de Gallinas.

Andrea Ibez Venta de mercera.

Martha E. Venta de mercera.

Simeona A. Despensa.

Josefina B. Venta de Gallinas.

Lorenza O. - Despensa.

Lucila Lpez Venta de Cosmticos.

Olga J. Despensa.

Pabla R. Despensa.

El grupo demuestra compaerismo y solidaridad. Todas las integrantes del grupo asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos extras en caso de que surja una eventualidad y demuestra un gran inters al programa y la importancia de cumplir en forma excelente con sus pagos.

El grupo se destaca por el entusiasmo y la honestidad que demuestran una a otra.
texts.en:
The Group called Ybysun was formed January 22, 2008. This group was organized thanks to the current treasurer contacting the Treasurer of the program, who convened a meeting attended by all neighbors and acquaintances. The members of this group will use their loans for different activities, such as:

Dionicia Vernica Ibez - Hardware Sales.

Leoncia Ibez - Fruit and Vegetable Sales.

Eusebia Martnez - Chicken Sales.

Saturnina D. - Chicken Sales.

Elva N. - Chicken Sales.

Blanca A. - Fruit Sales.

Olga Prez - Clothing Sales.

Sara Vern - Food Sales.

Elisa P. - Chicken Sales.

Andrea Ibez - Hardware Sales.

Martha E. - Hardware Sales.

Simeona A. - Grocery Store.

Josefina B. - Chicken Sales.

Lorenza O. - Grocery Store.

Lucila Lpez - Cosmetics Sales.

Olga J. - Grocery Store.

Pabla R. - Grocery Store.

This group demonstrates companionship and solidarity. All of the members attend the weekly meetings and carry out activities to raise extra money in case a contingency emerges. They show a great interest in the program and the importance of excellent compliance with repayment.

The group stands out for its enthusiasm and the honesty they show to each other.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy fruits and vegetables, ingredients for food preparation, chickens, cosmetics, clothing, sugar, flour, herbs, meat, etc.

loan.name: ngel

texts.es:
El Seor Angel S. est casado con la Sra. Gloria Mareco, son padres de 2 hijas; una de 12 y otra de 14 aos respectivamente, ambas se encuentran cursando sus estudios secundarios.

El cliente era empleado de una herrera desde los 12 aos de edad en donde aprendi el oficio de herrero, y con el ahorro de dicho trabajo form su propia microempresa que consiste en una elastiquera y herrera y cabe mencionar que lleva 14 aos en el rubro.

El prstamo solicitado ser destinado para la compra de un compresor de aire para su trabajo. Y tiene proyectado para el futuro vender repuestos para camiones, ya que cuenta con clientela bien formada y desea brindarles una mejor atencin.

Para el pas desea que se apoye ms a la agricultura y a las industrias por que considera que son los motores principales de la economa.
texts.en:
Mr. Angel S. is married to Mrs. Gloria Mareco, and they are the parents of 2 daughters (ages 12 and 14). Both girls are attending high school. Angel was 12 years old when he began working for a blacksmith, and this is where he learned his craft and where he was able to begin saving money, with which he was able to start his own blacksmithing business. He has now been in business for 14 years. The loan he is now requesting will go to the purchase of an air compressor for his business. He plans that in the future he'll also sell spare truck parts, since he has many customers with trucks and his desire is to give them better service. His wish is also that his country will receive more support to agriculture and other industries, which he believes are the main drivers in the country's economy.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase a compressor

texts.es:
El Sr. Arnaldo Campusano de 28 aos, esta casado con la Sra. Mara Duarte de 18 aos, aun no tienen hijos.

Don Arnaldo Campusano es propietario de una gomera y venta de repuestos para motos. Dicho negocio fue una herencia de su padre a quien perteneca hasta el ao 1.998, poca en la que decidi dejar la administracin del negocio a cargo de Don Arnaldo. Adems, con su esposa se dedican a la venta de perfumes y joyas desde hace cinco meses, donde su seora esposa esta como encargada.

La solicitud de crdito es para la compra de mercaderas como perfumes de variadas marcas y joyas de variados modelos, teniendo en cuenta que la mayor parte de su venta es a crdito.

Don Arnaldo sostiene que tener fuente de trabajo es lo ms importante, ya que nos ayuda a progresar econmicamente y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Arnaldo Campusano is 28 years old. He is married to Mrs. Mara Duarte who is 18. They do not have any children yet. Mr. Arnaldo Campusano is the owner of a tire repair shop, and also sells replacement parts for motorcycles. This business was inherited from his father, who owned it until 1998 when he decided to put Don Arnaldo in charge of managing the business. In addition, his wife has been selling perfumes and jewelry for the last five months as her own business.

The loan is to purchase items such as perfumes of various brands and jewelry of various models, taking into consideration that most of their sales are done on credit.

Don Arnaldo believes that having a solid work flow is most important, since it is that which will help his family succeed financially and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase perfumes and jewelry

loan.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Seor Carlos de 49 aos de edad, esta felizmente casado desde hace 15 aos con la seora Juana de 47 aos.

Desde pequeo, Don Carlos trabajaba en un taller, lugar donde acumul la experiencia necesaria para luego, en el ao 1.995 emprendiera su propio taller mecnico, con un pequeo ahorro que contaba hasta entonces. En el ao 2.004 amplio su negocio y abri una casa de repuestos para motos y bicicletas.

Como sueo personal desea ampliar ms an su taller para poder ofrecer un servicio completo a su clientela.

El cliente solicita el crdito para la compra de repuestos para motos y bicicletas.
texts.en:
Seor Carlos (49 years of age), is happily married for 15 years now with seora Juana (47 years of age). From the time he was a small boy, Carlos worked in a factory where he gained the necessary experience to open his own machine shop in 1995.
