He was able to do this with the savings he had accumulated until that point in his life. Then, in 2004, he expanded his business to include a spare parts shop for motorcycles and bicycles.

Now his personal dream is to expand his workshop even further and offer complete services to his customers. He is requesting a loan to purchase additional spare parts for motorcycles and bicycles.


Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles

loan.name: Dario

texts.es:
El Seor Dario de 28 aos de edad vive desde hace 4 aos con la seora Sandra, el matrimonio tiene un hijo de 2 aos de edad.

Don Dario, desde pequeo trabajaba en la carpintera con su padre. En el 2004, fue cuando decidi emprender su propia carpintera con un pequeo ahorro con el que contaba y un poco de ayuda que recibi de sus padres. Actualmente esta fabricando roperos de 4 y 5 puertas ya que estos artculos tienen mayor circulacin y le deja mayor porcentaje de ganancia.

Como sueo personal desea ampliar ms su carpintera para poder poner a la vista los refinados muebles que fabrica y de este modo dar a sus cliente una mejor atencin.

El cliente solicita el crdito para la compra de madera, terciadas y clavos.
texts.en:
Dario is 28 years old and is married to Sandra. They've lived together for 4 years and have a 2 year old boy.

Ever since he was a little boy, Dario worked at the carpenter's workshop with his father. In 2004, he decided to open his own carpenter's workshop with a little savings and some help from his parents. He's currently making 4- and 5-door wardrobes as they are in demand and he is able to make more money.

As a personal goal, Dario would like to expand his workshop in order to display the refined furniture he makes, and that way, serve his customers better.

Dario is soliciting a loan to buy lumber, plywood and nails.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy lumber, plywood and nails.

loan.name: Felicita

texts.es:
La Sra. Felicita Martinez de 45 aos de edad es madre soltera y cuenta con dos hijos de 22 y15 aos respectivamente, el primero estudi hasta el 2do. Ao de la carrera de Derecho y luego tuvo que abandonar la dedicarse al negocio y asi ayudarle a su mam porque la mayora de las ventas las realiza a crdito y l se dedica a la cobranza, mientras que la de 15 aos esta realizando sus estudios secundarios.

La seora Felicita empez el negocio hace 5 aos con un ahorro que vena acumulando de su trabajo anterior ya que ella es modista y realiza trabajo sobre pedido.

La seora y sus dos hijos estn llevando el negocio adelante con mucha dedicacin y sacrificio, el objetivo de la familia es tener mas ingresos en forma mensual para que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera universitaria y que en el futuro sea una persona de bien. Solicita este prstamo para compra de pantaln, remeras, camisas, short, calzados deportivos. As aumentar su Stock de mercaderas y ofrecer de esta forma variedad a sus clientes
texts.en:
Ms. Felicita Martinez is 45 years old, a single mother, and has two children, 22 and 15 years old, respectively. The first studied up to the second year of law school and then had to quit in order to work. As such, he helps his mother; because the majority of the sales are purchased with credit, he works to collect the payments. Meanwhile the 15 year old is in high school.

Ms. Felicita started her business 5 years ago with the savings she had been accumulating from her previous work, as she is a seamstress and works on custom orders.

Felicita and her two children are advancing the business with a lot of dedication and sacrifice. The family's goal is to have more monthly income so that the children can finish university studies and be well off in the future. She is requesting this loan to purchase pants, t-shirts, shirts, shorts, and tennis shoes. With this she will increase her merchandise stock and offer more variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy jeans for women and men, t-shirts, shirts, shoes, blouses, underwear, sneakers, and perfume

loan.name: Librada

texts.es:
La Sra. Librada Bentez de 32 aos de edad est casada hace 8 aos con el seor Hugo Acosta de 33 aos, el matrimonio cuenta con dos hijos de 12 y 5 aos respectivamente, el primero est en el 7mo grado y la otra est en el pre - escolar

La seora Librada se inici en este negocio hace 4 aos con la ayuda de su esposo que es funcionario de la Polica Nacional siendo su cargo actual Sub Oficial Inspector con una antigedad de 14 aos.

La seora cuenta con clientela formada y adems tiene su propia vendedora, que le ayuda a que cada da crezca ms su negocio y con eso aumentar su ingreso mensual Solicita este prstamo para compra de mercaderas como jeans para damas y caballeros, remeras, blusas, conjunto para criaturas, camisas, ropa interior y otros. As tendr mas variedad y con eso aumentar su Stock de mercaderas para poder ofrecer otras alternativas a sus clientes
texts.en:
Mrs. Librada B. is 32 years old. She has been married for 8 years to Mr. Hugo Acosta, who is 33 years old. They have two children, 12 and 5 years old. The first is in the 7th grade and the other is in pre-school.

Mrs. Librada started this business 4 years ago with the help of her husband, who is a member of the National Police, with his current position being the Sub-Officer Inspector with 14 years of seniority.

Librada says she has formed a clientelle and also has her own saleswoman, who helps her as her business grows more every day and with this her monthly income increases.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as jeans for women and men, t-shirts, blouses, outfits for babies, shirts, underwear, and more. As such she will have more variety and with this she will increase her stock of merchandise to be able to offer other alternatives to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy jeans for women and men, t-shirts, blouses, outfits for babies, shirts, underwear

loan.name: Maximina

texts.es:
La Sra. Maximina C. de 35 aos, es separada, tiene una hija que esta cursando sus estudios primarios.

Doa Maximina C. es propietaria de una ferretera, aproximadamente desde el 2.002; ella tuvo que salir fuera del pas en busca de trabajo, fue a nuestro vecino pas, la Argentina all estuvo mucho tiempo trabajando, para luego ahorrar hasta que llego el momento que decidi regresar a nuestro pas e invertir en el rubro de ferretera, esta pequea empresa que ahora pretende ampliar con este crdito, comprando ms mercaderas como: artculos elctricos, pinturas y otros.

Ella suea que la hija tenga una vida mas satisfactoria, un desarrollo personal y una educacin que le ayude a sobresalir siendo una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Maximina C. is 35 years old, separated, and has a daughter who is in primary school.

Maximina C. owns a hardware store, which she has had since about 2002. She had to leave the country for a while to work, traveling to neighboring Argentina where she was employed for quite some time. During this time, she saved money until she decided it was time to return to her country and invest in the hardware trade. With this loan, she can plan to expand her business and purchase items such as electrical products, paints, and others.

She dreams that her daughter will have a more satisfactory life, more personal development, and an education that helps her to succeed as a professional.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise such as electrical products, paints, and others.

loan.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirta F. tiene 36 aos de edad y esta casada con el seor Sr. Juan Cabrera de 38 aos. El matrimonio tiene 4 hijos, un varn y tres nenas.

Doa Mirta es comerciante y esta al frente de una despensa, la cual abri con un pequeo ahorro con el que contaba de una cosecha de algodn que tuvo cuando era agricultora. Actualmente siguen con la misma despensa pero adems se dedica a la venta de huevos al por mayor, cabe mencionar que su mayor fuente de ingreso proviene de esta actividad.

El prstamo otorgado ser destinado a la compra de huevos ya que tiene muchos clientes nuevos a quienes desea proveer de dicho producto en forma mayorista. En el futuro desea ampliar el negocio vendiendo otros productos de primera necesidad.

Nos manifest que tiene mucha esperanza en el nuevo gobierno de nuestro pas, y desea que haya mayores fuentes de trabajo y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mirta F. is 36 years old and she is married to Juan Cabrera who is 38 years old. From their marriage there are 4 children, a little boy and three little girls.

Mirta is a business woman and she is located in front of a grocery store, one that she opened with the small savings she earned from a cotton harvest from the days when she was a farmer. Today she still keeps up the same grocery store but she also sells eggs wholesale. She says that her best and strongest source of income comes from selling eggs.

The loan that she has requested will be used to purchase eggs. She has a large client base for her eggs and she wishes to provide them with the product as a wholesaler. In the future she dreams of expanding her business to sell other basic needs products.

She says that she has so much hope vested on the new government of their country. She hopes that there will be greater employment opportunities and a better quality of life.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase eggs wholesale.

loan.name: Gertrudis

texts.es: La seora Gertrudis G. V. tiene 53 aos de edad, actualmente, vive en la calle Ocano Pacifico, de la Zona El Tejar, se dedica a la produccin y comercio de alimentos (queso, chuo, papa, carne de cordero, caya y otros) los cuales compra en provincia y los trae a la ciudad para comercializarlos, la seora Gertrudis demuestra ser una persona con iniciativa y muy emprendedora, que siempre busca generar ingresos propios para el bien de su familia, ella trabaja con EMPRENDER hace 4 aos, primero siendo parte de un grupo solidario y actualmente con crdito individual, los crditos de la institucin le han permitido incrementar gradualmente su capital de trabajo y por tanto sus ingresos, por eso continua y continuar trabajando con la institucin.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gertrudis G. V. is 53 years old and currently lives on Pacific Ocean Street in the El Tejar zone. She dedicates herself to food production and sales (cheese, chuo, potato, lamb meat, caya and others), which she buys in the province and brings to the city to sell. Mrs. Gertrudis demonstrates herself to be an enterprising woman with a great deal of initiative, who is always looking for ways to increase her income to benefit her family. She has worked with EMPRENDER for four years, first as part of a solidarity group, and currently with an individual credit. The loans from the institution have allowed her to gradually increase her working capital and, concurrently, her income -- which is why she works with them and plans to continue doing so.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase of raw materials.

loan.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: El domicilio de la sreora Maria Luisa P. A., se encuentra ubicado en la Zona de Alto San Pedro, una de las zonas ms tradicionales de la ciudad de La Paz. La seora, se dedica a la produccin de ropa en tela de vicua, y al tejido de chales y carteras en macrame, el material que utiliza es la cola de rata; esta mercadera es exportada a Europa, adems de venderla en el mercado interno; actividad que viene realizando desde hace 20 aos. La Seora vive con sus dos hijas, es viuda desde hace varios aos; el crdito en esta oportunidad ser invertido en la compra de materia prima, ya que tiene bastantes trabajo por fin de ao, la sra. trabaja con emprender hace 3 aos.
texts.en:
The home of Seora Maria Luisa P. A. is located in the zone of Alto San Pedro, one of the most traditional zones in the city of La Paz. The Seora makes clothing from vicua fabric (a llama-like animal of the central Andes that yields a soft wool) and shawls and handbags made of macrame, the material that they use is ribbon. This merchandise is exported to Europe and also sold in the internal market, something that has been going on for twenty years. The Seora lives with her two daughters. She has been a widow for many years. The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw material now that she has enough work for the end of the year. The Seora started this undertaking three years ago.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of Raw Material

loan.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Srta. Norma L. de 43 aos de edad vive en la casa de sus padres a quienes les cuida y se responsabiliza de ellos ya que son muy adultos ya.

La seorita Norma empez el negocio hace 3 aos con un capital que consigui trabajando en el extranjero donde estuvo trabajando por 4 aos, empez con una mercera y con el correr del tiempo lo convirti en una ropera.

El sueo de Norma es que su negocio crezca cada da y con eso aumentar sus ingresos mensuales, para que el da de maana pueda llevar una vida ms cmoda.

Solicita este prstamo para la compra de mercaderas como jeans, remeras, calzados deportivos, carteras, conjunto de buzos, camisa, desodorantes, ropa interior, bijouterie, zapatillas, perfumes en general. As aumentar su Stock de mercaderas y ofrecer de esta forma variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Norma Lopez is 43 years old and lives in the house of her parents, who she takes care of and is responsible for, as they are elderly.

Ms. Norma started her business 3 years ago with money she earned working abroad, where she worked for 4 years. She began with a hardware store and, with the passage of time, converted it to a clothing store.

Norma's dream is that her business will grow every day and, with this, will increase her monthly income so that tomorrow can bring a more comfortable life.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as jeans, t-shirts, tennis shoes, wallets, track suits, shirts, deodorants, underwear, jewelry, footware, and perfume. With this she will increase her stock of merchandise and in this way offer more variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise such as jeans, t-shirts, tennis shoes, wallets, track suits, deodorants, underwear, jewelry, footware, and perfume

loan.name: Communal Bank "gosalvez" Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento GOSALVEZ, inici actividades con doce socias, las mismas tiene su domicilio en la zona del mismo nombre, Gosalvez en la Villa Nuevo Potos, Zona que se encuentra en la ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, esta ladera se caracteriza por tener vecinos migrantes del altiplano, en esta zona generalmente se dedican al comercio, servicio y tambin a la produccin y por ende la mayora de las socias se dedican a estos rubros.
El Banco de emprendimiento GOSALVEZ trabaja con nuestra Institucin cinco ciclos, habindose fundado el 10 de enero de 2007, actualmente se mantienen en el grupo 10 socias, teniendo como mesa directiva:
- Presidenta Catalina L. - Tesorera Paulina M. Q. - Secretaria Sofia V. A.
Se debe resaltar que el grupo trabaja con mucha solidaridad, compaerismo y responsabilidad; aprendieron al interior de la asociacin a ahorrar, hecho que en nuestro pas es muy difcil por la misma situacin social y econmica que atravesamos. Las razones que las motiva a trabajar en este tipo de crdito, es que las seoras indican, que al interior de la asociacin encuentran un espacio de esparcimiento, motivacin, confraternizacin, un espacio donde se sienten escuchadas y pueden hablar de sus problemas personales, para luego salir y poder nuevamente hacer frente a todos sus problemas
Catalina L. Condori : Tiene como actividad principal la venta en una tienda que esta ubicada en su propio domicilio, vive con el esposo que se dedica a la actividad de transporte libre (taxi) como asalariado, como su familia no cuenta con un ingreso fijo ellos han acudido a prestamos de la institucin y una de las aspiraciones de la seora es ver a sus hijos profesionales, uno de ellos se encuentra en la escuela de sargentos, el pequeo se encuentra recin en secundaria.
Agustina M. Q.: Tiene como una actividad principal la venta de lubricantes y la elaboracin de mantas en su propio domicilio. La seora con el esfuerzo y sacrificio de su trabajo juntamente con su esposo, mantienen a sus cuatro hijos. Gracias al prstamo otorgado por la institucin a podido comprar equipo de trabajo para la elaboracin de mantas y as aumentar su capital de trabajo.
Guillermo M. N.: Tiene su propio negocio de elaboracin de calzados en su propio domicilio, su esposa tiene como actividad principal la venta de comida en la zona de Chijini, pese a que los dos trabajan sus ingresos no le alcanzaban para poder ahorrar pero con el prstamo que se hicieron de la institucin pudieron incrementar su capital y poder ahorrar para sus hijos ya que ellos ansan verlos superados.
Paulina M. Q.: Madre de cuatro hijos, es empleada de una carnicera, el sueldo que ella percibe es mnimo por lo que no le alcanza para cubrir sus gastos familiares, es por este motivo que cual conjuntamente con su esposo elaboran calzados para la venta El prstamo otorgado por Emprender posibilito aumentar su capital de trabajo y por tanto su produccin e ingresos, que a su vez mejoro su situacin econmica.
Juana Sabina T. N.: Tiene como principal actividad la elaboracin y venta de chamarras, pese a que ella es una joven soltera, la misma se encuentra al cuidado de sus padres y sus hermanos, por lo que se ha constituido en la jefe de su hogar. Gracias al prstamo concedido a logrado elaborar chamarras para hombres y mujeres en diferentes tallas, lo que antes por falta de materia prima era difcil, uno de sus sueos es poder tener una tienda propia y poder exportar sus diseos.
Sofia V. A.: Tiene como principal actividad la venta de ropa interior y medias, como no cuenta con un sueldo fijo y sus ingresos no le alcanzan, solicito prstamo para poder incrementar y diversificar sus productos. Tiene como principal objetivo el poder ahorrar para comprar su propio lote.
Dominga N. A.: La Sra. se dedica a la venta de mandiles, se encuentran a su cargo sus 5 hijos, los nicos ingresos con los que cuenta la familia es de la madre, ya que los hijos se encuentran estudiando, con el prstamo otorgado se ha posibilitado que la Sra. pueda comprar su propio puesto y tener un stock en mercadera.
Teodora Q. Cayo: Tiene como actividad la fabricacin y venta de calzados, estn bajo su cuidado sus 6 hijos, ya que el padre se encuentra en el rea rural, es por este motivo que ella asumi los gastos y responsabilidades de su hogar. Su sueo es poder tener una tienda y aumentar su capital, para fabricar zapatos para caballeros ,damas y nios.
Flora R. M.: La Sra tiene como principal actividad la venta de frutas, tiene una familia numerosa, los ingresos de la familia dependen de la jefa de hogar. Con el prstamo de la institucin a logrado aumentar su capital y as poder comprar ms productos de la temporada y mejorar su situacin econmica de ella y sus hijos.
Irene C. M.: La Sra trabaja en la atencin de un bao publico, su esposo trabaja como chofer asalariado, sus ingresos familiares son mnimos y no llegan a cubrir sus necesidades bsicas. Con el prstamo la Sra. ha logrado comprar regalos que son vendidos en los locales que se encuentran cerca de su trabajo y as poder mejorar su situacin econmica que era muy difcil.
texts.en:
The communal bank GOSALVEZ began activities with twelve members. They live in the zone with the same name, Gosalvez, in the village of Nuevo Potos which is an area located on the western slope of the city of La Paz. This hillside is characterized by having migrants from the high plains region. In this zone they are generally dedicated to commerce, services and also to production, and most of the members work along these lines.

The communal bank GOSALVEZ has worked with our institution for five cycles, having funded itself on January 10, 2007. Currently, the group consists of ten members with a management team as follows:

- President Catalina L. - Treasurer Paulina M. Q. - Secretary Sofia V. A.

It must be highlighted that the group works with great solidarity, companionship and responsability; they learned how to save within the organization, given that in our country it is very difficult because of the social and economic situation we are going through. The reasons that motivate them to work with this type of credit, as the women indicate, is that within the association they have a safe haven where they find motivation, fraternization, a space where they feel heard and can talk about their personal issues. They later leave feeling renewed and able to again face all of their problems.

Catalina L. Condori: Has as her primary activity sales from a store that is located in her home. She lives with her husband who earns his wages as a taxi driver. Since their family does not count on a fixed income, they have turned to loans from the institution and one of this womans dreams is to see her children become professionals. One of them is in sergeants school, and the other is still in secondary school.

Agustina M. Q.: Has as her primary activity the sale of lubricants and production of blankets in her own home. This woman, with effort and sacrifice, works together with her husband to support their four children. Thanks to the loan granted by the institution, she has been able to buy equipment for making blankets and that way increase her working capital.

Guillermo M. N.: Has his own business making footwear in his own home. His wife has as her primary activity food sales in the zone of Chijini. Despite the fact that they both work, their income wasnt enough to be able to save. However, with the loan they were granted by the institution they were able to increase their capital and save for their children as they have hope to see them get ahead.

Paulina M. Q.: Mother of four children, she is an employee of a butchers shop. She earns a minimal wage which did not meet the familys financial needs, which is why she decided to join her husband in making footwear to offer for sale. The loan granted by Emprender increased her working capital and, in turn, her production and income which simultaneously helped improve her economic situation.

Juana Sabina T. N.: Has as her principal activity the making and sale of jackets. Despite the fact that she is still a single young woman, she is in charge of caring for her parents and brothers and therefore finds herself as the head of household. Thanks to the loan granted her, she has managed to produce jackets for both men and women of different sizes. Before, she was lacking in raw materials which was a difficulty. One of her dreams is to one day have her own store and to be able to export her designs.

Sofia V. A.: Has as her principal activity the sale of undergarments and socks. Given that she does not count on a fixed wage, her income was not sufficient. She sought a loan to help her to increase and diversify her products. Her principal objective is to be able to save so she can buy her own plot of land.

Dominga N. A.: Dedicates herself to the sale of aprons, and finds herself in charge of supporting her five children. The only income with which the family can count on is hers, since the children are still in school. With the loan granted her, it has become a possibility that this woman might be able to buy her own stand and a stock of merchandise.

Teodora Q. Cayo: Has as her activity the fabrication and sale of footwear, and she also cares for her six children given that the father is in a rural area. It is for this reason that she assumed the expenses and responsibilities of the home. Her dream is to be able to have a store and increase her capital, in order to produce her shoes for men, women and children.

Flora R. M.: This woman has as her principal activity the sale of fruit. She has a large family, and their income is dependent on her. With the loan from the institution she has managed to increase her capital, and in that way purchase more seasonal products and improve the financial situation for herself and her children.

Irene C. M.: This woman works tending to a public restroom, and her husband earns his wages as a chauffer. The familys income is minimal, and does not cover their basic needs. With her loan, she has managed to purchase gifts which she sells in various locales close to her work and in this way try to improve their very difficult economic situation.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of raw materials.

loan.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro P. de 22 aos de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Caaguaz. Pedro, desde pequeo trabajaba en la carpintera de su padre ayudndolo en el oficio, hasta que en el ao 2.006 quedo a cargo de la carpintera, ya que su padre se enfermo y Pedro ya no quera que trabaje. Actualmente esta fabricando muebles de todo tipo tales como: roperos, fiambreras y modulares. Cabe mencionar que Pedro ya cuenta con su clientela bien formada por que sus muebles son de gran calidad. Como sueo personal desea ampliar ms su carpintera y poner un saln donde pueda exhibir sus muebles. El cliente solicita el crdito para la compra de madera , terciadas y clavos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the city of Caaguaz.

Since he was small, Pedro helped out in his fathers carpentry shop. In 2006, he was left in charge of the shop given that his father was sick and Pedro didnt want him to work any longer.

Currently, he is making furniture of all kinds such as dressers, storage boxes and shelving units. It must be mentioned that Pedro has a well-established customer base because his furniture is of such high quality.

His personal dream is to expand his carpentry shop and add a room where he could display his pieces of furniture.

He is applying for a loan in order to purchase wood, wood pieces and nails.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: For the purchase of wood, wood pieces and nails.

loan.name: "las Emprendedoras" Commercial Bank Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento LAS EMPRENDEDORAS inicio actividades con catorce socias, las mismas viven en la zona de Villa Victoria, zona que se encuentra en el lado oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, en esta zona generalmente se dedican al comercio y servicio y por ende la mayora de las socias se dedican a estos rubros.
El Banco de emprendimiento LAS EMPRENDDEDORAS es reestructuracin del Banco de Emprendimiento DIOS ES AMOR trabaja con nuestra Institucin tres ciclos, habindose fundado el 03 de octubre de 2007, actualmente se mantienen en el grupo 10 socias, teniendo como mesa directiva:
- Presidenta Mery Margot A. C. - Tesorera Cinda G. Bascope - Secretaria Pamela VAsquez M.
Se debe resaltar que el grupo trabaja con mucha solidaridad, compaerismo y responsabilidad; aprendieron al interior de la asociacin a ahorrar aun teniendo problemas en un anterior ciclo, las socias no quisieron abandonar nuestra institucin. Las razones que las motiva a trabajar en este tipo de crdito , al margen del crdito es que las seoras sealan que al interior de la asociacin encuentran un espacio de esparcimiento, motivacin, confraternizacin, un espacio donde se sienten escuchadas y pueden hablar de sus problemas personales, para luego salir y poder nuevamente hacer frente a todos sus problemas.
Vernica Erika A. P.: Ella tiene como actividad principal la vente de t, con su actividad y junto a la ayuda de su esposo ven la posibilidad de poder mantener a sus dos hijos, la cuales actualmente son estudiantes, su nico sueo es ver realizados a sus hijos profesionalmente es por eso que acudieron a nuestra institucin para poder incrementar mas su negocio.
Cinda Gonzles Bascope: La seora actualmente trabaja como reparticin de vveres, antes ella venda comida pero la seora al dedicar mas tiempo a sus hijos tuvo que optar por repartir vveres, su nico sueo es que a sus hijos no les falte nada a esto tambin le colabora su esposo que es electricista pero la seora como madre es mas dedicada a su trabajo y sus hijos. Es una vecina de la zona de villa victoria.
Maria de Carmen C. S.: La seora es una persona muy responsable, ya que ella en todo el da se moviliza a dos lugares una que es desde Villa Victoria donde se ubica su domicilio hasta El Alto porque ah tiene su puesto de venta de pan ubicado en el Ceibo, para luego bajar, hasta su domicilio para vender lubricantes, pero es una mujer que a pesar de ir y venir siempre esta al pendiente de sus hijos, su esposo es chofer de un taxi la cual tambin aporta para la canasta familiar y otros gastos de manutencin en el hogar.
Janeth Cristina N.: La actividad que desempea es en la atencin de un punto cotel e Internet ya que ella aspira por poder ver a su nico hijo profesional pero tambin ella aspira a poder comprarse una casa para su familia sola es por eso que trabaja seis das a la semana es una persona muy dedicada a su negocio y su familia. Su esposo es sastre y trabaja en su domicilio.
Vicente C. M.: Un hombre responsable con su familia, el como padre de familia ocupa un lugar especial en su casa ya que sus hijos lo ven como el ejemplo para sus vidas. Presenta dos actividades para poder sustentar la canasta familiar y el estudio de sus hijos una la del servicio de amplificacin y la tienda de barrio, su esposa se dedica en la venta de comida, el no quiere que sus hijos sean simplemente vendedores sino sean profesionales es por eso que se esfuerza en sus actividades para poder darles lo mejor y algn da sean personas de bien.
Mery Margot A. C.: Ella es una persona sola ya que todava no encontr una pareja que sea una compaa para ella, su sueo es tener una familia que sea ejemplo dentro su medio pero ella es paciente y espera, pero as misma, ella vende todos los productos de belleza, ella con su negocio ahorrara para lo futuro para que no le falte nada tambin aspira por tener su casa propia donde pueda vivir cmodamente.
Pamela Lucy V. M.: Una jovencita dedicada a sus estudios y su trabajo ya que con eso sustenta todo lo que le hace falta para poder ser una profesional, actualmente ella no tiene hijos es por eso que aprovecha esta oportunidad para poder surgir y terminar su profesin ella vende todo en cuanto a material de escritorio con la ayuda de sus padres este prstamo que necesita le ayuda ms para sus estudios.
Rossemary Marcela M. M.: Una mujer que juntamente a su esposo velan por el bienestar de sus hijos pero el detalle es que ella se encuentra todo el da en su casa atendiendo una tiendita ubicada en su mismo domicilio y siempre estar al pendiente de sus hijos escuchndolos y ayudando en lo que pueda su esposo trabaja todo el da como obrero en una fabrica ubicada en El Alto el sueo de ambos es verlos crecer a sus hijos sin que les falte nada.
Guillermo Tito T. Cossio: El seor lastimosamente es divorciado, actualmente no cuenta con alguna persona al cuidado de l porque su esposa se los llevo dejndole solo, pero esto no fue motivo para no poder vivir, aun con esa soledad el seor sigue adelante, aprovecha los encuentros deportivos que existen en su barrio para poder vender refrescos, dulces y otros productos, tambin esta en la elaboracin de zapatos para poder tener un poco mas de ingreso, l sigue viviendo con la esperanza de ver nuevamente a sus hijos.
Beatriz Maria P. Q.: Tiene al cuidado de sus dos hijos juntamente a su esposo los dos hacen lo posible para mantenerlos ante esta situacin que atraviesa el pas, ella requiere de este prstamo para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo par ala venta de pan y con el ahorro que va a generar poder hacer estudiar a sus hijos. Es una mujer dedicada y responsable.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneurs Commercial Bank opened its doors with four members, who live in the vicinity of Villa Victoria, an area located on the west side of the city of La Paz. In general, this area of town is devoted to commerce and services, and therefore the majority of bank members fall into this category. The Entrepreneurs Commercial Bank has its roots in the restructuring of Gods Love Commerical Bank. It was founded on October 3, 2007, and has worked with this field partner through three loan cycles. Currently the group has ten members. President Mery Margot A. C., treasurer Cinda G. Bascope, and secretary Pamela Vasquez M. sit on its board of directors. It should be noted that the group projects solidarity, companionship, and responsibility; those within the association have learnt to save despite encountering setbacks in the last loan cycle. Members do not want to leave the association. This type of loan in particular motivates the members to work. The ladies indicate that within their association they find a place that provides relaxation, motivation, and companionship, a setting where they feel heard and can speak of personal problems, a haven from which they can then go forth empowered to once again tackle those problems. Vernica Erika A. P. main business is the sale of tea. Due to this business and together with her husbands assistance, Vernica envisions the possibility of being able to support their two children, both of whom are still in school. Her sole dream of seeing her children become professionals caused her to join the association to be able to expand her business. Cinda G. Bascope currently works in food distribution. In the past she sold food; however, in order to spend more time with her children she opted for becoming a distributor. She dreams that her children would lack for nothing and works with her husband, an electrician, towards this end. As a mother, she is dedicated to her work and her children. Cinda lives in the Villa Victoria neighborhood. Maria de Carmen C. S. is a person who has a great deal of responsibility. Throughout the day she commutes between Villa Victoria, where her home is located, and El Alto where she markets bread in El Ceibo, returning once again to her home to sell lubricants. Despite her comings and goings, she is always within earshot of her children. Her husband drives a taxi, which puts food on the table and contributes to household maintenance. Janeth Cristina N. plays her part at a Punto Cotel, a La Paz telecommunications company that provides Internet, telephone and cable television services. She dreams of seeing her only son become a professional, but also hopes to be able to buy a house for her family, and to attain this goal works six days a week. She is a person who is very dedicated to her business and to her family. Her husband is a tailor, who works out of the home. Vincente C. M. shoulders a lot of responsibility for his family. As the head of household, this father occupies a special role in his home since his children look to him as a role model. He engages in two endeavors to put food on the table and contribute to his childrens education, an expansion service and the neighborhood store. His wife sells food. Not wanting his children to be simple shopkeepers but to become professionals, he puts all his efforts towards giving them the best so that one day they might be persons of means. Mery Margot A. C. is single because she has not yet found the ideal partner. Her dream is to have a family that would be a shining example to those around them, but she is patient and ever hopeful. She sells all sorts of beauty products and due to the business is able to save for the future so she will not be in need. She also hopes to have her own house where she might live comfortably. Pamela Lucy Vasquez M. is a young woman devoted to her studies and her work, on the road to becoming a professional. At present she has no children and therefore can take advantage of this opportunity to be able to move forward and complete her education. She sells office supplies. Her parents help and the needed loan will assist her in completing her studies. Rossemary Marcela M. M. is a woman who, together with her husband, looks out for the welfare of her children. She spends her day in her home tending a small shop located in the house itself, always within earshot of her children, listening to them and helping them with whatever she can. Her husband works all day as a laborer in a factory located in El Alto. Both dream of seeing their children grow up without lacking anything. Guillermo Tito T. Cossio unfortunately is divorced. At present he has no one in his care as his wife took the children, leaving him alone. However, this was not a reason to give up on life. Despite the solitude, he moves forward, taking advantage of neighborhood sporting events to sell soft drinks, candy and other products. He also makes shoes in order to have a bit more income. He continues to live with the hope of seeing his children once again. Beatriz Maria P. Q. has two children in her care. She and her husband do everything possible to support them. Due to the current circumstances facing the country, she is in need of this loan to be able to increase her working capital for the sale of bread, and the profit generated will allow her children to complete their education. She is a very dedicated and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of raw materials

loan.name: Shyrley

texts.es:
La Srta. Shyrley M. de 21 aos, es soltera, vive con sus padres, es estudiante del segundo ao de la carrera de ingeniera comercial.

Shyrley es propietaria de una ropera, anteriormente desempeaba la funcin de secretara de la administracin del mercado municipal de la cuidad, con el salario que ella perciba pagaba sus gastos familiares y ahorraba poco a poco, hasta que reuni un capital para empezar con este negocio, aproximadamente en el ao 2.005.

Shyrley invertira este crdito para comprar ms mercaderas especficamente en la compra de ropas en general como remeras, jeans, faldas, camisas, etc.

Ella sostiene que sin fuente de trabajo, sin una carrera profesional no podemos progresar, ya que ella en un momento dado fue obligada a dejar sus estudios por que su condicin econmica no era la ms favorable.
texts.en:
Ms. Shyrley M. is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She is a student in the second year of studying civil engineering.

Shyrley is the owner of a clothing store. Previously, she worked as a secretary for the administration of the city's municipal market. With the salary she received, she covered household expenses and saved, a little at a time, until she had enough money to start this business, approximately in 2005.

Shyrley will invest this loan to purchase more merchandise, specifically to buy general clothing such as t-shirts, jeans, skirts, shirts, etc.

She maintains that, without a source of work, without a professional career, we cannot progress, since at one time she had to give up her studies because her economic situation was not the most favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy men's and women's clothing

loan.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Primer prstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=35911&_tpos=2&_tpg=1

Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos. Isabel es casada, tiene 56 aos y 4 hijos, Isabel tiene una imprenta en un local alquilado ubicado a 1 cuadra del parque principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos que le ayudan en sus tiempos libres, Isabel realiza diferentes trabajos de imprenta como impresin, elaboracin de recuerdos para diferentes compromisos, tarjetas, la atencin en su negocios es desde las 8 de la maana hasta las 8 de la noche, Isabel hace 2 meses compro una maquina que le permitir realizar otros trabajos novedosos, pero aun le falta algunas maquinas para implementar su imprenta.

Isabel necesita un prstamo de 2500 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de recordatorios, tarjetas y guillotina. Los sueos de Isabel son implementar su imprenta con maquinarias modernas, ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Empecemos Communal Bank. Isabel is married, 56 years old, and has 4 children. Isabel has a printing business, which she runs with the help of her children, who help her in their free time. She rents a shop one block from the main park in the city of Ayacucho. Isabel does different types of printing, such as impression, production of souvenirs for various events, and cards. Her business is open from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. Two months ago, Isabel purchased a machine that enables her to produce new kinds of products, but she still wants some other machines to expand her printing.

Isabel needs a loan of 2500 Peruvian Soles, which she will invest in purchasing cards and a paper cutter. Isabel's dreams are to set up her printing shop with modern machines, expand her business, and that her children become professionals.

First Loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=35911&_tpos=2&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To invest in purchasing cards and a paper cutter

loan.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas. Lola es casada, tiene 24 aos y 2 hijos, Lola es natural de la comunidad de Quispillacta que se ubica a 4 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, a donde viaja 1 vez por semana donde vende frutas variadas y de la feria compra quesos, ajos, animales menores como cuy, gallina, los animales los vende en el mercado 12 de abril, mientras que los ajos lo pela y luego lo reparte de casa en casa y en algunas oportunidades lo vende ambulatoriamente. Adems Lola junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con el que realiza transporte de pasajeros en la ciudad.

Lola necesita un prstamo de 1050 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra ajo y quesos. Lola suea con mejorar su casa, hacer crecer su negocio y que sus hijos estudien en buenos colegios.
texts.en:
Lola is a member of the Golondrinas Communal Bank. Lola is married, 24 years old, and has two children. She is from the Quispillacta community, which is located 4 hours from the city of Ayacucho. She travels there once a week to sell a variety of fruits and to buy cheeses, garlic, and small animals such as guinnea pigs and chickens from the market. She sells the animals in the market on April 12, while the garlic she peels and then distributes house to house and on some occasions she sells it as a street vendor. Additionally, Lola and her husband have a mototaxi, which they use to transport passengers to the city.

Lola needs a loan of 1050 Peruvian Soles, which will be invested in buying garlic and cheese. Lola dreams of improving her house, expanding her business, and having her children study in good schools.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To invest in buying garlic and cheese

loan.name: Elberta

texts.es:
Elberta es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo. Elberta es casada, tiene 53 aos y 8 hijos, Elberta tiene dos puestos en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, donde vende comida tpica, en especial los caldos que prepara durante la noche, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija que es estudiante en la universidad y que en sus tiempos libres le apoya. Elberta adems vende lea en su casa ubicado en el distrito de San Juan Bautista.

Elberta necesita un prstamo de 2000 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, azcar. Elberta suea con construir su casa mas bonita, abrir una tienda en su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elberta is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) Communal Bank.

She is 53 years old and married with eight children. She has two stands in the central market of the city of Ayacucho, where she sells traditional local dishes. Her specialty is soups, which she prepares at night with the help of her daughter, a college student who helps her in her free time. Elberta also sells firewook from her home, which is laocted in the San Juan Bautista district.

Elberta needs a loan of 2000 soles, which she will use to buy rice, oil, pasta and sugar. She dreams of building a prettier home, of opening up a store in her house and for her children to grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy rice, oil, pasta and sugar.

loan.name: Isadora

texts.es: Isadora tiene 53 aos. DesD. hace mucho tiempo ella se dedica a la venta D. comida, en el local que logr acondicionar en su vivienda. Adems por las noches tiene un puesto D. comida ambulante que le produce ingresos extras. El ultimo crdito que Isadora recibi, lo invirti en sacar adelante su negocio ambulante. Sin embargo ella cuenta que necesita ampliar el negocio D. venta D. comida que tiene en su casa, para eso necesita un pequeo capital para comprar los insumos en mayor cantidad y tener un mayor margen D. ganancias.
texts.en:
Isadora is 53 years old. Since many years ago she has sold food from a shop she set up in her home. Additionally, at night she works in traveling food sales to earn extra income.

Isadora used the previous loan that she received to invest in expanding her traveling business. Nevertheless, she says that she needs to expand her food sales business that she has out of her house. To do this she needs a little money to buy food supplies in bulk and to increase her profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy supplies for her food sales business

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo. Reyna es casada, tiene 30 aos y 3 hijos, Reyna tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada el distrito de San Juan Bautista, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, cereales, lea, actividad que realiza de lunes a viernes, mientras que los das sbados y domingos viaja a la feria del distrito de Tambo en donde vende ropa y mercera.

Reyna necesita un prstamo de 2000 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de arroz, azcar, leche, jabn. Reyna suea con tener una imprenta, establecerse en un solo lugar y ya no viajar, sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Triunfo Village Bank. She is 30 years old and is married with three children. Reyna has a shop in her home, which is located in the San Juan Bautista district. There, she sells groceries, vegetables, meats, cereals, and firewood from Monday to Friday. On Saturdays and Sundays, she travels to the fair in the Tambo district where she sells clothing and hardware.

Reyna needs a loan of 2,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, and soap. Reyna dreams of having a printing press, of settling in one place and no longer needing to travel, and of her children growing up to become working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Reyna needs a loan of 2,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, and soap.

loan.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo. Eugenia es casada, tiene 42 aos y 2 hijos, Eugenia tiene una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado en el Jr. Pizarro, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, cereales, adems tiene un telfono publico, actividad que realiza todos los das desde las 6 de la maana hasta las 10 de la noche, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.

Eugenia necesita un prstamo de 2000 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de arroz, azcar, cereales. Eugenia suea con implementar un locutorio, construir ms pisos en su casa y sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) Communal Bank. She is 42 years old, married and has two children. She runs a store out of a space she rents on the Jr. Pizarro. She sells dry goods, vegetables, meats, grains, and has a public telephone. She runs the store with the help of her husband; it is open every day from 6am to 10pm.

Eugenia needs a loan of 2000 soles, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and grains. She dreams of buying a telephone booth, of building more floors onto her house and that her children will be able to complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy rice, sugar and grains for general store.

loan.name: Leonilda

texts.es:
Leonilda es socia del Banco Comunal Sumaq Wasi que quiere decir Casa Bonita en quechua. Leonilda es madre soltera, tiene 51 aos y 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son estudiantes, Leonilda vive en el distrito de Carmen Alto y su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado 12 de abril en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende papa de todas las variedades, olluco (tubrculo), sus productos los adquiere en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad. Adems Leonilda cra animales menores como cuy, gallina en su casa y luego lo vende en el mismo mercado.

Leonilda necesita un prstamo de 1000 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de papa. Los sueos de Leonilda son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales, tener capital propio y una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Leonilda is a member of the Sumaq Wasi Village Bank, which means Pretty House in Quechua. Leonilda is 51 years old and is a single mother with three children, two of whom are students. Leonilda lives in the Carmen Alto district, and her business is located in the 12 de Abril market which is in the center of the city of Ayacucho. There, she sells olluco (tuber) and potatoes of all varieties. She acquires her products in the citys supply market. In addition, Leonilda breeds young animals like guinea pigs and hens in her home and then later sells them in that same market.

Leonilda needs a loan of 1,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of potatoes. Leonilda dreams that her children will grow up to become good professionals, that they will have their own capital and that they will have shops in their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Leonilda needs a loan of 1,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of potatoes.

loan.name: Ruthy

texts.es:
Ruthy es socia del Banco Comunal Imperio. Ruthy es madre soltera, tiene 32 aos y 1 hija, Ruthy vende pescados y mariscos en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza los das lunes a viernes, los das sbados vende en el mercado Sr. de Arequipa, los das domingos viaja a la feria de la ciudad de Quinua, Adems Ruthy reparte sus productos a las marisqueras y restaurantes de acuerdo a pedidos.

Ruthy necesita un prstamo de 2100 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de mariscos y pescados. Ruthy suea con mejorar su negocio, tener una cmara frigorfica y brindar la mejor educacin a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ruthy is a member of the Imperio Village Bank. She is 32 years old and is a single mother with one daughter. Ruthy sells fish and seafood in the city of Ayacuchos fish market, which she does every Monday through Friday. On Saturdays, she sells her merchandise in the Sr. de Arequipa market. On Sundays, she travels to the fair in the city of Quinua. Additionally, Ruthy distributes her products to seafood and other restaurants according to orders.

Ruthy needs a loan of 2,100 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of fish and seafood. Ruthy dreams of improving her business, of having a refrigerator room and of providing the best education for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Ruthy needs a loan of 2,100 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of fish and seafood.

loan.name: Yolanda Roberta

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua. Yolanda es casada, tiene 41 aos y 3 hijos, Yolanda compra tara, cochinilla y cuero, actividad que realiza en el mercado Nery Garca de manera ambulatoria desde las 5 de la maana hasta las 9 de la maana, adems Yolanda viaja a las diferentes ferias de la regin en donde tambin compra tara, cochinilla, luego de acopiar lo vende a los intermediarios que transportan a la ciudad de Lima. Adems Yolanda junto a su esposo tienen un carro que realiza servicios de transporte a instituciones.

Yolanda necesita un prstamo de 1200 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de cochinilla, tara. Los sueos de Yolanda son incrementar su negocio, progresar ms y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar una carrera.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the community bank "Amaquella" which means "Don't be Lazy" in the native Quechua language. Yolanda is married, is 41 years old, and has three children. She buys "tara" (dye derived from a plant), cochineal (dye derived from an insect), and leather, activity that she does in the Nery Garca market walking around from 5 in the morning until 9 in the morning. Also, Yolanda travels to the different markets in the region where she also buys "tara" and cochineal which she later gathers to sell to intermediaries who transport it to the city of Lima. Also, Yolanda, with her husband has a car that provides transportation services to institutions.

Yolanda needs a loan of 1200 soles ($425), money that she will invest in the purchase of cochineal and "tara." Yolanda's dreams are to increase her business, progress more, and for her children to finish studying for careers.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Yolanda needs a loan of 1200 soles ($425), money that will be invested in the purchase of cochineal and "tara".

loan.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 57 aos D. edad, es casada y madre D. 04 hijos, no tiene estudios, slo asisti al Programa D. Alfabetizacin. Vive en el Centro Poblado D. Acari, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo Puno.
Hace 05 aos que es socia del Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra del Centro Poblado D. Acari Yunguyo. Con su primer crdito D. S/.300 Nuevos Soles increment su capital para comprar 01 cabeza D. ganado vacuno. DesD. los 18 aos D. edad se fue a trabajar a las ciudades D. Tacna e Ilo, a los 22 aos tuvo su pareja y desD. entonces se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno D. engorD..
Con este crdito D. S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagado en 03 cuotas, comprar 01 cabeza D. ganado vacuno con S/.1,400 y con S/.100 D. forraje para el ganado.
Su sueo es tener un cobertizo ms amplio para el ganado y un almacn para el forraje.
texts.en:
Agustina is 57 years old, is married and is the mother of 4 children. She has no education, only having participated in the Reading Program. She lives in Centro Poblado D. Acari, in the district and province of Yunguyo D Puno.

She has been a member of the community bank Banco Comunal "Fe y Alegria" of Centro Poblado D. Acari D Yunguyo for five years. With her first loan of S/.300 she managed to compliment her capital to purchase a cow. Since she was 18 years of age she has been visiting the towns of Tacna e Ilo to work, and when she was 22 years of age she married. Since then she has been dedicating herself to the buying and selling of cows.

With this loan amounting to S/.1,500, which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase a cow (costing S/.1400) and with S/.100 she will purchase feed for the herd.

Her dream is to have a larger cow shed and to have a storage facility for the feed.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Comprar una cabeza de ganado vacuno y forraje

loan.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad. Jacinta es casada, tiene 36 aos y 5 hijos, Jacinta tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en la Asoc. Pueblo Libre que se ubica en la periferia de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, gaseosas, algunos remedios bsicos, condimentos que ella misma prepara, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos. Adems Jacinta viaja a las ferias los das sbados y domingos en donde vende ropa variada y de las ferias compra queso que vende a sus vecinos y tambin reparte.

Jacinta necesita un prstamo de 2000 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de arroz, azcar, fideo y ropa variada. Los sueos de Jacinta son que sus hijos sean profesionales y evanglicos como ella, prosperar en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Jacinta is a member of the Amor y Verdad Village Bank. She is 36 years old and is married with five children. Jacinta has a shop in her house located in the Assoc. Pueblo Libre, which is on the outskirts of the city of Ayacucho. There, with the help of her children, she sells groceries, vegetables, fruits, sodas, some basic remedies, and condiments that she herself prepares. In addition, Jacinta travels to fairs on Saturdays and Sundays, where she sells various clothing. At these fairs, she also buys cheese that she sells and distributes to her neighbors.

Jacinta needs a loan of 2,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles and various clothing. Jacinta dreams that her children will grow up to become professionals and religious like her and that they will thrive in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Jacinta needs a loan of 2,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles and various clothing.

loan.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina radica en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo Puno. Tiene 21 aos de edad, es conviviente, progenitora de un nio de 04 meses y estudi hasta primero de secundaria.
Hace un ao decidi integrar el Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra del Centro Poblado de Acari Yunguyo. Desde los 12 aos de edad empez a vender habas tostada los das domingo en la ciudad de Yunguyo, a los 20 aos de edad form su hogar. Desde ese entonces se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno y ovino, a su vez su esposo viaja semanalmente para comprar aj al Departamento de Tacna (Sama, Ite) para vender los viernes en la ciudad de Desaguadero. Con su primer crdito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles compr 04 ovinos a S/.75.00 cada uno.
Con este crdito de S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelada en 03 cuotas, comprar 01 cabeza de ganado vacuno con S/. 1,400 y con S/.100 comprar alimento balanceado para ganado de engorde.
Su mayor deseo es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Yunguyo, poner una tienda de abarrotes y educar a su hijo para que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Agustina is located at Centro Poblado de Acari in the district and province of Yunguyo D Puno. She is 21 years old, is living common law, and is the mother of a 4-month old little boy. She went to school until grade 7.

One year ago she joined the community bank Banco Communal "Fe y Alegria" located Centro Poblado de Acari D Yunguyo. Since she was 12 years old she started selling toasted fava beans on Sundays in the city of Yunguyo. When she was 20 years old she started her own family. Since then she has been tending to beef and milk cattle. Her husband travels weekly to purchase hot peppers at the Departmento de Tacna (Sama, Ite) and then resells them on Fridays at the city of Desaguadero. Her first loan of S/.500 she purcharged 4 beef cattle at S/.75 each one.

With this loan of S/.1,500, which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase 1 cow for S/.1400 and for S/.100 she will purchase a balanced feed so that her cattle can be well nourished.

Her greatest wish is to purchase a house in the city of Yunguyo, to set up a grocery store, and send her son to school so that he could be a professional.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase a cow and feed.

loan.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Anglica es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad. Anglica es casada, tiene 46 aos y 5 hijos, Anglica viaja a las diferentes ferias de la regin actividad que realiza 3 das a la semana, donde vende ropa variada, abarrotes, verduras, frutas y de las ferias compra quesos y animales menores los cuales los comercializa por mayor en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad. Adems Anglica tiene una pequea tienda en su casa donde vende abarrotes, verduras para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos.

Anglica necesita un prstamo de 2500 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de faldas, chompas, pantalones, casacas. Los sueos de Anglica son sacar adelante a sus hijos, mejorar su casa y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Anglica is a member of the Amor y Verdad (Love and Truth) microfinance institute. Anglica is a 46-year-old married mother of 5 children. She travels to the different markets of the region 3 times a week to sell assorted apparel, provisions, fruits, and vegetables. At these markets, she purchases cheese and small animals, which she sells at the citys wholesale market. Additionally, Anglica has her own in-home mini market where she sells provisions and vegetables. Her children help out with running the store.

Anglica needs a loan of 2,500.00 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of skirts, sweaters, pants, and jackets. Anglica dreams of helping her children get ahead in life, improving her house, and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase skirts, sweaters, pants, and jackets

texts.es:
Ana tiene 21 aos de edad, estudi quinto de secundaria, es conviviente y tiene una hija de 02 aos. Vive en el Jr. Trujillo S/N, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao Puno.
Desde el ao 2007 integra el Banco Comunal Generacin 2,000- Mazocruz. En un inicio con el crdito de S/.300 nuevos soles, compr carne, 02 animales degollados para vender por kilos los das de feria. Qued hurfana de madre a los 06 aos de edad, creci junto a su padre y madrastra, al cumplir los 15 aos de edad se fue a la ciudad de Puno para trabajar en restaurantes y auto sostenerse para seguir estudiando, a los 19 aos de edad tuvo su pareja y empez con la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino, alpacas y llamas para engorde, los cuales vende a pie.
Con este crdito de S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelada en 04 cuotas, comprar 02 vacas cada uno a S/.500. Actualmente ella integra una Asociacin de Artesanas y trabaja en convenio con el Proyecto Sierra Sur. Cuentan con el asesoramiento de una tcnica, quien se encarga de buscar mercado en el extranjero, tejen chullos, guantes y medias.
Su sueo es viajar a la ciudad de Lima al lado de su esposo que est trabajando en esa ciudad e instalar un negocio de acuerdo a la demanda que existe.
texts.en:
Ana is 21 years old, studied until her fifth year of secondary school, is married and has a 2-year old daughter. She lives on Trujillo Street in the Mazocruz district, located in the El Collao province of Puno.

She has been a member of the communal bank Generation 2000 of Mazocruz since the year 2007. She started with a loan of 300.00 new Peruvian soles, with which she bought meat, 2 gutted animals to sell by the kilo on market days. She lost her own mother when she was six years old, and was raised by her father and stepmother. Upon turning fifteen, she went to the city of Puno to work in restaurants so she could support herself and continue her studies. At nineteen, she met her partner and started to raise livestock such as cattle, sheep, alpacas and llamas, which she fattens and sells on foot.

With this credit of 1,000.00 new Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will buy 2 cows at 500.00 Peruvian soles each. Currently, she is a member of an artisan womens association and works in agreement with the Sierra Sur Project. They count on technical accessories, in charge of seeking overseas markets, knitting chulos, gloves and socks.

Her dream is to travel to the city of Lima at her husbands side, which is where he works, and start a business based on existing local demand.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of two cows.

loan.name: Leocrecia

texts.es:
Leocrecia es socia del Banco Comunal Retoo. Leocrecia es casada, tiene 36 aos y 5 hijos, Leocrecia junto a su esposo son recicladores de fierros, cauchos, botellas descartables, zapatillas, ollas, cobre, bronce, que compran por kilos, actividad que realizan en un local de su propiedad en el distrito de San Juan Bautista, Leocrecia tiene un carro con el cual salen a los diferentes distritos y tambin en la ciudad de Ayacucho para reciclar todo cuanto encuentran, luego de acopiar lo envan a la ciudad de Lima.

Leocrecia necesita un prstamo de 1000 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de plsticos y fierros. Los sueos de Leocrecia son comprar un molino para moler los plsticos, construir una buena casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Leocrecia is a member of the Retoo Village Bank. She is 36 years old and is married with five children. Leocrecia and her husband are recyclers of iron, rubber, disposable bottles, slippers, pots, copper, and bronze, which they buy by the kilogram. They recycle these items in a business that they own in the San Juan Bautista district. Leocrecia has a car which they use to travel to different districts and also within the city of Ayacucho to recycle everything they find. After collecting everything, they send it to the city of Lima.

Leocrecia needs a loan of 1,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of plastics and iron. Leocrecia dreams of buying a mill to grind plastics, of building a good home and that her children will grow up to become working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Leocrecia needs a loan of 1,000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of plastics and iron.

loan.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Doa Anglica tiene 28 aos de edad, estudi quinto de secundaria, es conviviente y madre de tres hijos varones de 11 y 8 aos y 1 mujer de 4 aos de edad, vive en el Jr. 28 de Julio S/N.
Hace 10 aos que es socia del Banco Comunal Generacin 2,000 Mazocruz. Desde los 15 aos de edad empez a preparar comida, lo cual venda en la plaza de Mazocruz. A los 17 aos de edad form su hogar y segua con su negocio. Con el primer crdito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles aument el capital y pudo comprar ms carne, verduras, papa, etc. As fue acumulando capital y cambi de negocio, desde el ao 2004 se dedica a la venta de combustible.
Con este crdito de S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar 02 cilindros de combustible.
Su meta es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Puno y educar a sus hijos, tambin piensa instalar un grifo en el distrito de Mazocruz.
texts.en:
Angelica is 28 years old and she completed high school. She lives with her common law husband and is mother to three boys aged 11, 8 and 1, and a 4-year old girl. They live in Jr. 28 de Julio S/N.

For 10 years she has been a member of the Banco Comunal "Generation 2000" in Mazocruz. Since she was 15 years of age she started purchasing foods which she would then resell in the main square of Mazocruz. At the age of 17 she started her family but she kept on with her business. With her first loan of S/300 she complimented her capital savings to purchase more meats, vegetables, potatoes etc. Her capital started to increase once again and then she decided to change her business. Since 2004 she has been dedicating her time to selling fuel gas.

With this loan amounting to S/.1500, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase 2 gas tanks.

Her goal is to purchase a house in the city of Puno and to send her kids to school. She also wants to set up a hot water service in the district of Mazocruz.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase gas tanks.

loan.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas. Olga es casada, tiene 61 aos y 4 hijos, Olga junto a su esposo tienen locutorios, brinda servicios D. llamadas telefnica a diferentes destinos, adems venD. tarjetas telefnicas y tambin realiza recargas virtuales, tiene 2 locales que son alquilados y estn ubicados en lugares estratgicos en avenidas, para lo cual cuenta con 2 empleados que atienden durante el da y durante las noches atienden ella y su esposo.

Olga necesita un prstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra D. tarjetas telefnicas. Olga suea con mejorar sus negocios y tener otras sucursales.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Golondrinas Communal Bank ("The Swallows"). She is 61 and married with 4 children. Olga and her husband have a call center, providing telephone services to various destinations. They also sell telephone cards and electronic recharging. She has two rented spaces in strategic locations on major streets. She has 2 employees who work during the day, and she and her husband work in the evenings. Olga needs a loan of $375 that will be invested in the purchase of telephone cards. Olga dreams of improving her business and opening other branches.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Olga needs a loan of $375 that will be invested in the purchase of telephone cards.

loan.name: Rosibel Maria

texts.es: La seora Rosibel es viuda tiene dos hijos los cuales son mayores de edad uno de ellos trabaja y le ayuda economicamente y su hija le ayuda con el negocio ya que ella se dedica a la venta de frijoles cocidos y elaboracion de tortillas, su actividad la empieza a partir de las cuatro de la maana ellas venden para el desayuno y almuerzo una parte la venden en su casa y la otra la salen a entregar, la seora Rosibel lleva once creditos con fundacin los cuales todos han sido para capital de trabajo, manifiesta que uno de sus grandes sueos es poder mejorar su casita ya que esta en muy mal estado y poder heredarles a sus hijos un techo mas digno manifiesta que agradece el apoyo y la confianza que le hemos tenido y espera que le sigamos brindando nuestro apoyo para asi poder lograr cumplir sus sueos
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosibel is a widow with two grown children. Her son is working and helps her out economically, and her daughter helps in the business. She sells cooked beans and makes tortillas, starting at four in the morning selling for breakfast and lunch. They sell some from their house, the rest they deliver. Mrs. Rosibel has eleven credits with the foundation, which have been for working capital. One of her biggest dreams is to be able to improve her little house, since it is in very poor condition, and to be able to leave her children a decent roof over their heads. She appreciates the help and confidence that have been given to her, and she hopes that we will keep offering our support so she will be able to fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas. Teofila es casada, tiene 55 aos y 7 hijos, Teofila tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el Jr. Callao, en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, carne, bebidas y tambin tiene un telfono pblico, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijas. Adems Teofila por las noches venD. salchipollos que ella misma prepara para lo cual cuenta con una carreta y se ubica en la puerta D. su tienda.

Teofila necesita un prstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra D. azcar, aceite, fideos. Teofila suea con mejorar su casa, surtir con mas productos su negocio y seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Swallows village bank. Teofila is married, 55 years old and has 7 children. Teofila has a small store in her home located on Callao Street, where she sells groceries, vegetables, meat, drinks, and offers a public telephone. She is supported by her husband and her daughters. Also, at night Teofila sells roasted chicken that she prepares; she has a cart that she places in front of her shop to sell them. Teofila needs a loan of $725 which she will invest in the purchase of sugar, oil, and noodles. She dreams of improving her home and better supplying her business to continue growing it.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of sugar, oil and noodles

loan.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
Ingrid es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua. Ingrid es soltera, tiene 26 aos y vive con sus padres, Ingrid estudio enfermera tcnica y ademas en bombera voluntaria, Ingrid vende cosmticos por catlogos, tambin productos naturales para el tratamiento de diferentes enfermedades, ambos productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares y sus ventas en mayor parte son al crdito. Adems Ingrid ayuda a su mama que tiene un restaurante vegetariano en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde adems ella vende galletas integrales que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.

Ingrid necesita un prstamo de 1800 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de galletas integrales y productos naturales. Los sueos de Ingrid son tener una tienda, independizarse, estudiar una carrera universitaria y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Ingrid is a member of the Comunal Bank Amaquella which means Don't be Lazy in Quechua. Ingrid is single, 26, and lives with her parents. Ingrid studied EMT, and in addition to being a volunteer firefighter, Ingrid sells cosmetics by catalogues, as well as natural products for the treatment of various diseases, she offers both products to her friends, families and her sales are largely on credit.

Also Ingrid helps her mother who has a vegetarian restaurant n downtown Ayacucho, where she also sells cookies which she gets in the city of Lima.

Ingrid needs a loan of 1800 soles which will be invested in buying the cookies and natural products. Ingrid's dreams are to have a store, become independent, study a career in a university, and continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying cookies and natural products

loan.name: Albertina

texts.es: Albertina Es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos. Albertina es conviviente, tiene 27 aos y 2 hijos, Albertina junto a su esposo tienen un laboratorio fotogrfico, en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actualmente cuentan con el apoyo de su cuado porque ella esta mas dedica a la atencin de sus hijos pequeos, Albertina brinda servicios de revelados de fotos, toma de fotos para documentos, venta de cmaras, rollos y diferentes accesorios, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y tambin a travs de pedidos que le traen a su negocio. Albertina necesita un prstamo de 1000 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de qumicos fotogrficos.
texts.en:
Ablertina is a member of the Banco Comunal Empecemos community bank.

Albertina lives with her common law husband, is 27 years old and has 2 children. Albertina along with her husband have a photo lab in a rented shop in the downtown area of the city of Ayacucho. Currently she depends on the support of their father-in-law because she has been busy taking care of her small children. Albertina provides photo printing services, scanning services for documents, and she also sells camera, film and different accessories. She acquires her products in the city of Lima and she also places orders that are delivered to her business.

Albertina requires a loan of 1000 soles, funds that will be invested ni the purchase of photographic developing solution.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Albertina requires a loan in the amount of 1000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of photographic developing solution.

loan.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Los Trigales. Maria es casada, tiene 55 aos y 4 hijos, Maria vive en la comunidad D. La Vega que se ubica a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, en donD. tiene una tienda muy surtida D. abarrotes, verduras, carnes, cereales, bebidas, medicamentos bsicos. Adems los das sbados y domingos venD. comida tpica y en algunas oportunidades lleva pedidos a la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Tambin Maria brinda servicios D. preparacin D. comida para diferentes eventos.

Maria necesita un prstamo D. 900 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra D. azcar, arroz, fideos. Los sueos D. Maria son construir su casa, implementar una botica para que trabaje su sobrina y dedicarse a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the the Communal Bank Los Trigales. Maria is married, is 55, and has four children. Maria lives in the community of La Vega which is located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho, where she has a store full of fods, vegetables, meets, grains, drinks, and basic medicines. Also on Saturdays and Sundays she sells typical food and on some opportunities she takes orders to the city of Ayacucho. Maria also provides preparation services for food for different events.

Maria needs a loan of 900 sols which will be invested in buying sugar, rice, fideos. Maria's dreams are to builda house, implement a boutique so her niece can work, and dedicating herself to agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Maria needs a loan of 900 soles to buy ingredients

loan.name: Barbara Herma

texts.es:
Doa Brbara tiene 39 aos de edad, estudi primaria completa, es conviviente y progenitora de cuatro hijos varones cuyas edades son de 10, 8, 6 y 2 aos. Vive en el Jr. Trujillo S/N. distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao Puno.
Hace un ao que es socia del Banco Comunal Generacin 2,000- Mazocruz. Con su primer crdito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, compr galletas, gaseosas, caramelos, yogurt (venta de abarrotes). Desde los 10 aos de edad empez a trabajar ayudando a sus tas de parte de su padre, a cambio de su trabajo slo reciba vveres y lana de alpaca. Cuando ya cumpli los 19 aos de edad empez a trabajar por cuenta propia, venda salchimote en la ciudad de Juliaca y a los 29 aos de edad convivi con su esposo, desde entonces se dedican a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino, llamas (engorde), la mayora de veces entrega alpacas, llamas en pie a los Bolivianos que viene a comprar al campo y al mes una dos veces entrega carne a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna, en un promedio de 03 a 05 degollados. Tambin pertenece a una Organizacin de Artesanas y les llega pedidos de Cuzco y Arequipa en convenio con el Proyecto Sierra Sur.
Con este crdito de S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagado en 04 cuotas, comprar ms alpaca, llamas para engorde y posterior venta en carne.
Su meta es tener una tiende de abarrotes en Mazocruz y que sus hijos estudien en la ciudad de Puno.
texts.en:
Ms. Barbara A. is a 39-year-old woman who completed elementary school, is married and has 4 sons ages 10, 8, 6, and 2. She lives in Jr. Trujillo S/N, Mazocruz district, in the El Collao Puno province.

She has been a member of the Generacin 2,000 Mazocruz microfinance institute for a year. With her first loan of 500.00 PEN, she purchased cookies, soft drinks, candy, and yogurt for her grocery store. From the age of 10, she started working, helping out her paternal aunts. In exchange for her work, she only received provisions and alpaca fleece. When she turned 19, she started to work independently. She used to sell salchimote, Peruvian street food made of maize and sausages, in the city of Juliaca. At 29, she went to live with her husband and ever since then, they raise livestockcows, sheep, and llamas (for meat). Most of the time she delivers alpacas and llamas by foot to the Bolivians who come to the countryside, and once or twice she delivers meat to retailers in the city of Tacna at an average of 3-5 carcasses.
