She also pertains to an organization of craftswomen, and they receive orders from Cuzco and Arequipa in agreement with the Proyecto Sierra Sur (Southern Sierra Project).

With this loan of 1,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase more alpacas and llamas to fatten them and sell their meat.

Her goal is to have her own grocery store in Mazocruz and to have her children study in Puno.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase alpacas and llamas to be fattened and sold for meat

loan.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 43 aos de edad, estudi primaria completa, es casada y progenitora de tres hijas de 22 aos (casada) 18 y 16 aos de edad (solteras). Vive en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo Puno.
Es una de las socias antiguas del Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra- Yunguyo. Al inicio obtuvo un crdito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles, con el que compr 02 quintales de aj. Doa Claudia manifiesta que a los 07 aos de edad qued hurfana de padre, por falta de medios econmicos a los 12 aos de edad hasta los 18 aos de edad trabajaba como empleada del hogar en la ciudad de Lima, ahorr su dinero y se vino a realizar negocio de cebolla y tomate que compraba en Puno y venda en Yunguyo. A los 20 aos de edad se cas, desde entonces empezaron el negocio de la venta de aj, que compran en el Departamento de Tacna (Sama, Ite, Locumba). Vende en la ciudad de Desaguadero los viernes.
Con este crdito de S/.3,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagao en 04 cuotas, comprar 03 sacos de aj, cada saco est valorizado en S/.800 Nuevos Soles (aj de primera), que ser comercializado en Desaguadero.
Su sueo es tener una casa en la ciudad de Tacna y que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 43-year-old married mother of 3 daugthers ages 22 (married), 18, and 16 (both single). She completed elementary school and lives in Acari, in the district and province of Yunguyo Puno.

She is one of the senior members of the Fe y Alegra" (Faith and Happiness) microfinance institute in Yunguyo. In the beginning, she obtained a 300.00 PEN loan with which she purchased about 200 lbs of Peruvian hot peppers. Ms. Claudia tells us that her father passed away when she was 7 years old, so due to the lack of financial resources, she had to work as a housekeeper in the city of Lima from age 12 through age 18. She saved up her money and established a business buying onions and tomatoes in Puno, then selling them in Yunguyo. At 20 years of age, she got married. Ever since then, she and her husband started a Peruvian hot pepper business. They buy the peppers in the department of Tacna (Sama, Ite and Locumba) and sell them in the city of Desaguadero on Fridays.

With this loan of 3,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase 3 sacks of top-quality Peruvian hot peppers, valued at 800.00 PEN, which will be sold in Desaguadero.

She dreams of owning a house in the city of Tacna, and would like for her children to receive an education and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase three sacks of Peruvian hot peppers

loan.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Doa Clementina tiene 54 aos D. edad, es casada, madre D. dos hijos y no tiene estudios. Actualmente vive en el Centro poblado D. Acari, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo Puno.
Es socia del Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra del Centro Poblado D. Acari - Yunguyo desD. el ao 2001. Con su primer crdito D. S/. 300 Nuevos Soles pudo comprar 04 porcinos a razn D. S/.50 y S/.80 Nuevos Soles cada uno para engorD. y para posterior venta en la feria D. Yunguyo. Hace seis aos se dedicaba al negocio D. chuo y a la venta D. papa en las ciudades D. Ilo y Tacna. En la actualidad se dedica al engorD. D. vacunos.
Con este crdito D. S/.2,300 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprar 01 cabeza D. ganado vacuno con S/.1,900 y con el resto comprar alimento balanceado para engorD..
Su sueo es comprar una casa en la ciudad D. Tacna para estar cerca a sus hijos, ya que ellos viven en esa ciudad.
texts.en:
Ms. Clementina P. is a 54-year-old married mother of two children. She did not receive a formal education. She currently lives in Acari, in the district and province of Yunguyo Puno.

She has been a member of the Fe y Alegra" (Faith and Happiness) microfinance institute in Acari Yunguyo since 2001. With her first 300 PEN loan, she was able to purchase 4 pigs, at .50 and .80 PEN each, to be fattened and later sold at the Yunguyo market. Six years ago, she used to sell chuoa freeze-dried potato productand potatoes for a living in the cities of Ilo and Tacna. She currently fattens up cows for a living.

With this loan of 2,300.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 3 monthly installments, she will purchase 1 head of cattle at 1,900.00 PEN. With the rest of the loan, she will purchase a balanced beef cattle finishing ration.

Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Tacna so that she can be closer to her children, who live there.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase one head of beef cattle and balanced feed

loan.name: Cresencia

texts.es:
Doa Crescencia tiene 47 aos de edad, estudi tercero de primaria, es casada y madre de 04 hijos. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo.
Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra del Centro Poblado de Acari Yunguyo. En un inicio obtuvo un crdito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles, con el que aument su capital para comprar 01 cabeza de ganado vacuno. Se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno desde que convive con su esposo.
Con el prstamo de S/.3,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprar 02 vacunos a S/.1,500 cada uno, comprar en la feria de Acora y vender en la feria de Yunguyo.
Su visin es apoyar a sus hijos en sus negocios, los cuales se dedican a la venta de aj, compra y venta de ganado vacuno, ya que no pudo apoyarlos en su educacin para que sean profesionales, pero s terminaron la secundaria. Tambin piensa comprar un camin para el negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Crescencia L. is 47 years of age, studied up to the third grade in elementary school, is married and has 4 children. She lives in Centro Poblado de Acari, in the district and province of Yunguyo.

She is one of the founding members of the Fe y Alegra" (Faith and Happiness) microfinance institute in Centro Poblado de Acari Yunguyo. In the beginning, she obtained a loan of 300 PEN, with which she increased her capital in order to purchase 1 head of bovine cattle. She has been buying and selling bovine cattle for a living ever since she started living with her husband.

With this loan of 3,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 3 monthly installments, she will purchase 2 cows at 1,500.00 PEN each at the Acora market, and then sell them in the Yunguyo market.

Her vision is to support her children in their businesses selling chili peppers and buying and selling bovine cattle, since she was unable to help them get an education and become professionals. They were, however, able to finish high school. She also plans to purchase a truck for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase cows

loan.name: Familias Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se conformo con Seoras del Barrio Constitucin, personas humildes, con deseos de trabajar en grupo, hacer un cambio en sus vidas en lo personal y econmico.

As iniciaron una etapa en donde el compromiso de cada una era la de estar unidas y ayudarse mutuamente entre las mismas, para sobrellevar la situacin econmica satisfactoriamente, siendo un comit de mujeres emprendedoras.

La Sra. Beatriz V. de 38 aos, fue elegida por el grupo para ser la Directora General, ella tiene una hija de 2 aos, trabaja y vive para la misma, realiza una lucha constante siendo vendedora ambulante de ajos por las zonas de Caaguaz. Es muy activa, alegre y solidaria desea un cambio y un progreso personal, de todas las integrantes de su comit y asegura que lo van a lograr ya que poseen el entusiasmo, la unin, la responsabilidad y la fuerza de realizar todos los objetivos propuestos por el grupo denominado FAMILIAS UNIDAS.

Las seoras se dedican a distintos tipos de actividades, que se detallan a continuacin:

-Beatriz V..Vendedora ambulante de ajos

- Adela M.. Vendedora ambulante

-Veronica R.. Vendedora ambulante

-Ahida B.. Vendedora ambulante

-Alexi Ramona B.. Vendedora Ambulante

-Octaciana Martnez. Vendedora ambulante

-Elicia R.. Almacn

-Maria Vda. de R.. Vendedora Ambulante

-Carmen Bez. Almacn

-Lucia Cceres.Vendedora Ambulante

-Cinthya G.. Copetin

-Cristina L..Vendedora ambulante

-Genara R. D.. Vendedora ambulante

-Ramona O.. Vendedora ambulante

-Eulalia B.. Vededora de ajos

-Gladis M.. Almacn

-Antonia Bez. Vendedora ambulante
texts.en:
This group is formed with ladies of the Constitution Neighborhoo, humble people with hopes of working as a groop, making a change in their lives, economically and politically.

So they started a place in which the compromise of each one got them together and helped them muually amongst each other, to overcome the economic situation satisfactorily, being a group of enterpreneurial women.

The 38 year old woman Beatriz Villabosi was elected by the group to be the General Director, she has a 2 year old daughter, she lives and works for her, in aconstant fight being a mobile vender of garlic in the neighborhods of Caaguazu. She is very active, happy and solitaire who wants a change and personal progress for all of the members of her committee, and insures that they are going to get it now that they have the enthusiasm, the unity, the responsibility, and the strength to realize all of the goals proposed by the group named United families.

The women are dedicated to distinct types of activities, which are detailed below:

-Beatriz V..Traveling garlic seller

- Adela M.. Traveling vendor

-Veronica R.. Traveling vendor

-Ahida B.. Traveling vendor

-Alexi Ramona B.. Traveling vendor

-Octaciana Martnez. Traveling vendor

-Elicia R.. Grocer

-Maria Vda. de R.. Traveling vendor

-Carmen Bez. Grocer

-Lucia Cceres.Traveling vendor

-Cinthya G.. Copetin

-Cristina L..Traveling vendor

-Genara R. D.. Traveling vendor

-Ramona O.. Traveling vendor

-Eulalia B.. Garlic seller

-Gladis M.. Grocery

-Antonia Bez. Traveling vendor


Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying clothes, garlic, groceries, arts, home products, etc.

loan.name: Georgina Alcelma

texts.es: La seora C. es casada , madre de cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad e independiente de ella,ha manejado 17 creditos con fundacion los cuales han sido todos para capital de trabajo, ella trabaja con el apoyo de su esposo ya que ellos se dedican al cuido y mantenimiento de tumbas en el cementerio de san felipe tiene alrededor de 30 aos de tener esta actividad , la cual les permitio formar a sus hijos, tambien se dedican a la elaboracion de cruces , locetas y bases las cuales ellos las comercializan . L a seora C. es una persona emprendedora que ha logrado salir adelante de su enfermedad como fue cancer en el ceno, que le ataco duarante largos diez aos y a pesar de ello a logrado cumplir con su meta como era ver realizados a sus hijos como profesionales tambien agradece el apoyo y confianza que leon 2000 le ha brindado para lograr cumpli r con esos sueos
texts.en:
Mrs. C. is married and the mother of four children who are now grown and living on their own. She has managed 17 loans with the Foundation, which have all been for working capital. She works with the help of her husband, dedicating themselves to the care and maintenance of gravesites at the San Felipe cemetery. She has been conducting these activities for approximately 30 years, and it allowed her to raise her children. They also manufacture crosses, headstones and bases to offer for sale. Mrs. C. is an enterprising woman who has managed to get ahead despite a bout with breast cancer which she fought for ten long years. Despite this, she has successfully met her goal of seeing her children become professionals. She also thanks the Leon 2000 foundation for the support and confidence they have provided her in her efforts to realize her dreams.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: For working capital.

loan.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 48 aos de edad, estudi tercero de primaria, es casada y madre de cinco hijos. Vive en la avenida de los nios, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Un da la invitaron a una reunin de amigas del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz, se inform la modalidad de trabajo y decidi integrar el Banco Comunal desde hace un ao y medio. Con el crdito inicial de S/.300 Nuevos Soles, compr 03 alpacas.
Desde los 12 aos de edad empez vender mates y caf en Mazocruz, acumulando capital, tambin preparaba comida para vender los das de feria. A los 20 aos de edad tuvo su pareja, ella segua vendiendo comida y su esposo venda carne de alpaca, llama y ovino, los cuales entregaba a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de carne, semanalmente entrega de 20 a 30 degollados.
Con este crdito de S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagado en 04 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 07 cabezas de alpaca, los cuales entregar en carne a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna.
El Banco Comunal es bueno para nosotras porque nos presta de inmediato sin mucho papeleo y eso nos conviene manifest Doa Delia.
Su sueo es comprar un camin para transportar ganado que trae de las comunidades de Wilacota, Asani, Huaitiri, Titijani y seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Delia is 48 years old and studied until the third grade of primary school. She is married, has five children and lives on Los Nios Avenue, Mazocruz district, in the province of El Collao, Puno.

One day she was invited to the reunion of friends of the commual bank "Generacin 2000" in Mazocruz, where she learned their method of business. She decided to become a member 1 years ago and, with her initial loan of 300.00 soles, she purchased 3 alpacas.

She started selling mates (a type of South American herbal tea) and coffee in Mazocruz when she was twelve years old, accumulating capital. She also prepared food to sell on market days. At 20 years of age she married and continued to sell food, while her husband sold alpaca, llama and sheep meat which he delivered to the wholesalers of the city of Tacna. Currently, she dedicates herself to the sale of meat, delivering 20 to 30 butchered animals per week.

With this credit of 1,500.00 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she plans to purchase seven alpacas which she will deliver as meat to the wholesalers in the city of Tacna.

The communal bank is good for us because we can obtain a loan quickly and without a lot of complicated paperwork, which is positive for us, states Mrs. Delia.

Her dreams include buying a truck to transport livestock that she brings from the communities of Wilacota, Asani, Huaitiri, Titijani, and continuing to support her childrens educations.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of seven alpacas.

loan.name: Ruly Mary

texts.es:
Ruly es socia del Banco Comunal Los Trigales. Ruly es conviviente, tiene 32 aos y 2 hijos, Ruly junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricacin de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compaa que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de peones a quienes renumera de acuerdo a la produccin, sus ventas lo realiza en el mismo lugar y tambin lo reparte a domicilio. Ruly en algunas oportunidades se dedica a la agricultura de verduras variadas.

Ruly necesita un prstamo de 2000 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de lea y el pago de peones. Ruly suea con mejorar su negocio, tener capital propio, construir su casa de material noble y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ruly is a member of the Trigales (The Wheatfields) village bank. Ruly is 32 years old with two children and works with her husband manufacturing handcrafted bricks in the Compania community, which is 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. They hire some day laborers to assist them who they pay depending on their production. They sell the bricks in the same locale where they're produced but also deliver them directly to their customers. Sometimes, Ruly will also work growing and selling various vegetables. Ruly needs a loan of $675 which she will invest in the purchase of firewood and in the payment of day laborers. Ruly hopes to grow her business, have her own capital, build a legitimate house and that her children will grow to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of firewood and payment of day laborers

loan.name: Demetria

texts.es:
Doa Demetria tiene 55 aos de edad, estudi quinto ao de primaria, es casada madre de dos hijos (un varn y una mujer) ambos casados. Vive en el Jr. 28 de Julio s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia del Collao, Puno.
Demetria es una de las socias antiguas del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 Mazocruz. Con su primer crdito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles compr carne, verduras, papa, etc. Para preparar viandas las cuales venda en la plaza de Mazocruz.
Doa Demetria qued hurfana de padre a los 08 aos de edad, eran siete hermanos y su madre tuvo que salir adelante junto a ellos, por falta de dinero no pudo estudiar, es por ello que desde los 14 aos de edad tuvo que salir a vender fruta, la cual compraba en Desaguadero y lo venda en las ferias de Ilave, Acora, con ello tambin ayudaba a sus hermanos. A los 26 aos de edad form su hogar y empez a vender comida en la ciudad de Mazocruz, dicha activadad lo realiz durante 32 aos. Hace cuatro aos se dedica a la venta de combustible al por mayor y menor.
Con este prstamo de S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagado en 04 cuotas, comprar 01 cilindro de gasolina y 01 cilindro de petrleo. Cada cilindro tiene un costo de S/.650.00 Nuevos Soles.
Su sueo es tener una tienda de abarrotes, un taller de mecnica y seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Demetria si 55 years old, she completed 5th year of primary school, is married, mother of two children (one man and one woman) both of whom are married. She lives at Jr. 28 de Julio s/n, Mazocruz district, Callao province, Puno. Demetria is one of the oldest members of the Communal Bank Generacin 2000 in Mazocruz. With her first loan for S/.300 Nuevos Soles she bought meat, vegetables, potato, etc. in order to prepare snacks which she used to sell in the Mazocruz plaza. Demetria became an orphan at 8 years old when her father died. She was one of seven children and her mother had to continue on with them. Lacking money, she wasnt able to go to school, so at 14 years old she had to leave to sell fruit which she bought in Desaguadero and sold in the markets in Ilave, Acora and also helped her brothers and sisters. At 26 years old she married and began to sell food in Mazocruz city, which she continued to do for 32 years. 4 years ago she began selling combustible fuel at wholesale and resale. With this loan for S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 1 cylinder of gasoline and 1 cylinder of petroleum. Each cylinder costs S/.650.00 Nuevos Soles. Her dream is to have a grocery store, a mechanic schop, and continue supporting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy 1 cylinder of gasoline and 1 cylinder of petroleum

loan.name: Rosa Nancy

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Paraso. Rosa es casada, tiene 40 aos y 3 hijos, Rosa junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en su casa ubicada en una avenida bastante concurrida, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, carnes, embutidos, bebidas variadas, helados, artculos de limpieza y 2 telfonos pblicos, actividad que realiza todos los das de la semana de 6 de la maana hasta las 10 de la noche.

Rosa necesita un prstamo de 2550 soles dinero que ser invertido en la compra de tarjetas telefnicas, gas, arroz y azcar. Los sueos de Rosa son tener una casa ms grande, surtir con ms productos su negocios y sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Paraso [Paradise] Community Bank. She is married, 40 years old and mother of three children. Rosa and her husband operate a shop out of their home on a central avenue. They sell packaged food items, vegetables, fruit, meat, cold cuts, various beverages, ice cream and laundry products. They also provide two public phones. The shop is open every day of the week, from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm. Rosa needs a loan of 2,550 soles [approximately $875], which she will invest in the purchase of telephone cards, gas, rice and sugar. Rosa's dreams include owning a bigger house, supplying her business with more products and for her children to obtain good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of telephone cards, gas, rice and sugar

loan.name: Dina Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 24 aos de edad, estudi quinto de secundaria, es casada y madre de una nia de tres aos de edad. Vive en la avenida de los nios S/N, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Es socia del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000- Mazocruz. Desde hace 04 aos decidi integrar el Banco Comunal por falta de capital, en un inicio le prestaron S/.300 Nuevos Soles, con el cual compr 02 alpacas. Ella siempre trabajaba en el negocio de carne, apoyando a su madre, cuando ya tuvo su pareja a los 20 aos de edad empez a trabajar por cuenta propia tambin en la venta de carne. Ella compra alpacas, llamas y ovinos en Laraqueri, Toquepala, Carumas, etc. A su vez lleva mercadera para vender, como azcar, arroz, fideos y otros, los cuales los vende en las ferias de los lugares ya mencionados. Generalmente entrega entre 20 a 30 degollados de carne a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna.
Con este crdito de S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagado en 04 cuotas, comprar 05 alpacas que sern entregados en carne a los mayoristas.
Su meta es exportar carne de alpaca por la demanda que existe en el extranjero y tambin que su hija estudie y sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Isabel is 24 years old and studied until the fifth grade of secondary school. She is married, and the mother of one daughter who is three years old. She lives on Los Nios Avenue, Mazocruz district, in the province of El Collao, Puno.

She is a member of the communal bank "Generacin 2000" in Mazocruz. She decided to become a member four years ago due to lack of capital. At the beginning, she was loaned 300.00 soles with which she purchased two alpacas. She has always worked in the business of selling butchered meat, supporting her mother. When she married at 20 years of age, she started working for herself in the same trade. She purchases alpacas, llamas, and sheep in the towns of Laraqueri, Toquepala, Carumas, etc. At the same time, she takes merchandise to sell such as sugar, rice, noodles, among others, which she sells at the markets in the aforementioned areas. Generally, she delivers 20 to 30 butchered animals per week to the wholesalers in the city of Tacna.

With this loan of 1,000.00 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will buy five alpacas who will be delivered as meat to the wholesalers.

Her goal is to export alpaca meat given the demand for it outside the country, and she also hopes to see her daughter finish her education and become a professional.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of five alpacas.

loan.name: Dionicia Timotea

texts.es:
Dionicia tiene 51 aos D. edad, estudi primer ao D. primaria, es casada, madre D. siete hijos. Actualmente vive en el Centro Poblado D. Imicate, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, Puno.
DesD. hace 04 aos es socia del Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra Yunguyo. Con su crdito inicial D. S/.300 Nuevos Soles, compr papa, quinua y chuo para ser comercializado en la ciudad D. Tacna.
Doa Dionicia manifiesta que desD. los15 aos D. edad se dedica a este negocio, a los 18 aos D. edad form su hogar. Continu con el negocio e increment la venta D. ropa que llevaba a la ciudad D. Tacna, pero al ver que la ganancia en casacas era poca, lo dej. Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno, chuo, papa, etc.
Con este crdito D. S/.3,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagado en 04 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 01 cabeza D. ganado vacuno con S/.1,700.00, el cual ser comercializado en la feria D. Yunguyo. Y con el resto del capital comprar 01 quintal D. quinua (S/.315.00), 05 arrobas D. chuo (S/.200.00), 10 arrobas D. haba (S/.200.00), etc., los cuales sern comercializados en la ciudad D. Tacna.
Su meta es tener un cobertizo, que su hija menor, D. 11 aos D. edad, estudie y sea una profesional ya que sus hijos mayores slo estudiaron quinto D. secundaria por falta D. medios econmicos.
texts.en:
Dionicia is 51 years old, completed the first year of primary school, is married and the mother of seven children. She currently lives in the town of Imicate, in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. She has been a member of the "Fe y Alegria" Communal Bank of Yunguyo for the past four years. With her first loan for S/.300 nuevos soles she bought potatoes, quinoa and chuo (a freeze-dried potato product traditionally maD. by Quechua and Aymara communities of Peru and Bolivias) which she sold in the city of Tacna. Dionicia says that she has been in traveling sales since she was 15 years old and at 18 she began her family. She continued in this business and increased the amount of clothing which she took to Tacna, but when she realized that earnings from clothing were low she gave it up. She currently buys and sells cattle, chuo, potatoes, etc. With a loan for S/.3,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she plans to buy 1 head of cattle for S/.1,700 nuevos soles, which will be sold at the Yunguyo market. With the rest of the money she will buy a hundreweight of quinoa (S/.315), 5 sacks of chuo (S/.200), 10 sacks of fava beans (S/.200), etc., which will be sold in Tacna. Her goal is to build a shed and that her youngest daughter, who is 11 years old, studies and becomes a professional, unlike her older children who only studied up to fifth graD. of secondary school because there was no money.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy cattle, quinoa, potatoes, etc.

loan.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Doa Dolores tiene 38 aos de edad, estudi cuarto de primaria, es conviviente y madre de seis hijos (uno casado y cinco solteros menores de edad). Vive en el Jr. Tupac Amaru s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Por falta de capital decidi integrar el Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz. Desde esa fecha se dedicaba a la venta de comida y con su crdito inicial pudo comprar papa, verduras, carne, etc.
Dolores se qued hurfana de madre a los 06 aos de edad, creci al lado de su padre y a los 15 aos de edad se fue a la ciudad de Arica a trabajar. Cuando cumpli 20 aos de edad convivi con su esposo y empez a vender comida, y jugo de frutas, tambin compraba carne en degollados y venda por kilos en la feria de Mazocruz. Una vez que acumularon capital instalaron una heladera, la cual hasta la fecha sigue en actividad.
Con este crdito de S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagado en 04 cuotas, comprar 07 alpacas para la venta en carne, tanto al por mayor como al por menor.
Su sueo es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Tacna y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Dolores is 38 years old, studied up to fourth grade, lives with her common-law husband and is the mother of six children (one is married and five are minors). She lives on Jr. Tupac Amaru, in the district of Mazocruz, province of El Collao, Puno. Because she needed capital, she decided to join the "Generacin 2000" Communal Bank in Mazocruz. Since that time she has been selling meals and with her first loan was able to buy potatoes, vegetables, meat, etc. Doloress mother died when she was 6 years old and she was raised by her father. When she was 15 she went to the city of Arica to work. When she was 20 she began living with her husband and began selling meals and fruit juices. She also bought slaughtered meat which she sold by the kilo in the market at Mazocruz. Once she had enough money saved, she started selling ice cream, which she continues doing today. With this loan for S/.1,500 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy 7 alpacas in order to sell the meat both wholesale and retail. Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Tacna and that her children study.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase 7 alpacas.

loan.name: Elena

texts.es:
Doa Elena tiene 38 aos de edad, estudi primaria completa, es viuda y madre de dos hijos (un varn de 17 aos y una mujer de 13 aos de edad). Vive en Jr. San Antonio N 293, distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, Puno.
Es socia del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz. Con este crdito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagado en 04 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar 02 casilleros de gaseosas con S/.60, 02 cajas de galletas con S/.50, 02 paquetes de gaseosa corriente con S/.30 y otros.
A los 20 aos de edad tuvo una pareja que lamentablemente falleci cuando gestaba su primer hijo, despus de 04 aos estuvo con un segundo compromiso quien la abandon con su hija, entonces ella asumi el rol de padre y madre para sus hijos. A los 22 aos de edad empez a vender carne de alpaca, ovino y llevaba directamente a la ciudad de Tacna. Desde hace 07 aos instal una tienda de abarrotes, la cual hasta la fecha viene trabajando.
Su meta es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave y ampliar su tienda de abarrotes surtiendo con ms productos, as mismo que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elena is 38 years old. She completed her primary schooling, and is a widow with two children (one of whom in 17 and the other of whom is 13). She lives in Jr. San Antonio in the district of Ilave in the provice of El Collao, Puno. She has been a member of the Communal Bank "Generation 200" in Mazocruz. With this loan of S. 500, which will be repaid in 4 installments), she will buy 2 cases of sodas, 2 boxes of cookies, among other things. At 20 years old she married, but it did not work out. Four years later she once again married, this time to a man who abandoned her with her daughter. From then on she has assumed the role of both mother and father to her children. At 22 she began to sell meat directly to the city of Tacna. For the past 7 years, she has had a grocery store, at which she is currently working. Her goal is to buy a house in the city and to expand her grocery store by supplying it with more products. This way her children will be able to study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing soda, cookies, et cetera

loan.name: Eliza

texts.es:
Eliza tiene 25 aos de edad, estudi secundaria completa, es conviviente y progenitora de dos hijos varones de 07 y 01 ao de edad. Vive en el Jr. Santa Cruz s/n Barrio Alianza, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Es socia del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz desde hace un ao y medio. Con su primer crdito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles compr 03 paquetes de gaseosa con S/.30, 02 cajas de atn con S/.30, golosinas a un valor de S/.100 y otros. Eliza qued hurfana de padre a los 06 aos de edad y ayudaba a su madre a vender desayuno en la ciudad de Tacna, a los 15 aos de edad haca su negocio por cuenta propia y venda empanadas. Cuando cumpli los 19 aos tuvo una pareja quien la abandon, con el segundo compromiso empez a trabajar en la compra y venta de carne de alpaca, la cual entrega semanalmente de 08 a 10 degollados a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna.
Con este crdito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagado en 04 cuotas, comprar 05 alpacas a S/.100 cada uno, los cuales sern comercializado en carne a los mayoristas.
Su meta es ampliar el negocio y llevarlo directamente a la ciudad de Tacna, de esa manera obtendra mayor ganancia y apoyara a sus hijos a que estudien hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Eliza is 25 years old. She studied through secondary school. She is the mother of two children, ages 7 and 1 years old respectively. She lives in Jr. Santa Cruz Barrio Alianza, in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of El Collao, Puno. She has been a member of the Communal Bank "Generation 2000" in Mazocruz for a year and a half. With her first loan of S. 300 she bought 3 packs of soda and 2 boxes of tuna fish and candy, among other things. Eliza's father died when she was 6 years old and she helped her mother sell breakfast in the city of Tacna. At age 15 she made her own business selling empanadas. When she turned 19 she was abandoned by her partner; with her second partner, she started to work on a store selling alpaca meat, which she brings to the citizens of Tacna weekly. With this loan of S. 500, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy 5 alpacas, whose meat she will sell. Her goal is to expand the business and take it directly to the city of Tacna, because this way she will obtain more profit and support her children, who are studying, until they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing five alpacas

loan.name: Kua Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo en el Barrio Constitucin de la ciudad de Caaguaz, donde viven muchas personas con deseo de progresar y ser tiles a sus familias. La Sra. Mara E. es una de ellas, ella tiene 24 aos, esta acompaada con el Sr. Carlos Gonzlez tiene 2 Hijos, y es la Directora General del Grupo KUA KATUPYRY, quien fue elegida por el grupo de seoras por ser una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, dinmica y muy activa.

El grupo es formado por mujeres sencillas que tienen una alegra contagiante, demuestran que pueden llegar a lo que quieren porque conocen lo que es el trabajo, saben la responsabilidad que asumieron como grupo; que es una oportunidad de cambio en sus vidas y de sus familiares, una forma de progreso que se les da a travs el crdito-ahorro y unirse para trabajar en grupo por un objetivo nico, la de servir a sus familias a travs del trabajo conjunto.

Las integrantes con la especificacin de sus actividades se detalla a continuacin: Mara E.. Vendedora Ambulante

Mercedes M.. Vendedora Ambulante de frutas.compra de frutas

Ana P.. Almacn

Evanglista O.. Macatera

Felicia V..Macatera

Hilara Brtez. Macatera

-Carmen O..Macatera

-Genara Peredes.Comedor en el Mercado

-Zunilda Cceres. Almacn

-Dora V..Almacn

-Vilma L..Vendedora Ambulante

-Mara C..Vendedora ambulante

-Tividad Velquez. Vendedora Ambulante

-Mara Monzn. Venta de ropas

-Antonia F.. Venta de comidas
texts.en:
This group was formed in the Constitution neighborhood of the city of Caaguaz, where lots of people who want progress and to be useful to their families live. Sra. Mara E. is one of these people. She is 24 years old, accompanied by Sr. Carlos Gonzlez, and has two children. She is the director of the group "KUA KATUPYRY." She was elected by the group of women because she is very hard-working, responsible, dynamic and active. This group was formed by women who have a contagious enthusiasm, show that they can get to their goals because they know how to work hard, and know the responsibilities involved in forming a group. They know this is their opportunity to change their lives and the lives of their families, something they will do through loans and savings and by uniting for a common goal. The members of the group with their specific activities are as follows: - Mara E.. Peddler. - Mercedes M.. Fruit peddler. - Ana P.. Warehouse. - Evanglista O.. Vegetable and clothing sales. - Felicia V.. Vegetable and clothing sales. - Hilara Brtez. Vegetable and clothing sales. - Carmen O.. Vegetable and clothing sales. - Genara Peredes. Food stand in the market. - Zunilda Cceres. Warehouse. - Dora V.. Warehouse. - Vilma L.. Peddler. - Mara C.. Peddler. - Tividad Velquez. Peddler. - Mara Monzn. Clothing sales. - Antonia F.. Food sales.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchasing fruits, vegetables, bread, ropes, household goods, canned goods, soda, meat, etc.

loan.name: Elizabeth Maria

texts.es:
Doa Elizabeth naci el 12 de Julio de 1971 en Chanchamayo, Junn. A los 05 aos de edad toda su familia emigr a la sierra, estudi primaria completa, es conviviente y madre de una hija de 16 aos y un hijo de 09 aos de edad. Vive en la comunidad de Queuani, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.
Gracias a la invitacin de su amiga Teresa decidi integrar el Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra en Yunguyo. Desde hace 08 aos se inici con un crdito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles, con lo cual aument su capital y compr 01 cabeza de ganado. Desde los 15 aos de edad se fue a trabajar donde su ta quien le pagaba por su trabajo, con ese dinero se compraba ropa y ayudaba a sus padres porque eran muy pobres. Desde los 20 aos de edad convive con su esposo y juntos empezaron con el negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno, semanalmente compraban en la feria de Acora y vendan en la feria de Yunguyo. Desde hace siete aos se dedica a la venta de aj que traen del departamento de Tacna (Sama, Ite) y venden los viernes en la ciudad de Desaguadero, paralelamente se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno.
Con este crdito de S/.2,300 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagado en 04 cuotas, comprar 02 cabezas de ganado vacuno a S/.900 cada uno, y con el resto comprar 03 quintales de aj a S/.180 cada quintal.
Su sueo es aumentar ms ganado vacuno (mejorados) para obtener ms ganancias y que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth was born on July 12, 1971 in Chanchamayo, Junn. At 5 years old her family immigrated to the mountains where she completed primary school. She is married and a mother to a 16 year old daughter and a 9 year old son. She lives in the Queuani community in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. Thanks to the invitation of her friend Teresa, she decided to become a member of the Communal Bank Fe y Alegra (Faith and Happiness) in Yunguyo. 8 years ago she began with her first loan of S/.300 Nuevos Soles, with which she increased her capital and bought 1 head of cattle. Since she was 15 years old she went to work for her aunt who paid her for her work, and with his money she bought clothing and helped her parents who were very poor. Since she was 20 she has lived with her husband and together they began a business buying and selling cattle. Weekly they would buy in the Acora market and sell in the Yunguyo market. For the past 7 years she has been selling chili pepper that they buy in Tacna and sell on Fridays in Desaguadero city, and at the same time she also raises and fattens cattle. With this loan for S/.2,300 Nuevos Soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 2 head of cattle at S/.900 each, and with the rest she will buy 3 quintals (a quintal is approximately 46 kg) of chili pepper at S/.180 per quintal. Her dream is increase her cattle to obtain greater earnings and that her children study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy two head of cattle and three quintals of chili pepper

loan.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 27 aos de edad, es conviviente y madre de tres hijos (dos varones de 08 y 04 aos de edad y una mujer de 06 aos de edad), estudi segundo de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Puno s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia del Collao, Puno.
Hace 03 aos la invitaron a una reunin de amigas en el Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz, lugar donde ella se inform sobre los crditos y decidi integrar el Banco Comunal. Con su primer crdito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles aument su capital y compr prendas de vestir para nios y bebes para comercializarlo en la ciudad de Mazocruz.
Doa Elsa form su hogar a los 19 aos de edad, empezando as a vender verduras, frutas, comida, de esa manera fue acumulando capital. Cambi de negocio desde el ao pasado, dedicndose a la compra y venta de carne de alpaca, llama y de ovino, tambin compra y vende lana de ovino, fibra de alpaca, llama y paralelamente tiene una pequea tienda de abarrotes.
Con el crdito de S/.2,300 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagado en 04 cuotas, comprar carne, lana de ovino, fibra de alpaca y de llama para ser comercializados a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna.
Su mayor sueo es que sus hijos estudien y que no se queden atrs, Elsa no pude estudiar porque sus padres se separaron cuando apenas tena 09 aos de edad junto con su hermano menor. Su padre los apoy hasta donde pudo, gracias a Dios ahora su hermano trabaja en el extranjero.
texts.en:
Elsa is 27 years old, married and the mother of 3 children (two boys, ages 8 and 4 and a girl, age 6). She studied through the second year of high school and she lives in Jr. Puno s/n, district of Mazocruz, province of Collao, Puno Three years ago she was invited to a meeting of the community bank "Generation 2000" in Mazocruz, where she learned about loans and decided to join the community group. With her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles she increased her capital and bought clothing for children and babies in order to market it in the city of Mazocruz. Elsa started her home when she was 19 years old, beginning with selling fruit, vegetables, food, and in this way she accumulated capital. She changed her business last year and now she buys and sells the meat of alpaca, llama, and sheep, and also buys and sells sheep's wool, alpaca and llama fiber and additionally she has a small grocery store. With the loan of 2,300 Nuevos Soles, which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy meat, sheep's wool, fiber of alpaca and llama to sell to the wholesalers of the city of Tacna. Her greatest dream is that her children will study and not fall behind. Elsa couldn't continue her studies because her parents separated when she was just 9 years old along with her younger brother. Her father supported them when he could, and thanks to God now her younger brother works outside the country.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of meat, sheep's wool, fiber of alpaca and llama, etc.

loan.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia tiene 70 aos de edad, no estudi, solo asisti al programa de alfabetizacin. Qued viuda muy joven y tuvo que asumir el rol de padre y madre para sus hijos, un varn y una mujer, que ya tienen sus parejas. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.
Emilia es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra del Centro Poblado de Acari, Yunguyo. Con el prstamo inicial de S/.300 Nuevos Soles aument su capital y compr un saco de aj. Doa Emilia indica que trabaja conjuntamente con su hija en el negocio de aj que traen del Departamento de Tacna (Sama) y lo venden los viernes en la ciudad de Desaguadero.
Con este prstamo de S/.2,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagado en 03 cuotas tiene presupuestado comprar un torete con S/.1,200 Nuevos Soles y con el resto comprar 02 sacos de aj. Mientras su hija viaja a comprar aj, ella se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno en el campo, actividad que se dedica desde que tuvo su pareja a los 20 aos de edad, tambin cra ovinos, porcinos y vende en la feria de Yunguyo.
Su sueo es construir un cobertizo para su ganado y seguir apoyando a sus hijos mientras viva.
texts.en:
Emilia is 70 years old, and never went to school, but did attend a literacy program. She was widowed when she was very young and had to assume the role of mother and father for her children, a man and a woman, who are both now married. She lives in the Acari neighborhood, in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. Emilia is one of the founding members of the Faith and Happiness Communal Bank of the Acari neighborhood, Yunguyo. With the first loan of 300 new soles ($100), she increased her capital and bought a sack of chilies. Mrs. Emilia says that she works alongside her daughter in the chili business, and they bring the chilies from the Tacna Department (Sama) and then sell them on Fridays in the city of Desaguadero. With this loan of 2000 new soles ($675), which she will repay in three installments, she is planning on buying a calf for 1200 new soles ($405) and with the rest she will buy two sacks of chilies. While her daughter travels to buy chilies, Emilia works fattening the cattle on the farm, an activity that she has been doing ever since she met her husband at 20 years old. She also raises sheep and pigs and sells them in the Yunguyo market. Her dream is to build a shed for her animals and keep supporting her children while she is alive.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy a calf and two sacks of chilies

loan.name: Ana

texts.es:
La seora Blanca, es propietaria de una despensa ella est casada y tiene 4 hijos, su despensa esta muy bin surtida y lo tiene en su mismo domicilio en la ciudad de Caacup compaia Cabaas.

Comenta la seora que con los prstamos que le otorg la Fundacin Paraguaya pudo surtir de gran cantidad de productos de rotacin rpida, como ser azcar, yerba, carne vacuna, pollo, aceite, fideo, arroz entre otros productos de consumo diario, sto genero ms atraccin a los clientes potenciales por lo bin surtido que esta su negocio.

Su objetivo a corto plazo y pensando en las festividades del 8 de Diciembre es la incorporar ventas de helados y comidas rpidas, ya que en aos anteriores ya experimento con estos productos y le fue muy bin, entre las comidas a ofertar son hamburguesas, empanadas, pollo, milanesas, etc
texts.en:
Blanca is the owner of a small grocery store. She is married and has 4 children. Her grocery store is very well stocked and she runs it right out of her own home, located in the city of Caacupe Compania Cabanas.

The loans that were provided to her by Fundacion Paraguaya were used to restock her shelves with a great many products that are of high demand, such as: sugar, herbs, beef, chicken, cooking oil, pastas, and rice and other products that are of daily use. More attention was generated in her potential clientele because she offered so much selection in her business.

Her short term goal is to include the sales of prepared foods and icecreams to her business to take advantage of the holiday season. Years ago she had experimented with these products and it was very successful. The foods that she prepared were hamburgers, pastries, chicken, meat patties etc../p>

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase merchandise such as sugar, herbs, milk, cookies, drinks of all kinds etc..

loan.name: Eugenia Martha

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 47 aos de edad, estudi segundo ao de primaria, es casada y madre de tres hijos, lamentablemente dos de sus hijos fallecieron y slo vive un hijo de 21 aos de edad. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Imicate, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.
Eugenia decidi integrar el Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra de Yunguyo para incrementar el capital desde el ao 2005. Con el crdito inicial de S/.300 Nuevos Soles, aument el capital y compr 01 cabeza de ganado vacuno.
Doa Eugenia relata que desde los 08 aos de edad hasta los 15 aos de edad trabaj como empleada del hogar. Con un capital ahorrado empez a vender verduras en la ciudad de Yunguyo. A los 20 aos de edad tuvo una pareja y ambos se dedicaron a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y a la venta de estircol. Hasta la fecha cuenta con 04 cabezas de ganado vacuno mejorados.
Con este crdito de 2,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser pagado en 04 cuotas, comprar 01 cabeza de ganado vacuno, valorizado en S/.2,000 para engorde.
Su sueo es comprar un camin, el cual le facilitar el negocio de ganado vacuno y estircol, al mismo tiempo que su hijo siga estudiando para que sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 47 years old, studied through the second year of primary school, is married and the mother of three children. Unfortunately, two of her children passed away and only her one son lives, who is 21 years old. She lives in Centro Poblado de Imicate, in the province of Yunguyo, Puno. Eugenia decided in 2005 to join the community bank "Fe y Alegra" (Faith and Happiness) of Yunguyo to increase her capital. With her initial loan for 300 Soles, she increased capital and bought one head of cattle livestock. Doa Eugenia says that from age eight to fifteen she worked as a maid. With capital saved, she began to sell vegetables in the city of Yunguyo. When she was twenty, she found her husband and they both dedicated themselves to purchasing and selling cattle and manure. Since then, she has sold four heads of cattle that she raised. With this loan for 2000 Soles, which will be paid back in four months, she will buy one head of cattle, worth 2000 Soles, in order to fatten it up. Her dreams are to buy a truck, which will be used for her business, and for her son to continue studying to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy one cow.

loan.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El seor Esteban tiene 53 aos, est casado y tiene 2 hijos ,el se dedica a la actividad de venta y plantacin de flores para jardn, esta en el oficio hace mas de 27 aos , Actualmente tiene mucho trabajo porque estamos en el mes de la primavera y tanto las flores como las dems plantas requieren de una mejor atencin porque estamos en la estacin dnde las flores estn en su etapa de florencimiento.

Gracias a los prstamos que le otorg la Fundacin Paraguaya pudo invertir en la compra de ms semillas, plantas y abonos ya que durante ste verano y parte del invierno la ciudad de Caacup recibio gran cantidad de visitantes lo que le posibilito tener buen movimiento de ventas.

Tiene pensado invertir en la ampliacin del negocio y para el efecto tiene pensado utilizar una propiedad que posee en una de las compaias vecina aqu en Caacup, la atencin del vivero estaria a cargo de uno de sus hijos que ya fue preparado para asumir ese compromiso.
texts.en:
Esteban is 53 years old, is married and has two children. He is dedicated to selling and planting garden flowers, a job which he has filled for 27 years. Currently, he has a lot of work because it is springtime and both flowers and plants require more attention because we are in the season when flowers are blooming.

Thanks to the loans that the Fundacion Paraguaya has granted, he has been able to invest in the purchase of seeds, plants and fertilizers since, during the summer and part of the winter, the city of Caacup received a great quantity of visitors which allowed him to have good sales turnover.

He is thinking of investing in business expansion and, to that end, is thinking of using a property owned by one of the neighboring companies here in Caacup. The care of the nursery would be in the hands of one of his sons who is already prepared to take on this commitment.


Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase seeds, plantss, fertilizers, etc.

loan.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena naci el 11 de Agosto de 1,952, no estudi, slo asisti al programa de alfabetizacin, es separada y tiene un hijo varn de 21 aos de edad. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.
Es una de las socias antiguas del Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra en Yunguyo, lo integr durante 04 aos y lo dej por motivos familiares, reingresando despus nuevamente al Banco Comunal.
Con este crdito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, aumentar el capital para comprar 01 cabeza de ganado vacuno para engorde con S/.800, tambin se dedicar al engorde de porcinos, ovinos, los cuales vende en la feria de Yunguyo.
Doa Filomena qued hurfana de padre a los 08 aos de edad, ellos son seis hermanos, su madre tuvo que enfrentar la responsabilidad sola para salir adelante. Por falta de medios econmicos no pudo estudiar porque tena que ayudar a su madre en el cuidado y crianza del ganado vacuno y ovinos. A los 20 aos de edad se fue a trabajar de empleada a la ciudad de Ilo, regres al campo a los 28 aos de edad debido a que su madre se encontraba mal de salud y lleg a fallecer. Form su hogar a los 30 aos de edad, lamentablemente su pareja la abandon cuando su hijo tenia apenas 03 meses de nacido, desde entonces ella asumi el rol de padre y madre, slo educ a su hijo hasta quinto de secundaria, el se fue a trabajar a la ciudad de Lima y hasta la fecha es quien la apoya econmicamente.
Su sueo es comprar ms ganado vacuno para engorde y tener un pequeo establo.
texts.en:
Filomena was born on August 11, 1952. She didnt go to school, she only attended a reading program. She is separated and has a 21 year old son. She lives in Centro Poblado of Acari in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. She is one of the older members of the Communal Bank Fe y Alegria (Faith and Happiness) in Yunguyo, she has been a member for 4 years and left for family reasons, returning recently to the Communal Bank. With this loan for S/.500 Nuevos Soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will increase her capital to buy 1 head of cattle to fatten. With S/.800 she will fatten pigs and sheep which she will sell in the Yunguyo market. Filomena lost her father when she was 8 years old, and she is one of 6 children. Her mother had to take responsibility to raise the children alone and move forward. For lack of economic means she could study because she had to help her mother care for and raise cattle and sheep. At 20 years old she went to work in the city of Ilo, returned to the countryside at 28 years old as her mother was in ill health and later passed away. She married at 30 years old, sadly her husband abandoned her when her son was only 3 months old. Since then she has assumed the role of father and mother, educating her son through the 5th year of secondary school, then he went to work in Lima and today it is he who supports her economically. Her dream is to buy more cattle to fatten and have a small stable.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy a head of cattle

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: For the purchase of grain (food for cows and hens) and corn

loan.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Doa Francisca tiene 48 aos de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos (un varn y una mujer), ambos tienen familia. Estudi hasta primero de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Puno s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Es socia del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz, desde hace 04 aos decidi formar parte del banco comunal por falta de capital. En un inicio su crdito fue de S/.300 Nuevos Soles, con el que compr galletas, gaseosas, caramelos, etc. Desde los 08 aos de edad empez apoyando a su madre, a partir de los 12 aos de edad trabaj por cuenta propia, venda frutas que traa de Desaguadero y venda en Mazocruz. A los 28 aos de edad se separ de su esposo, con lo cual fue padre y madre para sus hijos. Empez a dedicarse a la compra y venta de carne de alpaca, llama, ovino, los cuales llevaba directo a la ciudad de Tacna. Semanalmente entregaba de 20 a 30 degollados, paralelo a este negocio tambin tiene en la actualidad una tienda de abarrotes que instal hace 28 aos.
Con este crdito de S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar 02 bolsas de arroz con S/.300, 02 bolsas de azcar con S/.156, 01caja de aceite con S/.80, 03 bolsas de fideos con S/.90, y con el resto del capital comprar, gaseosas, galletas y otros.
Su meta es construir su casa cerca de la carretera binacional hacia el Departamento de Moquegua, instalar una tienda de abarrotes y a su vez instalar tambin un restaurante.
texts.en:
Francisca is 48 years old and separated, with two children (one boy and one girl). Both her children have families now. Francisca studied through the beginning of high school and she lives in the Jr. Puno s/n in the Mazocruz district, El Collao province, Puno. Francisca is a partner in the Generation 2000 Communal Bank in Mazocruz. Four years ago she lacked capital, and decided to join the communal bank. Her first loan was for 300 soles, and she used it to buy cookies, sodas, caramels, etc. Francisca started helping her mother at the age of eight, and at age twelve she began to work on her own. She bought fruit in Desaguadero and brought it to Mazocruz to sell. When she was 28 years old she separated from her husband, the father of her children. She started to sell alpaca, llama, and sheep meat, which she brings directly from the city of Tanca. Francisca sells 20 to 30 animals weekly. Parallel to this business she also has a grocery store that she built 28 years ago. With a loan of 1,500 soles, Francisca will buy: 2 bags of rice for 300 soles, 2 bags of sugar for 156 soles, 1 box of oil for 80 soles, 3 bags of noodles for 90 soles, and with the rest shell buy sodas, cookies and other goods. Francisca will repay the loan in four months. Franciscas goal is to build a house close to the binational highway to the Moquegua department, with a grocery store and a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: She will buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, etc.

loan.name: Gabriela Angelica

texts.es:
Gabriela tiene 32 aos de edad, estudi secundaria completa, es conviviente y madre de dos hijos (un varn de 06 aos y una mujer de 02 aos de edad). Vive en el Jr. 28 de Julio s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz. En un inicio le dieron un prstamo de S/.300 Nuevos Soles con el que compr chompas y buzos porque en ese entonces venda ropa. A los 17 aos de edad empez a trabajar como promotora de nios. Ahorrando un capital a los 20 aos de edad decidi por cuenta propia vender ropa, a los 27 aos de edad convivi con su pareja y juntos empezaron el negocio de combustible, el cual est en funcionamiento hasta el da de hoy.
Con este crdito de S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar 02 cilindros de combustible, cada cilindro cuesta S/.600 (aumentar su capital).
Su meta es construir su casa en Mazocruz, seguir con su negocio, incrementar el capital y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 32 years old, she completed secondary school, is married and mother to two children (a year old son and a 2 year old daughter). She lives at Jr. 28 de Julio s/n, Mazocruz district, El Collao, Puno province. She is one of the founding members of the Communal Bank "Generacin 2000" en Mazocruz. As a start they gave her a loan for S/.300 Nuevos Soles and she bought sweaters and track jackets because at that time she was selling clothes. At 17 years old she began to work as a promoter of childrens clothing. Saving her money, at 20 years old she decided on her own to sell clothing, at 27 years old she married and together they began a fuel business which is still in business to this day. With this loan for S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 2 cylinders of fuel, each cylinder costs S/.600 (she will contribute her savings). Her goal is to construct a house in Mazocruz, continue with her business, increase capital and support her childrens education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy fuel

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buy grass, sugar, cookies, milk, egg, meat, wine, coffee, cookies, etc.

loan.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Doa Guillermina tiene 52 aos de edad, estudi segundo de secundaria, es conviviente y madre de tres hijos, lamentablemente uno de sus hijos falleci y sus dos hijos ya tienen su familia. Vive en el Jr. Trujillo N 256, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia del Collao, Puno.
Es una de las socias antiguas del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000. Con el crdito inicial aument el capital y compr un cilindro de gasolina. Desde hace 17 aos se dedica a la venta de combustible, gasolina, petrleo y kerosn. Guillermina, a los 16 aos de edad, form su hogar empezando a negociar, en un inicio venda pan y frutas, y posteriormente, con el apoyo de su esposo, se dedic a la compra y venta de carne de alpaca, llama y de ovino.
Con este crdito de S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar 02 cilindros de gasolina, cada cilindro est valorizado en S/.700 Nuevos Soles. Semanalmente vende 01 cilindro de gasolina.
Su mayor sueo es tener un grifo y seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs Guillermina is 52 years old, she studied only until the second year of secundary school. He is cohabitant and a mother of three children. Unfortunately one of her children died and her two children already have their own families. She lives on Trujillo N 256, in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of the Collao. She is one of the oldest partners of the "Generation 2000" Communal Bank . With the initial loan, she increased her working capital and bought a gasoline cylinder. For past 17 years she has sold fuel, gasoline, oil and kerosene. When Guillermina was 16 years old she got married and started doing sales: at the beginning she was selling bread and fruits, and later, with the support of her husband, she started selling meat of alpaca, llama and sheep. With this loan of $525 which will be repay over a period of 4 months, she plans to buy 2 cylinders of gasoline, every cylinder costs $245. She sells one cylinder of gasoline a week. Her biggest dream is to have a faucet at home and to keep on supporting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy gasoline.

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, es una seora casada y tiene 5 hijos, ella es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a las venta de plantas, abonos, entre otros productos para el jardn, su negocio esta bicado en la ciudad de Eusebio Ayala.

Rosa comenta, que aparte de la venta de planta tambin tiene, un pequeo puesto de venta de chipas, en ambas activdades registra buena venta, porque esta ubicado en una zona dnde circulan gran cantidad de personas y esto facilita las ventas, adems la zona es muy conocida por la producin de chipas denominado Barrero, que son de muy buena calidad, un aspecto que uno debe hacer frente es la gran cantidad de competencia en este rubro.

Con los prestamos que le otorgo la Fundacin Paraguaya pudo comprar gran cantidad de plantas abonos, semillas y mazeta, entre otros articulos, otra parte del prstamo tambin lo invirtio en la compra de materia prima para la elavoracin de chipas.

Sus principales clientes son los automovilistas y gente que pasan por la ciudad con destino a otros ciudades vecinas
texts.en:
Rose is a married and she has 5 children. She is the owner of a nursery where she sells plants, fertilizers, among other products for the garden, her business is located in the city of Eusebio Ayala.

Rose tells us that besides selling plants, she also has a small stand where she sells chipas (corn donuts), in both activities she has good sales, because she is is located in a area where there is a lot of traffic of people and this facilitates the sales, also the area called Barrero is known for the production of chipas, that are of very good quality. An aspect that she has to face is the big competition she has in order to sell her products.

With the loans that the Paraguayan Foundation granted her, she was able to buy a big quantity of plants, fertilizers, seeds and pots, among other products. Another part of the loan she used it to buy raw materials for the elaboration of the chipas.

Her main clients are the motorists and the people from nearby cities who drive past the city going to neighboring towns.


Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy seeds, plants, fertelizers, etc.

loan.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia es natural del Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo. Tiene 27 aos de edad, estudi hasta tercero de secundaria, es casada y madre de 04 hijos cuyas edades son de 10, 8, 3 y 1 ao de edad.
Decidi integrar el Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra del Centro Poblado Acari, Yunguyo para incrementar su capital. Con un crdito inicial de S/.500 Nuevos Soles pudo comprar 01 saco de aj, negocio que se dedica desde hace 07 aos conjuntamente con su esposo. Actualmente forma parte de la Asociacin de aj y organo en el Departamento de Tacna (Sama). Semanalmente trae aj para vender los das viernes en precipitacin. Este ao empez con la compra y venta de ganado vacuno, compra en la feria de Acora y lo comercializa en la feria de Yunguyo.
Con este prstamo de S/.1,700 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprar 01 cabeza de ganado. Doa Herminia manifiesta que desde que tuvo su pareja a los 16 aos de edad empez a trabajar con negocio, en un inicio se dedicaba a la confeccin de casacas para otra persona, posteriormente confeccionaba para vender ella misma.
Su mayor sueo es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Tacna y darles buena educacin a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Herminia is a native of the Acari town, district and province of Yunguyo. She is 27 years old, she studied until third year of secondary school. She is married and a mother of 4 children whose ages are 10, 8, 3 and 1 years old. She decided to join the "Fe y Alegria" Communal Bank of the Acari town, Yunguyo to increase her working capital. With an initial loan of $175 she was able to buy one sack of green pepper. She has had this business with her husband for 7 years. At present she is a part of the " Association of green pepper and oregano " in the Department of Tacna. Every week she brings the green peppers to sell on Fridays. This year she started buying and selling dairy cattle. She buy it in the fair of Acora and commercializes it in the fair of Yunguyo. With this loan of $575 which will be repaid over a period of 3 months, she will buy cattle. Mrs Herminia tells us that since she got married at the age 16 she started working with this business, before she was dressmaking jackets so some else could sell them, later she was making them to sell them herself. Her biggest dream is to buy a house in the city of Tacna and to provide a good education to her children so that they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy cattle.

loan.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es natural de la parcialidad de Sullcanaca, Mazocruz, tiene 45 aos de edad, estudi hasta quinto ao de primaria, es casada y progenitora de tres hijos varones mayores de edad y egresados del Instituto Superior Tecnolgico. Vive en el Jr. Trujillo s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia del Collao, Puno.
Hace cinco aos que integra el Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz. Con su primer crdito de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles compr 04 bolsas de harina para la elaboracin de pan. Desde el ao 2003 cuenta con una panadera.
Doa Irma qued hurfana de padre y madre a los 06 aos de edad, creci trabajando como empleada del hogar y cuando cumpli 18 aos de edad empez a trabajar sola con su propio negocio de productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes). A los 20 aos de edad tuvo su pareja y continu con el negocio de abarrotes, el cual aument con la compra y venta de carne de alpaca, llama y ovino y as fue acumulando capital. Decidi cambiar de negocio y actualmente se dedica a su panadera. Desde hace un mes, tambin vende golosinas en la plaza de Mazocruz.
Con este crdito de S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar 05 bolsas de harina, cada bolsa a S/.110 Nuevos Soles y con el resto de capital comprar 06 cajas de galletas, cada una a S/.26 Nuevos Soles, 08 paquetes de gaseosa de diferentes sabores, cada paquete tiene un costo de S/.15.50 Nuevos Soles, chocolates, etc.
Su meta es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave e instalar una pollera.
texts.en:
Irma is a native of Sullcanaca, Mazocruz. She is 45 years old. She studied until fifth year of elementary school. She is married and a mother of three sons of age who have all finished their studies at the Superior Technological Institute. She lives on Trujillo st, in the district of Mazocruz, province of the Collao. She joined the "Generation 2000" Communal Bank five years ago. With her first loan of $30, she bought 4 bags of flour to make bread. She has had a bakery since the year 2003. Mrs Irma was left orphan of father and mother at age 6. She grew up working as servant and when she turned 18 years old she started working by herself with her own business selling essential items. When she was 20 years old she married and continued with the business of selling groceries, which she increased by buying and selling meat of alpaca, llama and sheep and this way she was able to gather a working capital. She decided to change business and at present she has a bakery. A month ago she started selling candies at the Mazocruz square. With this loan of $350, which will repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy 5 bags of flour, every bag is $37 and with the rest of capital she will buy 6 boxes of cookies, each one at $9; 8 packs of soda of different flavors, each pack is $5, chocolates, etc. Her goal is to buy a house in the city of Ilave and have a poultry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy bags of flour, cookies, sodas, etc.

loan.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El seor Silvio se dedica a la actividad de cuidado y venta de planta para jardn , como asi tambin flores de todo tipo, esta en el oficio hace mas de 20 aos.

En el mes de Septiembre comenta el seor Silvio, de que tiene mucho trabajo ya que las florerias de la zona les solicitan anticipadamente gran cantidad de flores especialmente rosa, y clavel, para poder evacuar estos pedidos se requiere trabajar mas hora todos los das, adems durante este mes tambin en la ciudad de Caacup se realiza el desfiles de las flores, el da 21 de Septiembre, organizado por la municipalidad, para este evento ya tiene una buena cantida de pedidos que fueron realizados por los estudiantes secundarios de la zona.

Gracias a los prstamos que le otorg la Fundacin Paraguaya pudo invertir en la compra de ms semillas, plantas y abonos como asi tambin gran cantidad de metros de carpa denominado media sombra que sirve para proteger las plantas del intenso calor.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio works at a nursery, caring and selling plants, and flowers of all kinds. He has been doing this for more than 20 years ago.

Mr Silvio tells us that in September he has a lot of work since the florist shops of the area order big quantities of flowers especially roses, and carnations. In order to fulfill these orders, he needs to work extra hours every day, also during this month in the city of Caacup , the flower parade takes place on September 21th. It 's organized by the municipality, for this event he already has a good number of orders that were made by the secondary school students of the area.

Thanks to the loans by Paraguayan Foundation, he was able buy more seeds, plants and fertilizer, and as well a big quantity of meters of woven black shade cloth used to protect the plants from the intense heat.


Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy seeds, plants and fertilizer.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: Purchase of beauty products for her small salon

loan.name: Oscar David

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, el seor Oscar Carrin se dedica con mucho esfuerzo al negocio de trabajo en aluminio y vidrio elaborando vitrinas y a la vez reparndolas.

Es de necesidad destacar que el seor Oscar C. es padre de tres hijos por los cuales tiene que velar y brindarles las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios. Segn comenta ellos son el motivo de sus esfuerzos. Por esta razn es que se dedica a su trabajo con mucho amor y sacrificio.

Hoy en da ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crdito para la compra del material de trabajo en aluminio y vidrio y espera que dicho crdito sea otorgado para continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Oscar Carrin works very hard as the owner of a business making and repairing windows made of aluminum and glass, in the Ciudad Sandino district of the city of Managua. It's essential to note that Oscar is the father of three children, whom he must take care of and provide with the conditions they need to continue their studies. According to Oscar, his children are the reason for his efforts and the reason he has dedicated himself to his work with such love and sacrifice. Oscar recently has turned to Ceprodel for a loan to purchase the materials he uses in his work -- aluminum and glass -- and he hopes that the application will be approved so he can continue operating his business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of work materials (aluminum and glass)

loan.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 25 aos de edad, estudi tercero de secundaria, es conviviente y progenitora de una nia de 05 aos de edad, vive en el Jr. Trujillo s/n frente al colegio, en el distrito de Mazocruz, provincia del Collao, Puno.
Particip en una reunin de amigas en el Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz, al informarse sobre el crdito se anim a integrar el Banco Comunal. Con un crdito inicial de S/.500 Nuevos Soles increment su capital y compr 02 cilindros de combustible. A los 16 aos de edad form su hogar y empez con la venta de productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes), compraba en desaguadero y venda al por mayor y menor en las ferias de Huaitiri, Candarave, Mazocruz.
Con este crdito de S/.800.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar productos para instalar su tienda de abarrotes, y contar con el apoyo de su esposo, que es el actual Alcalde del Distrito de Mazocruz.
Tiene como meta equipar una tienda de abarrotes y a su vez instalar cabinas de Internet en Mazocruz, tambin le gustara comprar una casa en la ciudad de Tacna para que su hija pueda estudiar y sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Irma is 25 years old and she went to school up to grade 9. She lives with her common law husband and she is the mother of a little girl aged 5 years. They live in Jr. Trujillo in front of a school, in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of Collao, Puno.

She went to a meeting held by the community bank "Generacion 2000" in Mazocruz to get information on the loan process and then she was convinced to join as a member. With her first loan amouting to S/.500, she supplemented her capital funds and she managed to purchase 2 cylinders of fuel.

When she was 16 years old she moved in with her future husband and she started selling products (such as groceries). She purchased her items on sale and she resold them wholesale and privately in the local fairs at Huaitiri, Candarave, and Mazocruz.

With this loan, amounting to S/.800, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she plans to purchase products to set up her grocery store. She will count on her husband's support. He is the Mayor of the district of Mazocruz.

Her goal is to set up her grocery store and also install a small internet cafe in Mazocruz. She would also like to purchase a little house in the city of Tacna so that her daughter will be able to go to school and one day become a professional.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase products to stock her grocery store.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buying an overlook sewing machine

loan.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
La pulpera Los ngeles es el nombre del negocio el cual atiende con mucha amabilidad la seora Martha C. F. en su casa de habitacin en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

La seora Martha es madre soltera y con dos hijos a su cargo el cual hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez brindndole las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. La razn por la cual hoy en dia ella acude a Ceprodel es para obtener un crdito con el cual comprar su mercadera a sus proveedores y de esta manera suplir su pulpera de productos para ofertatrlos.
texts.en:
Los ngeles [Angels] Convenience Store is the name of the business Martha C. F. runs out of her home in the Ciudad Sandino district of Managua. Martha is a single mother of two children. Her income is the only source of support for her children as she provides what they need to grow. She has turned to Ceprodel for a loan, which she will use to purchase merchandise from her suppliers and, in this way, stock her store with products for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of products for sale

loan.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es casada y tiene 05 hijas cuyas edades son D. 23, 18, 17, 14 y 10 aos D. edad, la mayor es profesional y la segunda est estudiando en la Universidad Nacional del Altiplano, en Puno, la tercera se encuentra estudiando en el colegio y la ltima estudia en la escuela. Doa Isabel estudi primaria completa y vive en el Centro Poblado D. Acari, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo.
DesD. el ao 2000 pertenece al Banco Fe y Alegra del Centro Poblado D. Acari, Yunguyo. Con su primer crdito D. S/.300 Nuevos Soles aument su capital para comprar ms mercadera (pantalones jeans). Isabel manifiesta que siempre le gust hacer negocio, desD. los 09 aos D. edad venda pan, caramelos y a los 18 aos tuvo su pareja y desD. entonces se dedica a la venta D. ropa (pantalones jeans y chompas). Compra en la ciudad D. Desaguadero y los comercializa en la ciudad D. Tacna, a su vez se dedica al engorD. D. ganado vacuno, para lo cual compra en la feria D. Acora y lo venD. en Yunguyo.
Con este crdito D. S/.3,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar 01 vacuno con S/.2,000 y con S/.1,000 comprar ms mercadera (ropa).
Su meta es comprar una casa en la ciudad D. Lima y que sus hijos sean profesionales, tambin piensa comprar un carro (tipo combi) para ir D. paseo con su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is married and has five girls, ages 23, 18, 17, 14 and 10. The oldest has a professional career and the second oldest is studying at the National University of Altiplano, in Puno. Isabel's third daughter is in high school, and her youngest is in graD. school. Isabel finished graD. school and lives in the the town of Acari, in the district and province of Yunguyo. Isabel has been a member of the "Fe y Alegra" [Faith and Joy] Community Bank in the town of Acari, Yunguyo, since 2000. With her first loan of 300 soles [about US$100], she had enough capital to purchase additional merchandise (blue jeans). According to Isabel, she always has liked doing business. When she was nine years old, she sold bread and candies. By the age of 18 she was married, and, since then, has sold clothing (jeans and sweaters). She purchases these items in the city of Desaguadero and then sells them in the city of Tacna. She also makes money fattening cattle, which she buys at the Acora fair and sells in Yunguyo. With this loan of 3,000 soles [US$1,025] -- which will be paid back in 3 installments -- Isabel has in her budget to buy one cow worth 2,000 soles, as well as 1,000 soles-worth of merchandise (clothing). Isabel's goal is to buy a house in Lima. She also hopes her children obtain good jobs. In addition, she is thinking about buying a car (mini van) to take a trip with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of a cow and clothing

loan.name: Nubia Veronica

texts.es:
El negocio al que se dedica la seora Nubia N. es el de la venta de pollo teniendo su negocio en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua.
