Es importante destacar que desde hace 3 aos que ella inici el negocio venda pocos productos pero a medida que ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado mejorar su negocio.

La razn por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crdito con el cual comprar los pollos para su venta. Es importante destacar que el negocio tiene varios clientes y por este motivo son sus anhelos crecer ms en el negocio y proyectarse a su comunidad.
texts.en:
Nubia N.'s business consists of selling chicken. Her business in located in the Ciudad Sandino district of the city of Managua. It's important to note that, for the three years she has been in business, she started out selling few products, but over time has managed to improve her business. The reason Nubia has turned to Ceprodel is to request a loan which she will use to purchase chickens for sale. It's important to note that the business has many clients. For this reason, Nubia would like to continue to grow her business and expand into the community.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of chicken

loan.name: Josefa Sabina

texts.es:
Doa Josefa tiene 46 aos de edad, estudi quinto de primaria, es viuda y progenitora de cuatro hijos (uno casado y tres solteros). Vive en el Jr. Trujillo s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Desde el ao 2001 es socia del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz. En un inicio obtuvo un crdito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles con el que compr galletas, gaseosas, golosinas para equipar su tienda de abarrotes. Desde los 15 aos de edad aprendi a vender mana y frutas por cuenta propia, a los 19 aos de edad form su hogar, su esposo era ganadero y juntos empezaron a vender verduras, carne de alpaca y abarrotes. Actualmente vende ropa, chompas, casacas, pantalones, ropa para nios, etc., los cuales los lleva a las ferias de Ancomarca, Capaso y Vilcanota. Josefa compra mercadera de Juliaca, Desaguadero.
Con este crdito de S/.2,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar 01 docena de chompas a S/.160, 01 paquete de pantalones de lana a S/.85, 01 docena de casacas a S/.250.00, etc.
Su meta es instalar una tienda de ropa y abarrotes en Mazocruz y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Doa Josefa is 46 years of age, studied to the fifth grade of primary school, and is a widow and mother of four children (one married and three single). She lives in Jr. Trujillo, district of Mazocruz, province of El Collao, Puno. Since 2001 she has been a member of the community bank "Generacin 2000" in Mazocruz. At the beginning, she obtained a loan for 300 Soles with which she bought cookies, sodas, and sweets to stock her little grocery store. Since she was fifteen years old, she learned to sell fruits on her own. At age nineteen, she made her home; her husband was a rancher and together they began to sell vegetables, alpaca meat, and groceries. Presently, she sells, clothes, sweaters, dress coats, pants, kids clothes, etc., which she carries to the markets of Ancomarca, Capaso, and Vilcanota. Josefa buys merchandise from Juliaca, Desaguadero. With this loan of 2000 Soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy one dozen sweaters at 160 Soles, one pack of wool pants at 85 Soles, one dozen dress coats at 250 Soles, etc. Her goal is to install a clothing and grocery store in Mazocruz and to see her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy sweaters, wool pants, dress coats, etc.

loan.name: Johanna Del Carmen

texts.es:
La seora Johanna G. es originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua. Se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa ofrecindola en su casa e habitacin y de igual forma en ocasiones sale a ofrecerla a las calles. De igual manera tambin se ha caracterizado por vender discos compactos de msica.

Con el fin de mejorar su situacin econmica y ampliar el negocio, la seora G. ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel por medio de los crditos para la compra de su mercadera. Por esta razn es que ella espera muy confiadamente que su crdito le ser otorgado y as continuar adelante en su actividad econmica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Johanna G. is from the town of Cuidad Sandino in the city of Managua. She makes a living by selling clothes from her house and also sometimes in the streets. Also, she has been known to sell music CDs. With the goal of improving her economic situation and growing her business, Mrs. G. is looking for support from Ceprodel, Kivas field partner, for a loan to buy merchandise. For this reason, she confidently hopes that her loan will be approved so she will be able to continue moving forward in her economic endeavor.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
El comit est compuesto por 15 seoras trabajadoras de la compaa Cerro Real de Caacup, la mayoria de las integrantes realizan actividades comerciales como ser, ventas de bebidas, de ropas, algunas tienen despensa, etc. Todas son vecinas y en algunas oportunidades se ayudan mutuamente para poder comercializar sus productos.

Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 3er ciclo del programa de comit de Mujeres Emprendoras, y la misma estn siendo beneficiada con un crdito promedio de gs. 580.000 cada integrantes.

El comit se inici gracias a que la actual presidenta la seora Lourdes C. se entero que un pariente de ella es integrante de un comit y as se puso en contacto con el oficial de comit de la Fundacin Paraguya, Freddy Bordn quienes le informo de los requisitos para formar un comits y rpidamente lograron reunir y as se formo el comit Cristo Rey.

La seora Lourdes comenta que adems de ser compaeras dentro del comits tambin ellas trabajan juntas realizando actividades con la finalidad de recaudar fondos para ayudar al club de futbol local a poder cubrir los numerosos gastos que representa competir en el torneo interno de la ciudad.

Con los prestamos que recibieron de la Fundacin Paraguaya pudieron comprar, gran cantidad de de mercaderas como galleta, azcar, leche, bebidas de todo tipo, ropas usadas, materia prima para la elaboracin de dulces de todo tipo.

A continuacin se detallan las actividades por integrante: Lourdes C. Venta de ropas

Mirian O.- Venta de bebidas

Gladys C.- Venta de dulce y frutas

Teresa A. Depensa (No se encuentra en la foto por tema laboral)

- Lourdes C.- Vendedora ambulante

- Maria E. Despensa

Teresa G.- Venta de ropas usadas

- Albina S.-Despensa

- Geronima B.- Despensa

Ramona N.- Kiosko (No se encuentra en la foto por tema laboral)

- Claudia S.-Despensa

- Maria A.- Viverista

Maria S.- Venta de Bebidas

Matilde O.-Despensa (No se encuentra en la foto por tema laboral)

- Alicia R. Venta de dulce
texts.en:
The committee is made up of 15 hard working women from Cerro Real de Caacup. The majority of the members sell items commercially, such as beverages, clothing, some have stores, etc. All are neighbors and when they can they help each other by buying each others products. Today the group is in its 3rd cycle of the committee program Mujeres Emprendoras and they are benefitting from an average loan of gs. 580.000 each. The committee began thanks to the current president Lourdes C., when she ofund out a relative of her was a member of a committee and put her in contact with the committee official of the Fundacin Paraguya, Freddy Bordn, who told them about the requirements to form a committee and quickly they were able to meet and form their own committee called Cristo Rey. Lourdes comments that in addition to being friends with the committee they also work together completing activities with the objective of raising funds to help the local soccer club covers its numerous expenses related to competing in the city tournaments. With loans that they received from the Fundacin Paraguaya they were able to buy a great quantity of merchandise such as cookies, sugar, milk, all kinds of beverages, used clothing, raw ingredients to make candy. Below is additional information about each members work: Lourdes C. Sells clothing Mirian O. Sells beverages Gladys C. Sells candy and fruit Teresa A. Has a store (she is not in the photo because of work) Lourdes C. Street vendor Maria E. Has a store Teresa G. Sells used clothing Albina S. Has a store Geronima B. Has a store Ramona N. - Kiosk (she is not in the photo because of work) Claudia S. Has a store Maria A. - Sells plants

Maria S. Sells beverages Matilde O. Has a store (she is not in the photo because of work) Alicia R. Sells candy

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy soda pop, meat, noodles, tea, sugar, cookies, milk, used clothing, ingredients to make candy, etc.

loan.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua, la seora Sandra Calderon se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de pulpera atendido por ella misma en su casa de habitacin. Como todo negocio en desarrollo, la pulpera de la seora Sandra requiera de inversin y para ello ha buscado el apoyo financiero en Ceprodel para solicitar el crdito para la compra de la mercadera.

Actualmente ella posee un record de dos crditos en Ceprodel y se ha destacado como fiel cliente de la institucin por haber cancelado satisfactoriamente sus anteriores crditos.
texts.en:
In the town Cuidad Sandino of Managua, Mrs. Sandra Calderon makes a living by putting forth a strong effort in her business, a small grocery store run from her home. Like all businesses in development, Sandras small store requires investment, and for this, she is asking for financial support from Ceprodel by applying for a loan to buy merchandise. Currently, she has a record of two loans from Ceprodel and has stood out as a loyal customer for having sufficiently paid back her previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 50 aos de edad, estudi hasta el primer ao de primaria, es casada y madre de tres hijos varones y una mujer, mayores de edad. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Imicate, distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.
Por falta de capital decidi integrar el Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra en Yunguyo.
Con este crdito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas tiene planificado comprar 02 arrobas de chuo, 02 arrobas de haba, 02 arrobas de tarwi, 04 arrobas de papa, los cuales sern comercializados en la ciudad de Tacna.
Doa Julia, a los 18 aos de edad, empez a vender los productos ya mencionados, a los 20 aos, form su hogar y continu su negocio hasta la actualidad.
Su sueo es comprar una moto taxi para que su esposo pueda trabajar, as podrn ahorrar ms dinero para instalar una tienda de abarrotes en el Centro Poblado de Imicate.
texts.en:
Julia is 50 years old, is married with 3 sons, and only studied until her first year in grade school. She is a woman old with age. She lives in downtown Imicate, a district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. Due to a lack of capital, she decided to call upon the community bank, Faith and Happiness in Yunguyo. With this loan of 500 Nuevos Soles, which she will pay back in 4 payments, she plans to buy 60 pounds of flour, 60 pounds of beans, 60 pounds of tarwi (a legume), and 120 pounds of potatoes, with which will be sold in the city of Tacna. At 18 years old, Julia started to sell the above mentioned products. At 20 years old, she started her home and continued her business until now. Her dream is to buy a taxi so that her husband can work. In this way, they will be able to save more money and establish a grocery store in downtown Imicate.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy flour, beans, tarwi, potatoes, etc.

loan.name: Yuri Janeth

texts.es:
Yuri inicio el negocio para apoyar a su esposo, y as tener mas ingresos para ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 pequeos hijos de 4 y 2 aos. la idea de trabajar en su propio negocio siempre la ha entusiasmado es por eso que decidi elaborar y vender tacos en su casa, y actualmente goza de buena clientela.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $325 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima y as poder ofrecer su servicio hasta mas tare, ya que en ocasiones se le acaba y tiene que cerrar el negocio.
texts.en:
Yuri began her business to support her husband and increase their income so that they may offer a better quality of life to their two little children, who are two and four years old. The idea of working in her own business always excited her and it's for this reason that she decided to make and sell tacos in her home, and presently she enjoys a good clientele. She needs a loan of $325, which she will pay back in three months, in order to buy more raw materials to be able to offer her service later in the day, since there are times when she runs out of ingredients and has to close the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: buy ingredients

loan.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza naci el 10 de Octubre de 1953, no estudi slo asisti al Programa de Alfabetizacin, es conviviente y madre de dos hijos (un varn de 23 aos, casado y una mujer de 16 aos, soltera), vive en el Jr. Tupac Amaru s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia de El Collao, Puno.
Hace 08 aos fue socia fundadora en el Banco Comunal Conduriri y desde el ao pasado se cambi al Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz. Con el crdito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles compr golosinas, negocio al cual se dedica desde hace 06 aos hasta la fecha. Reparte al por mayor y al por menor en las tiendas y vende al por menor en la plaza de Ilave. Lorenza manifiesta que durante 18 aos venda carne de alpaca, la cual llevaba directo a la ciudad de Tacna, tambin venda verduras en Conduriri, conjuntamente con su esposo.
Con este crdito de S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar 04 cajas de galletas con S/. 160, 05 cajas de chocolates con S/.100, 10 bolsas de caramelos con S/.100 y otros, los cuales sern distribuidos en la ciudad de Ilave, en Mazocruz.
Su sueo es poner una tienda de abarrotes en Mazocruz y que su hija estudie.
texts.en:
Lorenza was born on October 10, 1953. She did not study past learning the alphabet, shares a home, and is a mother of two children (a 23 year old married man, and a 16 year old single woman). She lives in Jr. Tupac Amaru s/n, Mazocruz district, El Collao province, Puno. Eight years ago, she was a founding customer of the Banco Comunal Conduriri. Last year, she changed her bank to Banco Comunal Generation 2000 in Mazocruz. With a loan of 500 Nuevos Soles, she bought candies, a business which she has been doing for 6 years to date. She sells wholesale and retail to small stores and sells retail in the key plaza. Lorenza says that she sold alpaca meat for 18 years, which she brought directly to the city Tacna. Also, she sold vegetables in Conduriri, together with her husband. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles, which she will pay back in 4 payments, she will buy four boxes of cookies for S/ .160, 5 boxes of chocolates for S/.100, 10 bags of caramels for S/.100 and more, with which she will sell to the key city, in Mazocruz. Her dream is to put a grocery store in Mazocruz and that her daughter will study.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy cookies, chocolates, caramels, etc.

loan.name: Mara Francisca

texts.es:
La seora Maria Francisca M. es originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino en la ciudad de Managua. Desde hace dos aos inici su pequeo negocio de mini pulpera atendido en su casa de habitacin.

La mini pulpera de la seora M. se ha venido desarrollando poco a poco a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo y Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en el negocio por lo que le ha beneficiado con crditos que los ha usado en la compra de sus productos. La razn por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crdito con el cual comprar su mercadera y as continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Francisca M. is from the town of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua. Two years ago, she started her small business of a mini grocery store run out of her home. Mrs. M.s mini grocery store has developed little by little as time has passed. Ceprodel, Kivas field partner, has been a pillar for the business because it has given Maria loans that have been used to buy products. The reason she is soliciting Ceprodel is for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise so that she can continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy products

loan.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juany inicio su negocio en su casa con la elaboracin y venta de comidas as como la elaboracin de empanadas. Ella inicio el negocio para apoyar la economa familiar ya que su esposo trabaja como albail y no tiene un ingreso fijo; empez vendiendo entre sus amistades y poco a poco ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $325 que pagara en 3 meses para tener materia prima y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Juany started her business at home. She prepares and sells meals and empanadas (turnovers). She initiated the business to support the family's economy since her husband works as bricklayer and he doesn't have a fixed income. She started selling among her friends and little by little she has managed to make her business.

She needs a loan of $325 which will be repaid over a period of 3 months, she wants tol buy raw materials and be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy raw materials.

loan.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La seora Gloria G. es una dama muy esforzada ya que siempre ha llevado el pan diario a su mesa para beneficiar a su pequeo hijo y lo hace por medio de su ardua labor de venta de cosmticos en el municipio Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

Hoy en da la seora Gloria ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo proporcionado por Ceprodel el cual lo ha utilizado para la compra de los cosmticos. Una vez ms ha solicitado el apoyo ya que requiere comprar de sus proveedores dichos productos. Segn comenta continuara con estos crditos para mejorar la condicin econmica de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria G. is a hard-working woman who has always put the daily food on the table for her small son, and she does this by means of her arduous efforts selling cosmetic products in the Sandino City municipality in Managua.

These days, Gloria has managed to get ahead thanks to the support provided by Ceprodel which she has used for the purchase of the cosmetics. Once again, she has solicited the support she needs to buy said products from her suppliers. She comments that she will continue with the loans in order to improve her familys financial situation.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of cosmetic products.

loan.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es natural del Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno. Tiene 51 aos de edad, slo estudi primero de primaria, es casada y madre de 06 hijos, de los cuales 04 tienen su pareja y 02 son solteros.
Desde el ao 2002 es socia del Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra del Centro Poblado de Acari, Yunguyo. Se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa (casacas, buzos, conjunto y Jeans), compra en la ciudad de Desaguadero y vende en la ciudad de Ilo, tanto al por mayor como al por menor. Paralelo a este negocio lleva, papa, chuo, oca y haba a la ciudad de Ilo.
Doa Margarita manifiesta que a los 13 aos qued hurfana de padre y junto a su madre se apoyan para seguir adelante. A los 20 aos de edad empez a dedicarse al negocio, venda pan y pescado en el mismo Centro Poblado de Acari.
Con este crdito de S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprar mercadera (casacas, conjuntos para nios, etc.).
Su sueo es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilo e instalar una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Margarita is a native of Centro Poblado de Acari, Yunguyo. She is 51 years old and only had one year of school. She's married with six children, four of whom are married and two who are single. Since 2002, she has been a member of the "Faith and Joy" Community Bank in her hometown. She makes a living selling clothes (frock coats, sweatshirts, outfits and jenas), which she buys in the city of Desaguadero and sells in the city of Ilo, both at wholesale and retail. Along with this business she also takes potatoes, potato flour and beans to Ilo. She started in commerce at age 20, selling bread and fish in her hometown. With this loan, which she plans to repay in three months, she will purchase supplies (frock coats, children's outfits, etc.). Her dream is to buy a house in Ilo and set up a convenience store there.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase supplies (frock coats, children's outfits, etc.)

loan.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua la seora Mara Auxiliadora P. se dedica al negocio de pulpera desde hace 1 ao. Gracias a sus mltiples esfuerzos ha logrado salir adelante y llevar el sustento a su casa de habitacin.

A pesar de las dificultades econmicas que ha atravesado, ha logrado mantener el negocio y se ha apoyado de los crditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha utilizado para la compra de su mercadera. Una vez ms solicita un prstamo y es de importancia destacar que se encuentra muy confiada que su peticin ser otorgada y de esta forma invertir en su negocio de pulpera.
texts.en:
In the town of Cuidad Sandino en Managua, Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora Perez has made a living over the past year from her small market. Thanks to her many efforts, she has been able to progress and bring food to her home. Aside from the economic difficulties that have transpired, she has been able to maintain her business and has been helped by the loans granted to her by Ceprodel. She has used these loans to purchase merchandise. Again, she is asking for a loan and emphasizes that she is hopeful her request will be approved, which she will invest in her small market.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comit est integrado por 15 seoras trabajadoras del barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Caacup, todas se dedican a la elaboracin y venta de chipas en forma ambulante, ellas estn en el 8to. Ciclo del programa comit de Mujeres Emprendedoras y como son del barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Caacup tienen una caracterstica muy especial todas sus integrantes son seoras que se dedican a una misma actividad todas son chiperas, actualmente el grupo maneja una lnea de crdito promedio de gs. 926.000 por cada integrante.

Las chipas son una comida tpica muy consumida en nuestro pas, y especialmente en la ciudad de Caacup en donde es una de las ciudades que se caracterizan por la venta de este producto tpico.

Manifiestan las seoras que los prstamos que obtuvieron de la Fundacin Paraguaya lo invirtieron en la compra de almidn, aceite vegetal, queso, leas en gran cantidad, esto le permiti tener una buena produccin de chipas, lo que le permiti a su vez tener una muy buena venta.

La presidenta del comit en nombre de todas sus compaeras y el de ella agradece a la Fundacin Paraguaya por permitirles ser parte de este programa que tiene una finalidad muy noble, apoyar a la gente trabajadora de escasos recursos y marginados por el sistema financiero formal del pas.
texts.en:
The committee is composed of 15 hard working women from the San Francisco region in the city of Caacupe. They all make corn and cheese breads (chipas) and sell their products door to door. They are currently going through their 8th cycle in the program Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) and because they are all from San Francisco in Caacupe they all share one common factor: they all make corn and cheese breads. Currently the group holds a line of credit averaging 926,000 gs. per member.

Chipas are a very traditional food that is very popular in our country, especially in the city of Caacupe. The city has even earn a reputation as a source of this popular product.

The loans that were obtained through Fundacion Paraguaya wer einvested in the purchase of starch, vegetable oil, cheese, and fire wood in great quantities. This permitted them to have good production of their corn and cheese breads, which in turn resulted in very good sales.

The president of the committee, on behalf of all of her colleague, wish to thank the Fundacion Paraguaya for permitting them to be part of this program that has a very noble mission: to support hard working people of small means and those that are marginalized by the economic system of the country.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase ingredients to produce Chipas, such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil, firewood, flour, milk, etc.

loan.name: Danilo Jos

texts.es:
El seor Danilo P. se dedica al negocio de venta de repuestos de todo tipo para motocicletas atendindolo en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino donde es originario.

El negocio comenz desde hace 3 aos ofertando pocos repuestos pero muy sabiamente se ha apoyado de los crditos brindados por Ceprodel y gracias a estos ha logrado mejorar y aumentar la cantidad de repuestos para ofertar.

La principal razn por la que hoy en da ha solicitado el crdito es para la compra de dichos repuesto con el propsito de ofrecerlos en su comunidad. ES de importancia destacar que l ha sido un buen cliente de la institucin y son sus anhelos continuar hasta mejorar todo su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Danilo P. sells parts for all makes of motorcycles in the city where he was born, Ciudad Sandino. He began his business 3 years ago offering a few parts but very wisely he has supported himself through loans provided by Ceprodel and thanks to these loans he has been able to improve and expand the quantity of parts that he offers. The reason for his loan today is to buy parts with the intention of selling them in the community. It is important to note that he has been a good client of this institution and his goals are to continue improving his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase motorcycle parts

loan.name: Esmeralda Janeth

texts.es:
Esmeralda es una mujer emprendedora y ejemplar que siempre ha tratado de salir adelante por iniciativa propia, por la necesidad de apoyar en el gasto del hogar a su esposo y de sus 3 hijos de: 4, 3 y 1 aos; por eso se dedica a la venta de productos cosmticos, actividad que le ha ayudado a salir adelante.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $725 que pagara en 6 meses para comparar mercancia y asi poder cumplir con unos pedidos que ya tiene por entregar.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is an entrepreneurial and model woman who always has tried to get ahead with her own initiative through the need to financially support her husband and their three children of 4, 3, and one years. As a result, she is dedicated to the sale of cosmetic products, an activity that has helped her get ahead.

She needs a loan of US $725, which she will repay in six months, in order to purchase merchandise and supply some orders that she already has.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchadise.

loan.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita naci el 10 D. Junio D. 1951, en la actualidad tiene 57 aos D. edad, es madre D. siete hijos (04 mujeres y 03 varones), slo estudi hasta el primer ao D. primaria y a los 40 aos D. edad qued V.. Vive en el Centro Poblado D. Acari, distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo.
DesD. que se form el Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra del Centro Poblado D. Acari, Yunguyo viene trabajando hasta la fecha. Con su primer crdito D. S/.300 Nuevos Soles aument el capital y compr 01 cabeza D. ganado vacuno con S/.500. DesD. los 17 aos D. edad empez a dedicarse al negocio en la compra y venta D. mantas, sombreros, chompas. Compraba en Desaguadero y lo venda en la ciudad D. Juliaca. En la actualidad se dedica al engorD. D. porcinos y a la venta D. aj.
Con este prstamo D. S/.2,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprar 02 porcinos a un precio D. S/.100 y D. S/.150 cada uno y la diferencia lo invertir en 04 sacos D. aj, cada saco est valorizado a S/.400.
Su mayor sueo es tener un pequeo establo D. ganado vacuno y que sus seis hijos continen con el negocio D. confeccin y venta D. casacas en la ciudad D. Lima. Uno D. sus hijos vive en la comunidad D. Cuturapi Yunguyo.
texts.en:
Margarita was born Juno 10, 1951, and is now 57 years old. She is a mother of seven children (four girls, three boys). She only had one year of elementary school education and was widowed at 40. She lives in Centro Pablado D. Acari, and since the Faith and Joy Community Bank was formed she has been working. With her first loan she raised capital to buy one head of cattle. Since she was 17 years old she maD. a living buying and selling traditional blankets, hats and sweaters. She bought her products in Desaguadero and sold them in the city of Juliaca. Currently, she makes a living raising pigs and selling chili peppers. With the loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within three months, she will purchase two pigs and invest the rest in the purchase of chilis (four sacks' worth). Her biggest dream is to have a small stable of cattle and for six of her children to continue their frock coat business in Lima. One of her kids lives in the community of Cuturapi Yunguyo.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase two pigs and four sacks of chili peppers

loan.name: Lesbia De Los ngeles

texts.es:
La seora Lesbia S. se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente cocinera ya que desde hace varios aos se dedica a su negocio de elaboracin y venta de comida y bebidas teniendo su propio establecimiento en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua.

Hoy en da el motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crdito para la elaboracin de los alimentos. Espera muy confiadamente que su crdito ser aprobado y as continuar en su actividad econmica.
texts.en:
Lesbia Sanchez is known to be an excellent cook and for many years has been making and selling food and drinks from her own establishment in the county of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua.

Now her motive for coming to Ceprodel is to get credit to make the food she sells. She confidently awaits her credit being approved so that she can continue with this economic activity.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy raw materials/Compra de materia prima

loan.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa emprendi su negocio para apoyar a su esposo y a la vez solventarlos gastos de sus 2 pequeos hijos de 6 y 4 aos. Ella inicio vendiendo artculos de limpieza casa por casa hasta tener clientes en la colonia y luego los mismos empezaron a ir al domicilio a comprar la mercanca, y as se fue haciendo de clientes.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $725 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercanca y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa started her business to help her husband and to cover the costs of their 2 young kids who are 6 and 4 years old. She started off selling cleaning products house by house and even has clients in 'La Colonia' and later they started to come to her house to buy merchandise, and this is how she got a clientele.

She needs a loan of $725 USD which she will repay over a period of 6 months to buy merchandise and to be able to continue with her business.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise/comprar mercancia

loan.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria es soltera, tiene 24 aos de edad, estudi hasta quinto de primaria, vive en la comunidad de Chua, distrito de Capaso, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Es socia del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz. Con su crdito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles compr 01 cilindro de petrleo. Desde los 13 aos de edad aprendi a vender gelatina, galletas, man en las ferias de Chua, Torata, Tancachi, etc. A los 17 aos de edad se fue a la ciudad de Tacna para trabajar como empleada y con ello pudo lograr ahorrar un capital, y desde hace 04 aos empez a dedicarse al negocio de combustible, negocio que tienen hasta el da de hoy.
Con este crdito de S/.1,200 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar 02 cilindros de petrleo a S/.560 cada cilindro.
Su meta es seguir con el negocio, aperturar una tienda de combustible, gasolina, petrleo, kerosene; adems incluir productos como lubricantes y aditivos.
texts.en:
Maria is single, 24 years old and has a fifth-grade education. She lives in the community of Chua, Peru. She is a member of the Generation 2000 Community Bank in Mazocruz. With her first loan, she purchased one cylinder of oil. Since she was 13 years old, she learned to sell gelatins, cookies and other treats in the local outdoor markets. At 17, she went to the city of Tacna to work as maid and she was able to save some capital. The past four years she has made a living selling combustible fuels. With the $425 loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase two cylinders of oil at about $200/cylinder. Her goal is to keep growing her business and open a store selling gasoline, oil and kerosene as well as other products like lubricants and additives.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase two cylinders of oil

loan.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El comit est compuesto por 15 seoras trabajadoras que se dedican a la elaboracin y venta de chipas, actualmente el grupo ya est en su 9 ciclo del programa comit de mujeres. La chipa es una comida tpica de nuestro pas que es bastante consumido, una de las ciudades ms tradicionales en donde se puede disfrutar de las mejores chipas es en Caacup.

De las 15 seoras, 13 se dedican a la venta de chipas, una posee una carnicera y la otra, venta de ropas, todas son vecinas del barrio Gral. Daz de la ciudad de Caaup.

Con los prstamos que obtuvieron de la Fundacin compraron las materias prima necesarias para elaborar chipas, en esta ocasin tuvieron xito en la adquisicin de sus productos debido a que se juntaron todas y compraron en cantidad a precio mayorista por lo que obtuvieron importantes descuentos.

Todas las integrantes reciben un promedio de gs. 973.000 y lo invierten para la produccin de sus productos descriptos ms arriba.

Todas las integrantes del comit agradecen a la Fundacin por el apoyo y por permitirle ser parte del programa comit de mujeres, actualmente el comit tiene como objetivo lograr la mayor cantidad de venta en estos meses prximos al 8 de Diciembre, que es la fecha de la fiesta patronal en Caacup, y la ciudad recibe a mas de un milln de visitantes, por lo que hay un potencial importante de clientes y la manera de obtener buena venta es manteniendo la calidad y aumentando la produccin, manifiesta la seora Mary Colman.
texts.en:
The committee is made up of 15 hard working women that product and sell Chipas (corn and cheese breads). The group is going through its 9th cycle of the program for women. Chipas is a traditional food for our country and it is very popular for consumers. Caaupe is a city that is traditionally known as a place where you can enjoy some of the best Chipas.

Of the 15 women, 13 sell Chipas, one has a butcher shop and the other sells clothing. They are all neighbours in the region of Gral. Diaz in the city of Caaupe.

With the loans that were acquired through the organization "Fundacion" they purchase ingredients to make Chipas. This time they saw great success in acquiring their ingredients because they all got together and they purchased in great quantities at wholesale prices, granting them significant savigns.

All of the members receive on average 973,000 gs. and they use the funds to invest in the production of their products, as described here above.

All of the members of the committee wish to thank the organization "Fundacion" for the support and for allowing them to be part of the women's program. Currently the committee has an objective to achieve greater sales in these months up to December 8, which is the Patron celebration of Caaupe. During this time the city receives more than 1 million visitors, which translates in a significatn potential for clients. The way to secure a good sales period is to maintain quality in their product but at the same time increase their production. Mary Colman was the speaker.

Todas las integrantes del comit agradecen a la Fundacin por el apoyo y por permitirle ser parte del programa comit de mujeres, actualmente el comit tiene como objetivo lograr la mayor cantidad de venta en estos meses prximos al 8 de Diciembre, que es la fecha de la fiesta patronal en Caacup, y la ciudad recibe a mas de un milln de visitantes, por lo que hay un potencial importante de clientes y la manera de obtener buena venta es manteniendo la calidad y aumentando la produccin, manifiesta la seora Mary Colman.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase ingredients to produce Chipas, such as: starch, cheese, vegetable oil. Other women purchased clothing for ladies, men, and children etc.

loan.name: Marleny Flora

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 25 aos de edad, estudi hasta quinto de secundaria, es conviviente y madre de dos hijos, una nia de 09 aos y un nio de 04 aos de edad, vive en Jr. Puno s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia del Collao, Puno.
Es una de las socias antiguas del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz, el cual lo integr a los 17 aos de edad. Con el crdito inicial de S/.300 Nuevos Soles empez a comprar lana de oveja, fibra de alpaca y llama para ser comercializados en Mazocruz. Poco a poco increment el capital y cambi de negocio, ahora vende ropa para nios y a su vez vende golosinas en su triciclo en la escuela de Mazocruz.
Con este crdito de S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar 05 paquetes de conjuntos para nios, cada paquete tiene un costo de S/.65 Nuevos Soles y con S/.500 comprar golosinas.
Gracias al Banco Comunal empec a dedicarme al negocio, para nosotras es una gran ayuda y podemos generar ingresos para nuestros hogares manifest Marleny muy alegre.
Su sueo es tener una bodega, poner todo tipo de productos y al costado de la bodega instalar una tienda de ropa, as podra generar mayores ingresos para educar a sus hijos y de esa manera puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Marleny is 25 years old, has a high-school education and lives with her common-law husband and two children a nine-year-old daughter and a 4-year-old son in Mazocruz, Peru. She is one of the longest-tenured members of the Generation 2000 Community Bank, which she joined at age 17. With her first loan, she started purchasing wool from sheep, alpaca and llama to sell in Mazocruz. Little by little, she increased her capital and changed her business, and now she sells children's clothing and sometimes will sell snacks from her motocart at a local school With the current loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay in four months, she will purchase five packages of children's clothing and use the remainder to buy snacks.

"Thanks to the community bank I started to dedicate myself to the business. For us, it is a great help and it allows us to make an income for our households," Marleny states happily. Her dream is to own a convenience store selling all types of products, and on the side of it she will have a clothing store, so she will be able to generate more income for her children's education and they can become successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase children's clothing and snacks

loan.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Doa Modesta cumpli 44 aos de edad, estudi hasta tercero de primaria, es casada y tiene siete hijos (cinco varones y dos mujeres) solteros. Vive en la avenida Tacna s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Modesta es una nueva integrante del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz. Decidi integrarse por falta de capital y por las facilidades para obtener un crdito. Con este prstamo de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar 01 saco de arroz con S/.140, 01 bolsa de azcar con S/.75, 01 bolsa de fideos con S/.30, 01 paquete de gaseosa con S/.17, etc.
Modesta nos relata que no conoci a sus padres, la dejaron cuando tena 03 aos de edad. Su madre la regal a una familia que no tena hijos porque ella era madre soltera. All creci hasta cumplir los 18 aos de edad, dedicndose a tareas como cocinar, lavar, pastar ganados, etc., cuando tuvo su pareja empezaron con el negocio de compra y venta de carne de alpaca, venda en Mazocruz al por menor. Desde hace 03 aos instal una tienda de abarrotes, y a partir del 2006 tambin se dedica a la preparacin de comida los das de feria (viernes y sbado).
Su sueo es comprar un camin con el que piensa transportar verduras y productos de abarrotes a las diferentes ferias, de esa manera podr obtener mayores ingresos para educar a sus hijos y que puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Modesta is 44 years old, has a third-grade education and is married with seven children five boys, two girls, all unmarried. She lives on Tacna Avenue in Mazocrux, Peru. Modesta is a new member of the Generation 2000 Community Bank. She decided to join because she lacked capital and for the ability to receive a loan. With the loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, one sack of noodles, one package of soft drinks, among other items. Modesta tells us that she does not know her parents, who left her when she was three years. Her mother left her with a childless single mother. There she grew up, dedicating herself to kitchen chores, washing, grazing cattle, etc., until she and her partner started a business buying and selling alpaca meat in Mazocruz at retail. Three years ago she set up a convenience store and from 2006 she also has prepared meals on market days (Fridays and Saturday). Her dream is to purchase a truck so she can transport vegetables and grocery products to the different outdoor markets, and in this way she'll be able to obtain more income for her children's education so they can grow up to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loan.name: Luz Viva Ii Group

texts.es: La asociacin "Luz Viva II" pertenece al centro focal de villa Tejada ala cabeza de Laureana Q. trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace 10 aos aproximadamente. Ellas cuentan que luego de tener problemas con sus parejas en algunos casos necesitaban de independizarse econmicamente, pero no tenan nada de capital para emprender un negocio propio. Actualmente algunas se dedican a la elaboracin y venta de comida pero la mayora de ellas se dedican a la venta de ropa variada , para todas las edades, estas prendas son comercializadas principalmente en el mercado tihuanacu ubicado en la ceja de la ciudad de El Alto . Afirman que necesitan de mayor capital para la compra de mercadera en mayor cantidad para poder viajar al interior del pas y vender sus prendas, con la seguridad de generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
The association "Living Light II" is the focal center of the village of Tejada. It is headed by Laureana Q., who has worked together with Kiva partner Pro-Mujer for approximately 10 years. The women say that when they have had problems with their companions sometimes they have needed to become economically independent, but they didn't have any capital to start a business of their own. Now, thanks to the group, some of them are dedicated to making and selling food, but the majority of them make a living selling various clothing items for all ages. These products are sold mainly in the Tihuanacu market located in the city of El Alto. The women affirm they need more capital for the purchase of these products in larger quantities so they can be able to travel to the country's interior and sell their clothing items so they can generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase capital to purchase larger quantities of items for resale

loan.name: Rocio Monica

texts.es:
Rocio tiene 25 aos de edad, estudi en el Superior Pedaggico, es soltera y es la mayor de 04 hermanos menores. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.
Rocio integra el Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra en Yunguyo. Con su primer crdito de S/.300 aument su capital y compr 01 torete con S/.1,200. desde los 18 aos de edad se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno
Con este crdito de S/.1,200 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar 01 cabeza de ganado vacuno en la feria de Ilave para comercializarlo en la feria de Yunguyo.
Su meta es invertir ms capital en ganado vacuno, tener 05 o 06 cabezas de ganado vacuno mejorado. Con su capital acumulado piensa comprar una casa en la ciudad de Lima y apoyar a sus hermanos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rocio is 25 years old. She went to school at Superior Pedagogico. She is single and she is the eldest of 4, all of whom are still minors. They live in the Centro Poblado in the city of Acari, within the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno.

Rocio is a member of the community bank "Fe y Alegria" in Yunguyo. With her first loan, amounting to S/.300, she replenished her capital savings and she purchased a calf, costing S/.1200. Since she was 18 years old she has been purchasing and sellling cattle.

With this loan, amounting to S/.1200 Nuevos Soles, repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase a head of cattle at the Ilave fair and she plans to resell it at the Yunguyo fair.

Her goal is to invest more capital and expand her herd, to have 5 or 6 head of cattle. With her accumulated capital she hopes to purchase her own home in the city of Lima and she wants to support her younger siblings so that they may grow up to be professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase a head of cattle.

loan.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Mara inici el negocio por necesidades econmicas, para contar con mas recursos para los estudios de sus 2 hijas: ngela de 15 aos y Araceli de 14 aos, ambas estudiantes. Comenz hace 8 aos vendiendo abarrotes en su domicilio, y poco a poco logre mejor su tienda ofreciendo una mayor cantidad de productos, lo que le permiti ampliarla y brindar un mejor servicio.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $375 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercanca y tener ms surtido el negocio y hacerlo crecer. Con tu apoyo ella saldr adelante.
texts.en:
Maria started her business due to economic necessity, to have the resources for her 2 daughters' studies: Angela, who is 15 and Araceli, who is 14 and are both students. Eight years ago she started selling groceries from her home, and bit by bit she improved her store offering a wider quantity of products which allowed her to expand her business and offer a better service.

She needs a loan of $375 USD, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, to buy merchandise and to have a better stocked business and for it to grow. With your help she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise/comprar mercancia

loan.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana tiene 25 aos de edad, estudi quinto de secundaria, es conviviente y madre de dos hijos varones de 06 y 02 aos de edad, vive en el Jr. Ejercito s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Desde hace 04 aos integra el Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz. En un inicio obtuvo un crdito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles, con lo cual aument su capital para comprar golosinas, galletas, gaseosas etc.
A partir de los 08 aos de edad trabajaba en las vacaciones cuidando nios, le daban su propina y ella se compraba su ropa. Cuando cumpli 14 aos de edad trabaj en los restaurantes, a los 19 aos de edad convivi con su pareja y desde entonces hasta la fecha vende golosinas.
Con este crdito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar 02 casilleros de gaseosas con S/.24, 02 cajas de galletas con S/.80, 02 cajas de chocolates con S/. 40.00, etc.
Su sueo es comprar una camioneta para ir a ver a su familia, construir su casa e instalar una tienda de abarrotes y golosinas, y que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 25 years old and she went to school up to grade 11. She lives with her common law husband and she is mother of two little boys aged 6 and 2. They live in Jr. Ejercity s/n in the district of Mazocruz, within the province of El Collao in Puno.

She has been a member of the commuity bank "Generacion 2000" in Mazocruz. In the beginning she obtained a loan of S/.300 Nuevos Soles, with which she supplemented her capital to purchase snacks, cookies, soft drinks etc.

Since she was 8 years old she worked as a babysitter in her spare time. They gave her tips and with that she used to purchase her own clothes. When she turned 14 she started working in restaurants, and when she was 19 she joined her partner and since then she has been selling snacks.

With this loan, amounting to S/.500, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 2 boxes of soft drink (costing S/.24), 2 boxes of cookies (costing S/.80), and 2 boxes of chocolates (costing S/.40), etc..

Her dream is to purchase a minivan so that she could go and visit her family, she wishes to build her own home, and she wants to set up a small grocery store. She wants to see her kids going to school and become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase soft drinks, cookies, chocolates, etc..

loan.name: Luz Viva Group

texts.es: La elaboracin de almuerzos y meriendas es la principal actividad de la asociacin Luz Viva .Esta pertenece a l centro focal de Villa Tejada, con la ayuda de su asistente de crditos trabajan muy organizados en sus actividades de grupo. Toda la elaboracin de estos alimentos lo realizan con productos frescos por lo que deben realizar compras a diario ya que no cuentan con refrigeradores suficientes. Luego de la elaboracin de sus alimentos los entregan a pedido en oficinas y puestos en la ciudad de El Alto. La asociacin Luz Viva necesita comprar refrigeradores grandes con la suficiente capacidad para almacenar productos necesarios para la elaboracin de sus almuerzos.
texts.en:
Making lunches and snacks is the main activity that the 'Luz Viva' ('Living Light') association does. They belong to the focal center in Villa Tejado and with the help of their credit assistant they are very organized in the way in which they work in a group. They make all their food using fresh produce which means they must buy things daily as they don't have enough refrigerator space. After making foods they take them to the offices and food stalls which have ordered them in the city of El Alto. The 'Luz Viva' association needs to buy bigger refrigerators with enough room to keep all the products necessary for making their lunches.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: They need capital to buy big refrigerators/Necesitan capital para la compra de refrigeradores grandes.

loan.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es soltera, tiene 19 aos de edad, estudi hasta quinto de secundaria y vive en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.
Decidi integrar el Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra en Yunguyo por falta de capital y con este crdito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, aumentar su capital y comprar 01 torete con S/.900 para engorde y posterior venta.
Trabaj apoyando a su prima durante cuatro meses, ahorrando un capital decidi dedicarse a un negocio por su propia cuenta.
Su sueo es tener una tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad de Yunguyo y que su hermana menor siga estudiando, ya que son cuatro hermanos, ella es la tercera y los dems no pudieron seguir estudios superiores por falta de medios econmicos.
texts.en:
Sonia is single, she is 19 years old and she attended school until grade 11. She lives in Centro Poblado de Acari within the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno.

She decided to become a member of the "Fe y Alegria" community bank in Yunguyo because she was lacking capital funds. This loan amounting to S/.500, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, will complement her capital and she will purchase a calf (totalling S/.900) to raise and resell later.

She worked to support her cousin during a 4 month period and she managed to make some savings. With these saving she decided to set up a business by her own account.

Her dream is to set up a grocery store in the city of Yunguyo and for her younger sister to keep going to school. Since they are four children in her family, she is the third eldest, and the other two could not continue going to school for lack of financial means.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase a calf to raise and fatten and for later resale.

loan.name: Women United Group

texts.es:
El comit Mujeres Unidas tiene mas de 2 aos de formacin y trabajo con la Fundacin Paraguaya mantiene a la mayora de sus integrantes fundadoras del comit en actividad, realizan actividades diversas con el propsito de superarse a pesar de las limitaciones acadmicas y laborales con que cuentan sus integrantes.

Se dedican a diversas actividades entre las cuales podemos citar: reciclaje, venta de mercera, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comestibles, venta de carbn, venta de bebidas, entre otras actividades productivas. Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para tratar de que sus hijos alcancen una buena educacin y puedan optar por un buen empleo

Las actividades de las seoras son diversas, a continuacin detallaremos las mismas: -Candida M. , Recicladora.

-Maria R. , Lavandera.

-Mercedes A. , Recicladora.

-Maria A. , Vta de bebidas.

-Ramona G. ,Venta de pancho-gaseosa.

- Gloria L. , Vta de verduras.

-Maria S. , Recicladora.

-Elba C. , Venta de frutas.

-Ftima A. , Vta de comestibles.

-Graciela R. ,Venta de mercera.

-Celina R., Reciclaje.

-Mirian F. , Venta de comestibles.

-Gloria Lezcano, Despensa

. -Ignacia A. , Venta de comestibles.

-Elba E. , venta de mercera.

-Mercedes de P. , Venta de comestibles.

-Veronica F. , Reciclaje.

-Genara A. , Venta de gaseosa.

-Maria Antonia M. , Venta de carbon.
texts.en:
This committee "Mujeres Unidas" has more than 2 years since its creation and they are supported by Fundacion Paraguaya. This organization retains most of the individuals of this committee as members. They work at different occupations but they all work towards self-improvement despite their limited schooling and training.

They run different kinds of businesses which include: recycling, merchandise sales, produce sales, food sales, carbon sales, and drink sales amoung other productive businesses. They are striving towards a better future for their children, and this is why they work twice as hard to make sure that their children can secure a good education and later have good jobs.

The businesses run by these women are diverse, and they are listed here below:

-Candida M. , Recycling.

-Maria R. , Laundry services.

-Mercedes A. , Recycling.

-Maria A. , Drink sales.

-Ramona G. ,Soft drink sales.

- Gloria L. , Produce sales.

-Maria S. , Recycling.

-Elba C. , Fruit sales.

-Ftima A. , Food sales.

-Graciela R. ,Craft sales.

-Celina R., Recycling.

-Mirian F. , Food sales.

-Gloria Lezcano, Groceries.

. -Ignacia A. , Food sales.

-Elba E. , Craft sales.

-Mercedes de P. , Food sales.

-Veronica F. , Recycling.

-Genara A. , Soft drink sales.

-Maria Antonia M. , Carbon sales.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To purchase aluminum, cardboard, plastics, wood carbon, soft drinks, beer, wine, liquors, produce, sugar, herbs, flour, cooking oil, pastries, milk products, meats, pasta, rice, and starch.

loan.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 28 aos de edad, estudi Superior Tcnico, es casada y madre de dos hijos varones de 05 y 03 aos de edad, vive en la avenida Tacna s/n en el distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.
En el ao 2002 decidi integrar el Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz. En un inicio obtuvo S/.300 con el que compr conjuntos para bebes, chompas, pantalones de lana.
Doa Teresa qued hurfana de padre a los 12 aos de edad, a los 13 aos ya venda gelatina, cuando cumpli los 21 aos form su hogar y se inici con la venta de ropa, confeccionaba buzos, tapetes para televisores, compraba su mercadera en la ciudad de Juliaca y venda en la ciudad de Puno. Desde hace 02 aos cambi de negocio, en la actualidad atiende en su restaurante.
Con este crdito de S/.2,200 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar 02 cabezas de ganado vacuno para engorde.
Su meta es comprar su casa en la ciudad de Puno, instalar su Snackcafetera y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Teresa is 28 years old and studied high technology in school. She's married and a mother of two boys, ages 5 and 3. She lives on Tacna Avenue in the town of Mazocruz. In 2002, she decided to join the Generation 2000 Community Bank, and with her initial loan she purchased outfits for infants, jackets, and wool pants. Teresa was orphaned at age 12, and the next year she started selling gelatins. When she turned 21, she started a family and began selling clothes, making sweaters and cloths for TVs. She purchased her supplies in the city of Juliaca and sold them in the city of Puno. Two years ago she changed her business, and currently tends to her restaurant. With the loan, which she plans to repay in four months, she will purchase two heads of cattle to fatten. Her goal is to purchase a home in Puno and to set up a snack bar so she can provide for her sons' education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase two heads of cattle to fatten

loan.name: Reyna Gloria

texts.es:
Reyna inicio el negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo por que lo que gana es muy poco y no les alcanza. Adems de tener la preocupacin de su esposo que trabaja mucho y esta enfermo de diabetes, por eso emprendi su negocio de venta de regalos, con las ganancias de este, los gastos son menos y puede solventar los pagos de los estudios de sus hijos.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses el cual la va a ayudar en comprar ms mercanca para tener un mejor surtido en el negocio y as incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Reyna started her business so she could help her husband out as he earns very little and it is not enough for them. Moreover she worries about her husband who works a lot and has diabetes, and this is why she started her business selling gifts and souvenirs, and with her earnings from this they spend less and they can afford to pay for their kids' education.

She needs a loan of $550 which she will repay over a period of 6 months which will help her buy more merchandise to have a better stocked business and thereby increase her sales.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise/comprar mercania

loan.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora inicio el negocio para poder darles estudio a sus hijos ya que se quedo viuda y necesitaba pagar las deudas que le dejo el accidente que tuvo su esposo en el cual falleci, aparte de la preocupacin de no tener dinero para darles de comer a sus hijos, pagar la escuela; as como otros gastos como pagar renta ya que no tenan vivienda propia. Es por eso que inicio la elaboracin y venta de tortillas de harina para poder salir adelante.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima para la elaboracin de las tortillas y as poder incrementar las ventas darles a los clientes un producto de calidad.
texts.en:
Nora started her business so her kids could study as she is a widow and needed to pay off the debts that she was left with after her husband had the accident in which he died. Apart from worrying about having no money to feed her kids or pay for their education she also had other costs such as paying rent as they didn't have their own house. This is why she started making and selling flour tortillas - so she could move forward.

She needs a loan of $550 USD, which she will repay over a period of 6 months, to buy basic ingredients to make the tortillas and thereby increase her daily sales and give her clients a quality product.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy basic ingredients/comprar materia prima

loan.name: Tereza

texts.es:
Doa Tereza tiene 37 aos de edad, estudi Superior Tcnico, es casada y madre de cinco hijos (cuatro mujeres de 12, 18, 03 y de 2 meses, y un varn de 08 aos de edad). Vive en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.
Desde el ao 2000 integra el Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra en Yunguyo. Al inicio obtuvo un crdito de S/.300, el cual en ese entonces le alcanzaba para 02 sacos de aj. Ella empez a dedicarse al negocio desde los 16 aos de edad, comercializaba haba, papa, chuo, tunta y quinua en la ciudad de Juliaca. A los 22 aos de edad form su hogar y continu con el negocio, adems venda carne de chancho en la ciudad de Puno. Desde hace 03 aos cambi de negocio y ahora vende aj trae del Departamento de Tacna (Sama) y lo comercializa semanalmente en Desaguadero.
Con este crdito de S/.3,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar 04 cuatro sacos de aj, cada saco tiene un costo de S/.430 Nuevos Soles, los cuales sern comercializados en la ciudad de Desaguadero.
Su meta es la de comprar una camioneta para que le facilite su negocio y que su hijo estudie en la ciudad de Tacna porque ya compr su terreno y pronto construir su casa para poder trasladar a su familia.
texts.en:
Tereza is 37 years old. She studied at the Superior Tcnico [Advanced Technical Institute]. She is married and the mother of five children (four girls ages 12, 18, 3 and 2 months, and one 8-year-old boy). She lives in the village of Acari, in Yunguyo district and province, in the region of Puno. Tereza became a member of the "Fe y Alegra" [Faith and Joy] Community Bank in 2000. She first received a loan of 300 soles [about US$100], which she then used to purchase two bags of aj [Peruvian hot peppers]. She started working in this business when she was 16 years old, selling beans, potatoes, chuo [potato flour], tunta [dehydrated potato], and quinoa, in the city of Juliaca. When she was 22, she built her own house and continued operating her business while also selling pork in the city of Puno. Three years ago she changed her business and now sells aj brought from the Tacna region (Sama district) and sold each week in Desaguadero. With this loan of 3,000 soles [about US$1,025] -- which will be paid back in four installments -- Tereza plans to buy 4 bags of aj, which she will sell in the city of Desaguadero. Each bag costs 430 soles. Tereza's goal is to buy a small truck to help her run her business. She also hopes her son will be able to study in the city of Tacna, seeing she recently has purchased land and soon will build her house to be able to move her family there.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase of aj [Peruvian hot peppers]

loan.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Doa Vernica cumpli 38 aos de edad, estudi segundo de secundaria, es conviviente y madre de tres hijos (una mujer de 18 aos, dos varones de 15 y 13 aos de edad). Vive en el Jr Santa Rosa s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Es socia del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz. Con este crdito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar verduras, papa, carne para su restaurante.
Anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de compra y venta de carne de alpaca, llama y ovino, los cuales lo compraba por degollados y lo venda al por menor en kilos. Desde hace 03 aos se dedica a su restaurante y eventualmente vende carne de alpaca.
Su meta es comprar su casa en Arequipa y aperturar un restaurante, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Doa Vernica is 38 years old and studied until the second year of secondary school. She is married and mother of three children (one daughter of 18 years and two sons of 13 and 15 years). She lives in Jr. Santa Rosa, district of Mazocruz, province of El Collao, Puno. She is a member of the community bank "Generacin 2000" in Mazocruz. With this loan of 500 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she will buy vegetables, potato, and meat for her restaurant. Previously she was dedicated to the business of buying and selling alpaca, llama, and sheep meat, which she bought from the butchers and sold it in smaller quantities of kilograms. Since three years ago, she has been dedicated to her restaurant and occasionally sells alpaca meat. Her goal is to buy her home in Arequipa and open a restaurant and that her kids study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: vegetables, potato, and meat

loan.name: Tekojoja Group

texts.es:
Este comit se encuentra actualmente en su dcimo ciclo cuenta con 15 integrantes.

Las integrantes se dedican a actividades varias entre las que se pueden destacar la venta de minutas, bebidas, despensa, peluquera, adems de venta de ropas, entre otras cosas el destino de los fondos va para la compra de materiales como telas, ropas, hilos, carne, aceite, verduras, kiosco compra de mercaderas varias.

Este grupo compuesto por 15 integrantes es bastante dinmico y organizado uno de los comit mas antiguos de la fundacin.

La Sra. Francisca F. tiene una despensa que gracias a la ayuda de la Fundacin pudo ampliar hoy cuenta con un stock interesante de mercaderas y tiene una tendencia a crecer.

El comit presenta buena relacin interna y respeto entre sus integrantes.

Cabe destacar tambin la puntualidad en los pagos y asistencia de la mayora de las integrantes a las reuniones. Las actividades que desarrollan estas mujeres emprendedoras se definen de la siguiente manera:

-Francisca F.,Despensa

-Ramona L., Venta de mercaderias varias

-Modesta S., Venta de ropas

-Marina C., Venta de comestibles

-Toribia L., Venta de ropas

-Julia C., Venta de ropas usadas

-Ana Maria G., Venta de lenceria

-Maria V., Venta de bebidas y ropas

-Maria Raquel A., Venta de comestibles

-Aparicia P., Venta de lenceria

-Eulalia D., Venta de comestibles

-Ana M., Kiosko

-Cinthia G., Peluqueria

-Mirian I., Venta de comidas rpidas

-Maria T., manualidades
texts.en:
This committee actually finds itself in its 10th cycle counting among 15 members.

The members are dedicated to various activities among which can be seen the sale of designs, drinks, pantry, a salon, as well as the sale of clothes. Among other things, the destiny of the funds will go to buying materials like cloth, clothes, needles, meat, vinegar, vegetables, kiosk buying of various merchandise.

This group composed of 15 members is dynamic and organized enough and one of the oldest committees of the foundation..

Mrs. Francisca F. has a pantry which thanks to the help of the Foundation was able to grow and today has an interesting stock of merchandise and has the tendency to grow.

The committee has good internal relations and respect among its members.

It can also show the timeliness of payments and the attendance of the majority of its members at the meetings. The activities which these women are involved in are defined in the following way.

-Francisca F.,Pantry

-Ramona L., Sale of various merchandise

-Modesta S., Clothing sales

-Marina C., grocery sales

-Toribia L., Clothing sales

-Julia C., Used clothing sales

-Ana Maria G., Venta de lenceria

-Maria V., Clothing and drink sales

-Maria Raquel A., Grocery sales

-Aparicia P., Venta de lenceria

-Eulalia D., Grocery sales

-Ana M., Kiosk

-Cinthia G., Salon

-Mirian I., Fast food sales

-Maria T., manualidades


Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buying merchandise

loan.name: Yaneth Melania

texts.es:
Yaneth tiene 25 aos de edad, estudi cuarto de secundaria, es casada y madre de tres hijos (dos mujeres de 08 y 02 aos, y un varn de 04 aos de edad). Vive en el Jr. Puno s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Es socia del Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz. Decidi integrar el Banco Comunal desde hace 05 aos porque le faltaba capital para equipar su tienda de abarrotes. Con el crdito inicial de S/.300 Nuevos Soles compr 01 bolsa de arroz, 01 bolsa de azcar, etc. Desde los 06 aos de edad su padre las abandon y ella tena que salir a vender gelatina, desde los 09 hasta los 18 aos de edad venda abarrotes en las ferias de Tupala, Huacullani, Huaitiri y otros. A los 19 aos de edad convivi con su pareja y ambos instalaron su tienda de abarrotes. Con un capital acumulado actualmente vende combustible, carne de alpaca, llama, ovino y entrega a los mayoristas de Tacna.
Con este crdito de S/.1,500 nuevos soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar 01 cilindro de combustible con S/.600 y con el resto del capital comprar alpacas para la venta en carne. Cada alpaca tiene un costo de S/.180.00 a S/.200.00.
Su meta es tener una casa muy bonita en Mazocruz, instalar una tienda comercial, contar con empleados para la atencin al pblico y ella slo lo administrara, adems que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 25 years old and completed a fourth of secondary school. She is married and mother of three children (two girls who are two and eight years old, and a boy who is four years old). She lives in Jr. Puno, district of Mazocruz, province of El Collao, Puno. She is a member of the community bank "Generacin 2000" in Mazocruz. She decided to join the community bank five years ago because she lacked capital to stock her grocery shop. With the initial credit of 300 Soles, she bought one bag of rice, one bag of sugar, etc. At six years of age, her father abandoned her and she had to go out to sell gelatin. From age nine to eighteen, she sold groceries in the markets of Tupala, Huacullani, Huaitiri, and others. At age nineteen she married her husband and they installed their grocery shops. With a capital accumulated, she presently sells fuel, alpaca, llama, and sheep meat, mostly to the wholesalers of Tacna. With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she proposes to buy one cylinder of fuel with 600 Soles and with the rest of the capital she will buy alpacas for the sale of meat. Each alpaca costs 180 to 200 Soles. Her goal is to have a very beautiful home in Mazocruz, set up a commercial shop, hire employees to attend to the public, and she will just administer it. Her goal is also that her kids study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy fuel and alpacas for the cost of meat.

loan.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es: En el centro focal Panamericana podemos encontrar a la asociacin San Pablo a la fecha cuenta con nueve miembros activos que trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace ms de siete aos. Diversos son los negocios de esta asociacin por ejemplo algunas de ellas tienen una mini- distribuidora de perfumes de marca( Reblon), Sonia es duea de una tienda de abarrotes, Luz al igual que otras de sus compaeras se dedican a la venta de electrodomsticos que por lo general los dejan a crdito a instituciones y personas particulares. La mayora de ellas son casadas y con hijos siendo Lidia y Vernica las nicas solteras del grupo, pero de la misma forma que sus compaeras trabajan para mantener econmicamente a sus familias. Todas ellas quieren ampliar sus ventas por lo que necesitan comprar mayor cantidad de productos, para generar mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
In the Panamerican focal center we find the "San Pablo" association, which to date has nine active members who work together with Kiva partner Pro-Mujer for more than seven years. The members' businesses are diverse, for example, some of the women run a small brand-name (Reblon) perfume distribution; Sonia is owner of a convenience store, and Luz is as well; other members sell electric appliances on credit to institutions and certain people. The majority of the members are married with children Lidia and Vernica are the only single members in the group and all are untied by the goal to work for their families' economic stabilities. All of the women want to increase their sales, which in turn means they need to buy a larger quantity of supplies, so they can generate more earnings to allow them to improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase more products to increase their sales

loan.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La seora Herminia Espnola de Aguero, es casada, el cnyuge tomo la decisin de viajar al exterior (Espaa) por razones econmicas, y gracias a esto la Sra. cuenta con otro ingreso pues el enva dinero mensualmente desde el exterior.

Los mismos tienen dos hijos, quienes son menores de edad. Herminia posee un copetn, la misma esta muy bien ubicada en una zona altamente comercial. Se inici con un capital de apenas Gs. 500.000. (alrededor de 110 dlares), que fue ampliando con el correr de los aos, pues actualmente cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes.

La seora retira el prstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracin de comestibles, como: empanadas, chipa guazu, milanesas, otros.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder este negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento o mobiliario para poder ofrecer un ambiente ms cmodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Herminia E. de Augero is married. Her husband took the decision to travel abroad (Spain) due to financial reasons, and thanks to this, Mrs. Herminia has an extra income since he sends money on a monthly basis from abroad.

They have two children, who are both minors. Herminia owns a drink stand. It is well located in a busy commercial zone. She started with a budget of just $110 USD and has been expanding as the years pass by. Today she has ample amounts of customers.

Mrs. Herminia would like this loan to purchase materials necessary to make edible items such as empanadas, chipa guazu, milanesas, and others.

One of her aspirations is to equip her business with furniture to create a more comfortable environment that is inviting to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase edible products such as meat, flour, vegetables and others.

loan.name: Juana

texts.es:
La seora Juana A., es soltera, tiene 52 aos, no tiene pareja actualmente, su nica hija tiene 23 aos, quien tambin trabaja con ella, en la confeccin de todo tipo de bolsos y maletines, actividad a la que se dedica hace ya ms de 20 aos, conjuntamente con su padre quien tambin es su socio comercial.

El negocio lo tienen en su propio domicilio. Ella aprendi este oficio de su padre, y est muy orgullosa del mismo, ya que en cada uno de sus diseos resalta principalmente la calidad de la confeccin, que segn como manifiestan posee una muy buena durabilidad, y diseos exclusivos para cada cliente de acuerdo a los gustos en cuanto a los colores y formas para su mejor aprovechamiento de espacios.

La seora Juana A. retira el prstamo para la adquisicin de ms telas y as poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar prximamente este negocio, mediante la adquisicin de ms mquinas de coser industriales y as brindar puestos de trabajo en tan noble actividad, para el desarrollo profesional y econmico de los jvenes principalmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana A. is a 52-year-old single mother of a 23-year-old daughter, who also works with her making all types of handbags and satchels. She has been in this business for over 20 years, alongside her father, who is also her business partner.

The business is located in their own home. She learned this skill from her father, and she is very proud of him because quality stands out in each of his designs. The products have great durability, and they are designed exclusively for each customer according to their taste in color and form, making the most use of space.

Ms. Juana A. is requesting this loan in order to purchase more fabric, thus allowing her to be able to fill all her customers orders.

One of her aspirations is to be able to expand the business soon by means of obtaining more industrial sewing machines, and in so doing offer job positions in this noble field, mainly for the professional and financial development of young people.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase fabric for making handbags and satchels

loan.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 20 aos de edad, estudi primaria completa, es conveniente y progenitora de un hijo varn de 01 ao con 07 meses de edad. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Imicate, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.
Es socia del Banco Comunal Fe y Alegra en Yunguyo. Con este crdito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual ser cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprar papa, chuo, tarwi, haba para ser comercializados en la ciudad de Tacna.
Yesenia a los 13 aos de edad empez con el negocio de productos ya mencionados, desde que cumpli los 16 aos de edad convive con su esposo y contina con su negocio.
Su meta es terminar con la construccin de su casa en el sector de Challapampa, el cual est cerca a la carretera de Yunguyo, instalar una tienda de abarrotes y educar a su hijo para que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 20 years old and completed primary school. She is married and mother of a son who is one year and seven months old. She lives in Centro Poblado of Imicate, district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. She is a member of the community bank "Fe y Alegra" (Faith and Happiness) in Yunguyo. With this loan for 500 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she will buy potatos, potato starch, tarwi (edible Andean bean), and broad bean for reselling in the city of Tacna. At age 13, Yesenia began this business with the mentioned products, and when she was 16, she married her husband and continued this business. Her goal is to finish the construction of her home in the sector of Challapampa, which is near the highway in Yunguyo, set up a grocery store, and educate her son to be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: potato, potato starch, tarwi, broad beans, etc.

loan.name: Yudith Roxana

texts.es:
Yudith tiene 23 aos de edad, estudi cuarto de secundaria, es conviviente y madre de un nio de 04 aos de edad. Vive en el Jr. Ejrcito s/n (frente al mercado), distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.
Desde el ao 2005 integra el Banco Comunal Generacin 2000 en Mazocruz. Por motivos familiares tuvo que dejar el Banco Comunal, reingresando nuevamente hace dos ciclos. Con el crdito que le otorgaron de S/.500 Nuevos Soles pudo comprar 03 cabezas de alpaca.
Yudith empez a dedicarse al negocio desde que tuvo su pareja, a los 22 aos de edad, con la venta de carne y fibra de alpaca, llama y tambin carne y lana de ovino que entrega a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna. De vez en cuando prepara comida para vender en la feria sabatina de Mazocruz.
