Juan is a hard-working man who has been fully dedicated to passenger transportation for quite some time. He owns two motorcycle taxis, one which he drives, and another which is driven by his brother, to whom he has offered employment. Juan, who is 35 years old, has 3 school age children who love him very much. As a homemaker, his wife, Rosa, looks after the children and carries out the household chores. She greatly supports him and agrees with everything that he sets out to accomplish. For Juan, the most important thing is to make his children study so that they can one day become professionals. He now wants to keep making his business grow, and for this he has to maintain his motorcycle taxis in good condition, which is why he needs to purchase spare parts with the loan he is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase spare parts for motorcycle taxi repairs

loan.name: Jimena Aneyda

texts.es: El domicilio de la seora, se encuentra ubicado en la populosa zona de Villa Victoria de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, siendo una vecina muy conocida de la zona. La seora se dedica a la comercializacin de juguetes al por mayor desde hace ya 6 aos; este crdito ser destinado al incremento de capital para la compra de mercadera. La seora es soltera dependen econmicamente de ella sus papas que ya son ancianitos, es cliente de nuestra institucin ya hace 1 ao, la moneda en la que trabaja es en bolivianos, comenta que los crditos que sac con nuestra institucin le sirvieron de mucho ya que son de corta rotacin y puede incrementar su capital de manera rpida, gracias a ello, logr mejorar su calidad de vida y la de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Jimena's home is located in the populous neighborhood of Villa Victoria in the city of La Paz, Bolivia, and she is a well-known neighborhood resident. She makes a living selling toys wholesale, which she has done for the past six years. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital to purchase merchandise. Jimena is single and her parents, now a bit elderly, depend on her economically. She has been a client of Kiva partner Emprender for one year. She says past loans she's received for the institution have helped her greatly since they have come in quick rotation and have allowed her to increase her capital rapidly. Thanks to the loans, she has been able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase capital to purchase larger quantities of merchandise

loan.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene, de 42 aos, es madre de dos hijos los cuales le inspiran a seguir adelante, ella junto a su esposo Exaltacin (chofer de cargas pesadas) quien la apoya en todo, y sobre todo en su negocio, son los encargados de brindar todo lo necesario a sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan mucho en su trabajo. Ella tiene su negocio de venta de jugos en un puesto del mercado Bellavista, realiza esta actividad desde hace varios aos atrs y le va muy bien hasta ahora.El motivo por el que solicita este prstamo es para mandar a construir un kiosco y con el tiempo espera que su negocio se convierta en un muy lugar conocido y de mucha concurrencia.
texts.en:
Irene is 42 years old and mother of two children, who inspire her to continue working to improve their lives. She and her husband, Exaltacin (who is a driver of heavy shipments), who supports her in everything and especially her business, together are responsible for offering to their children everything that they need. It's for this reason they work so hard in their jobs. She has a business of selling juices from a stand at the market Bellavista. She has done this activity for several years and it has gone very well for her so far. The reason why she is requesting a loan is to contract the construction of a pavilion over her stand. With time she hopes that her business will become a well-known place with many returning customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Construct a pavilion for her business of juice sales.

loan.name: Marcia

texts.es:
Inici su negocio como una minipulpera vendiendo cosas pequeas de alimentos, con crditos que ADIM le ha otorgado ella empez a vender de todo tipo de productos alimenticios, en un crdito de mayor monto invirti en ropa menor, tarjetas de telfono, gas butano para uso domiciliar, etc. Actualmente est consolidando su negocio y quiere ampliarlo con una pequea soda ubicada en el parque de la misma localidad.
Ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos pero quienes le apoyan directamente en el negocio son sus dos hijas que estudian y trabajan en el negocio. Ella expresa que con su negocio ella se siente como una pequea empresaria capaz de realizar el proyecto que tiene en mente y que necesita el financiamiento de ADIM para cumplir sus sueos

loan.use: Compra de Productos

loan.name: Maria

texts.es: Marial tiene 26 aos, es profesora de educacin primaria, tiene 1 hijo, el mismo que es la razn de su vida, es propietaria de un motocarro, que es manejado por su esposo Javier, quien siempre la apoya en todo. Ambos quieren brindar a su nio lo necesario, y velar por el momento con respecto a su educacin, alimentacin y salud.Maria quiere mejorar a su herramienta de trabajo y para ello requiere comprar repuestos para mandarlo a arreglar, ya que es el nico sustento que tienen, ella se traz una meta, que es ahorrar un poco de dinero para ms adelante tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes, ya que su casa se encuentra ubicada en un lugar muy transitable, y as asegurar una mejor vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old and a teacher of primary education. She has one son, who is the reason for her life. She is the owner of a motocart, which is driven by her husband Javier, who always supports her in everything. They both want to offer their boy the necessary things in life and look after his education, nutrition, and health. Maria wants to improve her motocart for work and for this purpose she must buy spare parts for repairing it. Since this is their main source for providing sustenance, she made it her goal, to save a little money to later have a business of grocery sales, because her house is located in a high-traffic place. This way she can ensure a better life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy spare parts to repair her motocart.

loan.name: Nio Fajardito Communal Bank Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Nio Fajardito esta ubicado en L. Comunidad D. San Cristbal en Huancavelica. L. comunidad D. San Cristbal es un barrio populoso que cuenta con Colegios, Posta, Universidad, y una Zona Turstica donD. se encuentran los Baos del Inca y un parque Eco Turstico. Entre las actividades que realizan sus pobladores esta L. ganadera, agricultura, comercio, transportes.

Juana O., esta separada D. su esposo, tiene 2 hijos a los cuales elL. se dedica como padre y madre porque quiere que sean profesionales, su negocio es L. venta D. golosinas que venD. ambulatoriamente. Juana suea con tener una tienda D. abarrotes. Su prstamo lo utilizar para surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.

Elizabeth P., es casada, se dedica a L. venta D. golosinas en las escuelas, las ventas las realiza en un triciclo D. manera ambulatoria, su esposo tiene trabajo eventual, por cuanto no siempre cuenta con capital para surtir su negocio. Elizabeth tiene parlisis facial debido al estrs, pero elL. sabe que podr salir adelante. Su sueo es tener una casa propia.

TeofiL. C., tiene 7 hijos algunos D. ellos en el colegio y otro en L. universidad, tiene un negocio D. agregados para techo, el cual desea surtir comprando hormign, confitillo grueso y fino. Su sueo es comprarse un camin, volquete o tractor.
texts.en:
The Bancomunal (communal bank) Nio Fajardito is located in the community of San Cristbal in Huancavelica, Per. San Cristbal is a popular neighbourhood that has schools, medical clinic, university, and a tourist zone where the Baos del Inca (Inca baths) and an ecotourism park are located. The locals work at various occupations including grazing, growing crops, business, and transportation.

Juana O. is separated from her husband, and has two children to whom she devotes herself as both mother and father because she would like them to become professionals. Her business is candy sales, and she sells them on the street. Juana dreams of having a grocery stO.. Her loan will be used to stock her business and increase her sales.

Elizabeth P. is married and earns a living selling candies in schools from a mobile tricycle stand. Her husband has temporary work, so she does not always have the capital to stock her business. Elizabeth has facial paralysis due to stress, but she knows she can get ahead. Her dream is to have her own home.

TeofiL. C. has 7 children, some of whom are in school and another in university. He has a roofing aggregate business, for which he would like stock by purchasing cement, and coarse and fine gravel. His dream is to buy himself a transport truck, dump truck, or bulldozer.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The communal Bank Nio Fajardito requests a loan of US$1600 to benefit its 11 members in the implementation of their businesses

loan.name: Leoncio

texts.es: El domicilio de don Leoncio, se encuentra ubicado en la populosa zona de Villa Victoria de la ciudad de La Paz siendo un vecino muy conocido de la zona; el sr. se dedica a la confeccin de prendas de vestir para varones sastrera, desde hace 25 aos; este crdito ser destinado a la compra de una mquina de coser y adems para la compra de materia prima; el seor Leoncio vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos que ya estn cruzando estudios universitarios y dependen econmicamente de el, la esposa tiene una tienda de barrio con la que apoya en los gastos familiares, es cliente de nuestra institucin desde hace 5 aos y solo trabaja con nosotros, la moneda en la que trabaja es el dlar. Comenta que los crditos le sirven de mucho ya que gracias a ello logra mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Leoncio's home is located in the highly populated neighborhood of Villa Victoria in the city of La Paz and he is well known in the area. He has worked as a tailor making clothing for men for 25 years. This loan will be used to purchase a sewing machine and also to buy materials. Leoncio lives with his wife and two children who are university students and are economically dependent on him. His wife has a neighborhood store with which allows her to contribute to household expenses. He has been a client of our institution for five years and only works with us. The currency in which he works is the dollar. He says that the loans are a great help and thanks to them he is able to improve the quality of life for his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loan.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal San Antonio D. Padua pertenece a la comunidad D. Huando en Huancavelica. Este Valle tiene 3 barrios, Acobamba, Libertad y Progreso, la comunidad es bastante acogedora por su zona comercial. Entre las actividades principales que realizan esta la agricultura (maz, papa, olluco, cebada, trigo), la ganadera (carnero, vacas, caballos, burros) y la artesana (bordado D. fustanes).

Nora S., es casada, tiene dos hijos pequeos D. 5 y 3 aos. Su negocio es una ferretera la cual ha surtido continuamente con los prstamos que recibe. Con el prstamo D. ahora comprar cemento en cantidad. Su sueo es que sus dos lindos tesoros, como les llama, tengan estudios y sean profesionales.

Norma M., tiene 8 hijos, se inici en el negocio vendiendo bebidas calientes, ahora ella venD. ropa, comida y fruta, esto es segn la temporada. Antes no contaba con capital pues las ganancias las utilizaba en la alimentacin D. sus hijos. Su esposo maneja un tractor que alquila a instituciones, ahora Norma pueD. ahorrar para la educacin D. sus hijos que estn en la universidad.

Soledad S., es casada, su negocio es la venta D. Cds y DVDs, agradece las reuniones D. su bancomunal porque ha aprendido mucho, su prstamo lo quiere invertir en la compra D. plsticos pues ha visto que en la comunidad D. Huando no hay.
texts.en:
The San Antonio D. Padua Communal Bank belongs to the Huando community in Huancavelica. This valley has three neighborhoods - Acobamba, Libertad and Progreso and the community is quite charming due to it's commercial area. Among the principle activities of the people are agriculture (corn, potatoes, olluco, barley and wheat), raising livestock (rams, cattle, horses and donkeys) and handicrafts (embroidered white skirts).

Nora S. is married and has two small children ages five and three. Her business is a hardware store that has run continuously with the loans she receives. With the current loan she will buy a large quantity of cement. Her dream is that her two beautiful treasures, as she calls them, are able to study and become professionals.

Norma M. has eight children. She went into business selling hot drinks. Now she sells clothing, food and fruit depending on the season. Before, she could not count on having business capital because she used all of her earnings to feed her children. Her husband drives a tractor that he rents to institutions. Now Norma can save for the education of her children who are in college.

Soledad S. is married. Her business is selling CDs and DVDs. She is thankful for the communal bank meetings because she has learned a lot. She wants to invest her loan in the purchase of plastics because she has seen that there aren't any in the Huando community.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The San Antonio de Padua Communal Bank requests a loan for 13,900 soles that will be used by its 18 members to invest in their businesses.

loan.name: Santa Rosa De Pachaclla Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal D. Santa Rosa D. PachaclL. pertenece a L. Comunidad D. PachacclL. ubicada en el Distrito D. Yauli en Huancavelica. Es una zona fra, se realizan ferias dominicales, es una zona muy bonita donD. a cada paso hay animales como llamas, mensualmente se hace L. trasquilacin D. lana D. alpacas, carneros entre otros. Su actividad principal es L. ganadera, agricultura, artesana, sus pobladores con comerciantes.

Victoria T., venD. quesos y realiza tejidos D. chalinas, ahora incrementar su negocio vendiendo verduras en las ferias dominicales. Su reto es afrontar algo en su hogar, pues su esposo es machista.

Ana Mara Otyae, venD. lana en pequeos ovillos D. multicolores en las ferias, esta agradecida con FINCA pues antes no haba recibido prestamos, nadie haba confiado en elL.. Ahora esta aprendiendo a ahorrar y con los prestamos esta surtiendo su negocio. Ana Mara suea con tener una tienda llena D. lanas.

Beatriz S., sabe hilar lanas D. alpaca, vicua, oveja y venD. los tejidos D. medias, chompas y guantes. Con los prestamos elL. va a surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa D. PachaclL. Communal Bank belongs to the community of PachaclL. located in the Yauli district of Huancavelica. It's a very cold place and there are markets on Sunday. It's a very lovely area and there are animals called llamas everywhere. Every month they shave the wool of the alpacas and sheep. The principle activities are raising cattle, agriculture and handicrafts and the inhabitants are tradesmen.

Victoria T. sells cheeses and makes shawls. Now she will expand her business selling vegetables in the Sunday market. Her biggest challenge is facing an issue at home because her husband is a male chauvinist.

Ana Mara Otae sells small, multicolored balls of wool in the markets. She is grateful to FINCA because before, she had not received any loans because no one trusted her. Now she is learning to save and with the loans is nurturing her business. Ana Mara dreams of having a wool store.

Beatrz S. knows how to spin alpaca, vicuna and sheep's wool and sells woven socks, sweaters and gloves. With the loans she is going to buy supplies for her business and will increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: The Santa Rosa de Pachaclla Communal Bank needs a loan of 3,200 soles for 12 of its members who wish to grow their businesses

loan.name: Anglica

texts.es:
Esta joven madre inici su negocio comprando y vendiendo pltanos en la comunidad y tambin trasladndolos a Managua al mercado Mayoreo; y los fines de semanas realiza la actividad de venta de fritanga en su casa donde vive con su mam, tiene bastante clientela de la comunidad, es conocida por la calidad de su comida; ella piensa invertir ms en el negocio para obtener ms ganancias y poder construir su pequea casa en un terreno heredado de su mam.
Ella vive con su esposo y su hijo pequeo, quien se entiende directamente en el negocio es solamente ella. Piensa obtener ms crditos para salir adelante y poder realizar lo que suea.
texts.en:
This young mother started her own business buying and selling bananas in the community, as well as transporting them to Managua to the Wholesale market. On weekends, she sells fried food in her home, where she lives with her mother. She has a large clientele in the community, and she is known for her quality foods. She plans on investing more money into the business so that she can yield greater profits and be able to build her small house on a plot of land that she inherited from her mother.

She lives with her husband and young son. She is the only one who deals directly with the business. She plans on obtaining more loans so that she can get ahead and be able to realize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase products

loan.name: Cleotilde

texts.es:
Esta seora se dedica a la actividad agrcola junto con su esposo, cultiva tomates, cebolla, chiltomas, sandas y granos bsicos como arroz, maz, frijoles. Trabaja con sus hijos, ella es propietaria del terreno que cultiva y es quien comercializa la produccin en el mercado de Rivas y de Tola, algunos productos lleva al mercado de Managua. Es persona que ha manejado su actividad con mucha responsabilidad, inici con granos bsicos y luego con las hortalizas que le dan ms ganancias.
Ella espera poder comprar ganado menor para complementar la actividad agropecuaria y dar sostenibillidad alimentaria para su familia e ingresos mejores para el estudio de sus hijos. Ella se siente que est satisfecha de poder controlar el negocio y poder manejar los crditos que ADIM le ha dado para salir adelante
texts.en:
This woman dedicates her time to agriculture together with her husband. She grows tomatoes, onions, sweet peppers, watermelons and basic grains like rice, corn and beans. She works with her children and is the proprietor of the cultivated land. She is the one who sells the produce in the Rivas and Tola market; some produce she takes to the market in Managua. She is someone who has managed her business with much responsibility. She began selling basic grains and later started selling produce which brings in more income. She hopes to buy small livestock to complete her farming business and give her family a sustained source of food and help with their education. She feels much satisfaction from managing her business and the previous loans she recieved from ADIM to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy agricultural consumables

texts.es:
El bancomunal Tayta Espritu esta ubicado en la comunidad de La Mejorado, distrito de Mariscal Cceres en Huancavelica.

Elsa C., se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras, se inici hace 10 aos junto a su esposo, fue muy difcil porque tenan poco capital. Cuando sus hijos fueron creciendo los gastos eran mas grandes, Elsa usar su prstamo en incrementar su negocio.

Edeliza Quispe, se dedica a la venta de ropa en las ferias de Yauli, Ascoria e Izcuchaca, su esposo trabaja en la chacra, as solventa su hogar de sus 7 hijos, ellos se iniciaron con poco capital, pues los bancos les pedan muchas cosas y era difcil solicitar un prstamo. Con el apoyo de FINCA a comprado mercadera, ahora desea invertir porque se vienen las fiestas navideas y el negocio es bueno en esa poca.

Ana Antonia, tiene una bodega, antes venda hojas de coca y gaseosas, ella desea con el prstamo incrementar su negocio para ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos.

loan.use: El bancomunal Tayta Epiritu necesita 6300 nuevos soles para que sus 11 socias inviertan en sus negocios.

loan.name: Blanca Lili

texts.es:
Blanca inici el negocio para ayudar a su esposo, ya que en ocasiones tiene pocas muy difciles porque sus 3 hijos estudian y el ms grande dentro de poco va a comenzar una carrera universitaria y quiere apoyarlo. Comenz en Noviembre de 2006 a vender productos para el hogar por invitacin de una amiga a una demostracin, pero en Mayo de 2007 por invitacin de otra amiga comenz con la venta de ropa usada ya que en esta actividad obtiene mejores ganancias. En su crdito anterior con KIVA pudo invertir en mercanca lo cual le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas y al mismo tiempo sus ganancias y gracias a ello ha podido salir adelante con los estudios de sus hijos.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $475 que pagara en 5 meses para poder comprar ropa usada de temporada ahora que se acerca el otoo y la gente empieza a comprar ropa para la temporada de fro lo cual le permitir tener mejor surtido para mis clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca began her business to help her husband, as from time to time she has difficult moments because her 3 children study and the oldest will soon begin studying at the university and she wants to support him. She began her business in November 2006 selling household products through a friends invitation to a demonstration. But in May 2007 another friend invited her to sell used clothing as there are greater profits in this work. With her previous KIVA loan she was able to invest in merchandise which helped her increase her sales and at the same time her earning. Thanks to that loan she was able to be successful and provide an education to her children. She needs a loan of US $475, which will be repaid in 5 months, in order to buy seasonal used clothing now that fall is approaching and people are starting to buy clothing for the cold season, which will permit her to have a better stock for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy used clothing

loan.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa una persona alegre, simptica, trabajadora y emprendedora inici el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ya que el trabaja por su cuenta y no percibe un ingreso fijo y por lo tanto sus ingresos varan ya que a veces tiene trabajo y a veces no. comenz en Mayo de 2004, cuando una promotora de cosmticos la invit a vender dichos productos y como a le gustan mucho las ventas, adems de que tiene muchas amistades y personas conocidas entre las cuales poda ofrecer dichos productos y hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien. Con su anterior crdito con KIVA pudo comprar los productos que vende y quedar bien con sus clientes los cuales han aumentado y eso la ha ayudado para salir adelante con los gastos de nuestro hogar.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $475 que pagara en 5 meses para invertir en productos de belleza y poder quedar bien con sus clientes que cada vez le hacen mas pedidos.
texts.en:
Felipa is a happy, nice, hard-working and enterprising person who began a business to help her husband with the household expenses. Her husband is self-employed and does not have a fixed income, and his income also varies. Sometimes he has work and sometimes he does not. Felipa began her business in May 2004 when a cosmetics saleswoman invited her to sell the products. It has gone well for her, as she likes sales a lot and has many friends and acquaintances to who she can sell her products. With her previous loan from Kiva, she was able to buy the products she sells and make a good impression on her clients. The number of her clients has increased, and this has helped her get ahead with household expenses.

She needs a loan of $475, which she will repay over 5 months, to invest in beauty products and make a good impression on her clients, who each time are placing more orders.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase beauty products

loan.name: Yaqueline

texts.es:
Esta seora inici vendiendo productos naturales combinado con una mini pulpera, ella pens en invertir ms en la pulpera porque era donde mas venda, vendi tres pepanos (triciclos para hacer viajes cortos en la localidad) (ciclo taxis) para invertir en el inventario e hizo un primer crdito con ADIM y as logr tener un crecimiento en su negocio y ahora con cada crdito ella invierte en ms productos que son de primera necesidad y de rpida rotacin y otros que sus clientes le encargan como cosmticos, ropa menor y grande, etc.
Vive con su esposo que es taxista, ella se entiende sola en el negocio, tiene un hijo pequeo. Piensa en crecer ms para as garantizar el futuro de su hijo y ser independiente econmicamente y as sentirse duea de su empresa decidiendo solo ella en su futuro.
texts.en:
Yaqueline started out selling natural products along with a small convenience store. She planned to invest more in the convenience store because that's where most of her sales were. She sold three moto-rickshaws so she could invest in supplies and took out her first loan with Kiva partner ADIM, and she was able to grow her business. Now with every loan she invests in more products that are of prime necessity and rapid rotation, as well as other items her customers demand like cosmetics, small and large clothes, etc. She lives with her husband, who is a taxi driver, and they have a small son. She works on her business alone. She plans to grow it even more so she can guarantee a bright future for her son and be economically independent, thusly feeling like the owner of her business and having control of her future.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Tayta Soltero Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Tayta Soltero, pertenece a la Comunidad D. La MejoR., ubicada en el distrito D. Mariscal Cceres en Huancavelica. Esta comunidad esta ubicada al margen derecho del ro Mantaro entre 2600 y 3600 metros D. altitud, tiene un clima clido, cuenta con acceso a las ciudades D. Huancavelica y Huancayo. Fue llamado Mariscal Cceres porque por este lugar pasaban los virreyes, encomenderos, ejrcitos D. las revoluciones pues cruzaban los caminos D. Ayacucho, Huancayo y Huancavelica.

Julia Chapca, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar, su negocio es la venta D. verduras y comida. Con los prestamos que recibe los invierte en mercadera, Julia antes solo venda verduras, ahora venD. tambin anticuchos y papa rellena, sus hijos mayores le ayudan.

Zila V., tiene negocio D. cochinilla y venta D. Tara, empez muy joven a trabajar junto a su esposo, ella ahora se dedica al negocio y su esposo al transporte, la falta D. dinero y capital fue un problema que tuvo que enfrentar. Con el prestamos que recibir surtir su negocio para tener mas ingresos.

Ana S., tiene una bodega desD. hace 13 aos, cuando recin empez los distribuidores n le daban crdito, ana aprendi a ahorrar y a invertir en su mercadera ahora su negocio a crecido. Ahora ella da crdito a sus vecinas que necesitan algunos productos D. su bodega. Ella invertir su prstamo en mercadera y con las ganancias arreglar su casa. Su sueo es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Tayta Soltero Communal Bank belongs to the community of La MejoR., located in the Mariscal Cceres in Huancavelica. This community is located on along the right siD. of the Mantaro River at an altituD. between 2,600 and 3,600 meters. It has a warm climate and offers access to the cities of Huancavelica and Huancayo. It was named Mariscal Cceres because it is a place where viceroys, military leaders and revolutionary armies passed by on the roads from Ayacucho, Huncayo and Huancavelica. Julia Chapca is a single mother with four school-aged children. Her business is vegetable and food sales. With the loans she receives she invests in merchandise. Before, Julia only sold vegetables. Now she also sells kebabs and stuffed potatoes. Her older children help her. Zila V. has a business raising pigs and selling tara. She started very young working alongsiD. her husband. She now takes care of the business and her husband is in charge of the transportation. The lack of money and capital was a problem that she had to face. With the loans that she will receive she will increase her business to have more income. Ana S. has had a general store for the last 13 years. When she started the distributors wouldnt give her credit. Ana learned to save and to invest in merchandise and now her business has grown. Now she gives credit to her neighbors that need certain products from her store. Eh will invest her loan in merchandise and with the earnings she will make repairs to her home. Her dream is that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Money to be used by 13 members of the communal bank to invest in their businesses

loan.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una persona muy activa y trabajadora; inici el negocio porque necesitaba un ingreso extra ya que la pensin que recibe de su esposo no le alcanzaba para cubrir todas las necesidades y adems tena algunas deudas que cubrir. En un inicio se dedic a vender diversos productos, pero en el 2004 se empezaron a poner de moda los accesorios de bisutera y de esta manera fue como su hija y ella decidieron elaborar pulseras y collares. Les fue muy bien y posteriormente empezaron a vender productos de belleza y hasta ahora han podido salir adelante. Hace 2 aos le dieron su primer crdito KIVA el cual les ayud mucho. Haban ido creciendo pero debido a una enfermedad de una hermana a la cual me toc cuidar y la cual lamentablemente falleci se estancaron un poco, pero sabe que con la ayuda de Dios saldrn adelante.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $700 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar materiales para la elaboracin de pulsera y collares, as como en productos de belleza lo cual le permitir incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Isabel is a very active and hardworking person. She started the business because she needed an extra income because the pension that her husband receives wasn't enough to cover all of the needs and besides, she had other debts to cover. In the beginning she worked selling a variety of products but in 2004 costume jewelry started to become popular and because of this she and her daughter decided to make bracelets and necklaces. They did very well and later started to sell beauty products and until now have been successful. Two years ago, Kiva gave them their first loan and it helped a lot. They had been growing but due to the illness of her sister who unfortunately died and her responsibly to care for her, the business slowed down a little but they know that with God's help it will continue to grow. She needs a loan for US$700, which will be repaid in six months, to buy materials needed to make bracelets and necklaces in addition to beauty products and that will help them increase their sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Bertha Adelina

texts.es: Esta seora inici su negocio con un pequeo capital propio y el primer crdito lo obtuvo con ADIM cuando ADIM inici operaciones en esta localidad y desde entonces ha ido mejorando cada vez ms, ella tena una pequea tienda de granos y ahora tiene un tramo de abarrotes con variedad de cosmticos bastante surtido con numerosa clientela y excelente ubicacin en el mercado de Rivas. Vive con su esposo que le ayuda en el tramo, piensa mantener el inventario y surtir cada vez ms de nuevos productos para incrementar sus ventas y mantener a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This lady started her business with a small capital of her own and she obtained her first loan with ADIM when ADIM started operating in this area and since then she has improved a lot. She started with a small store selling grains and now she has groceries, a large variety of cosmetics for her numerous clients, and excellent facilities at the market of Rivas. She lives with her husband who supports her with her business, she wishes to maintain the stock, improve it with new products in order to increase sales, and keep her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase products in order to increase sales.

loan.name: Mara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen inici el negocio porque necesitbamos dinero para sacar adelante a nuestros hijos que estaban estudiando y como eran cinco nuestra situacin era ms difcil y tenamos algunas deudas que cubrir. El negocio lo inici un cuado, pero como el se fue de la ciudad y vio su necesidad, se lo traspas en el ao 2001 y desde entonces les fue muy bien, ya que mucha gente los conoce por estar ubicados en un lugar donde hay mucho trnsito de vehculos. Hace dos aos le dieron el primer crdito a travs de KIVA y desde entonces han crecido ya que amplio el local y compr ms sillas y mesas para poder atender ms personas.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $700 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar materia prima que le permita seguir elaborando pollos asados para darle un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen started the business because she needed money to support her children who were in school. Because there were five of them the situation was more difficult plus she had debts to cover. The business was started by a brother-in-law but because he left and went to the city and she saw a need, he signed over the business to her in 2001. Since then things have gone very well because many people know them and they are in a highly-trafficked location. Two years ago they were given their first loan through Kiva and since then they have grown because they were able to increase the size of the space and purchase more chairs and tables to be able to attend more clients. She needs a loan for US$700, which will be repaid in six months, to buy the products that will allow her to continue to roast chickens and offer good service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase products needed to run the business

loan.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia inici el negocio por deseos de salir adelante, de ser una mujer independiente y poder tomar sus propias decisiones y porque le gustan mucho las ventas, adems de que puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Comenz en el mes de Marzo de 2004, platico con su esposo acerca de la necesidad de otro ingreso y de lo mucho que le gustaban las ventas y fue cuando el le sugiri que vendiera las verduras y las salsas para mariscos, ya que de esta manera se complementara con la actividad de l que es la compra-venta de pescados y mariscos, y ella ofrecera las verduras y las salsas para prepararlas y desde entonces se dedico a esta actividad. Con su anterior crdito KIVA pudo surtir mejor su negocio y aunque este ao ha sido un poco difcil por las intensas lluvias que han azotado la regin he podido mantenerse y salir adelante.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas productos a precio de mayoreo y tener un mayor surtido para mis clientes que acuden a comprar ingredientes para preparar sus mariscos
texts.en:
Virginia started the business because of her desire to get ahead, to be an independent woman, to be able to make her own decisions and because she likes sales a lot. Besides that, she can help her husband with the household expenses. She began in March of 2004. She spoke with her husband about the need for an additional income and how much she liked sales and that's when he suggested that she sell vegetables and sauces for seafood because that way it would compliment his business which is purchasing and selling fish and seafood. She started offering the vegetables and sauces and ever since she has dedicated her time to this activity.

With her previous Kiva loan she was able to offer more products and, even though this year has been a little difficult due to the intense rains that they have experienced in the region, she has been able to maintain the business and get ahead.

She needs a loan for US$750, which she will repay in six months, to purchase more products at wholesale prices and have a better offering for her clients that go to her to buy the ingredients needed to prepare their seafood.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase products at wholesale prices

loan.name: Sonia Cristina

texts.es:
Esta seora tiene un negocio de Comidera en el mercado de Rivas, inici vendiendo comidas rpidas en el municipio de Tola con capital propio, aprovecho la oportunidad que se le present para vender en el Mercado y se estableci con la ayuda de un crdito obtenido en ADIM con el que compr sillas, mesas, utensilios de cocinas, manteles, etc. En el negocio le ayudan sus dos hermanas y le apoya su esposo que es taxista, ella siente que con su negocio es mas independiente y que ha logrado salir adelante dando trabajo a su familia y ayudndola.
Tiene dos nios pequeos que son estudiantes y ella piensa trabajar para que ellos estudien y tengan una profesin, dndole un mejor nivel de vida que el que ella tuvo. Expresa que lo puede lograr con financiamiento que es lo que hasta ahora le ha ayudado mucho para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sonia sells meals in the Rivas market. She started selling fast foods in the town of Tola with her own money, and took advantage of the opportunity to sell in the market when it presented itself, establishing it with the help of a loan obtain through Kiva partner ADIM. With it she purchased chairs, tables, cooking utensils, table cloths, etc. Her two brothers help her with the business, and her husband, a taxi driver, supports her as well. She feels the business has made her more independent and has helped her make headway by giving work to her family and helping it. She has two small children who are in school, and she plans to keep working so they can continue their studies and become successful, giving them a better quality of life than what she had. Sonia says she could not have done it with out the help of loans, which have really helped her make headway up to this point.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase ingredients to make her meals

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Esta seora tiene un negocio de pulpera, inici vendiendo refrescos y helados, luego prob con otros productos como gaseosa y vio que ella poda producir para aportar a los gastos de la casa, pues su esposo no poda con todos los gastos y los nios son estudiantes y tenan gastos .Pensando esto decidi vender otros productos y as ella llego a tener la pulpera que hasta hoy tiene y que est ubicada en la carretera panamericana con rtulo grande para vender a los viajeros de la carretera.
Decidi obtener un crdito con ADIM y as ofreci ms variedad de product6os a los clientes, as ella con todos los financiamientos ha mejorado en la presentacin del local que al da de hoy tiene un espacio seguro y a la par su calidad de vida para la familia.
Est satisfecha con haber logrado salir a delante por su familia y sentir que es empresaria que puede seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Rosa runs a convenience store. She started out selling beverages and ice cream, then added other products like soft drinks and saw that she was able to help with household expenses; her husband couldn't afford them all on his own and their children are in school. With this in mind, she started selling more products and now has her store located on the Panamerican Highway with a big sign to attract travelers. She decide to obtain a loan through Kiva partner ADIM so she could offer a wider selection of merchandise to her customers, and with all the help, she has been able to improve her store's presentation, making it more secure and improving her family's quality of life at the same time. She's satisfied with having been able to make headway for her family and feels that her business can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise for her convenience store.

loan.name: Mara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen inici el negocio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra y de esta manera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ya que el dinero que ganaba a veces no le alcanzaba y se desesperaba mucho, fue por eso que decidi dedicarse a una actividad en la que pudiera ganar dinero y al mismo tiempo cuidar a sus hijos. Comenz en el mes de Marzo de 2003, vendiendo tortas en una mesita que acondicion para poder elaborar las torta, el pan y la carne la calentaba en la estufa de su casa, pero poco a poco le empez a ir mejor y pudo comprar un carrito tortero en buenas condiciones el cual ubic en el frente de su casa as como unas mesitas y sillas para que sus clientes pudieran comerse las tortas ah de manera cmoda. Con su anterior crdito en KIVA pudo comprar ingredientes para seguir elaborando sus tortas y por sugerencia de unas personas ahora tambin elabora tacos y le ha ido mejor.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar ingredientes para la elaboracin de sus tortas y tacos que le permitan brindar una buena atencin a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen started the business due to the need to earn extra income and in this way help her husband with household expenses. Because the money he was making wasn't enough, he would often become desperate. Because of this she decided to work doing anything she could to make money while at the same time take care of her children. She started in March 2003 selling sandwiches from a table that she designed to use to make them. The bread and meat were warmed on the stove in her home but little by little things started going well and she was able to buy a sandwich cart that was in good condition that she put in front of her home in addition to a small table and chairs so that her clients could be more comfortable while they ate their sandwiches.

With her previous credit from Kiva she was able to buy ingredients needed to make the sandwiches and due to the suggestion of several people she now also makes tacos and business has improved.

She needs a loan for US$750 that she will repay in six months to buy ingredients to make sandwiches and tacos so that she will be able to offer better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase ingredients

loan.name: Gloria Mara

texts.es:
En su casa ubicada en una zona urbana de la Ciudad de Rivas tiene instalado su negocio en su casa, jefa de su familia integrada por 4 personas, en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos que son estudiantes, el resto del da ella es la que atiende, ella realiza las compras en el mercado de mayoristas de Rivas.
Piensa seguir siendo usuaria de ADIM para obtener crditos y as seguir creciendo en su negocio, piensa ofrecer cosmticos y ropa menor que sus clientes demandan, tambin mejorar el local para dar una mejor atencin.
Expresa que ella se siente empresaria y satisfecha de tener su negocio y que es capaz de salir adelante sola con el apoyo del financiamiento.
texts.en:
In her home located in the urban area of the city of Rivas, Gloria has installed her convenience store. Head of her four-member household, her children (students) help her with the business when they can and she takes care of things herself the rest of the time. Gloria makes her purchases at the city's wholesale market. She plans to continue using Kiva partner ADIM to obtain loans to help her keep growing her business. She plans to offer the cosmetics and lingerie her customers demand and also make improvements to her store for better customer service. She says she feels enterprising and satisfied having her business and that she is capable of making headway on her own with the help of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise and make improvements to her store

loan.name: Mara Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mara Guadalupe inici el negocio por la necesidad de obtener otro ingreso ya que mi esposo se haba quedado sin trabajo y nuestros hijos estaban estudiando. Comenz en el ao 2002, en una ocasin que se le acab el contrato de trabajo a su esposo surgi la idea de poner un negocio en su casa, para lo cual habilitaron un espacio y mientras el volva a ser contratado por otra empresa trabaj en la instalacin de su tienda. En el 2006 le dieron su primer crdito a travs de KIVA y desde entonces ha ido creciendo poco a poco y ha podido surtir mejor su negocio.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $825 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar ms mercanca que le permita tener una mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta forma aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mara Guadalupe started the business out of the necessity to have another income because her husband was without work and their children needed to study. She started in 2002 in one occasion that her husbands work contract had expired. He suggested the idea of establishing a business in their home and they created a space for it. Her husband was once again contracted to work and in the meantime she worked on the installation of her store. In 2006 she received her first loan through Kiva and since then has grown little by little and has been able to better supply her business.

She needs a loan for US$825 that she will repay in six months to purchase additional merchandise that will allow her to have a greater variety of products to offer her clients and in this way increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Tayta Espiritu Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Tayta Espritu esta ubicado en la comunidad D. La Mejorada, distrito D. Mariscal Cceres en Huancavelica.

Elsa C., se dedica al negocio D. venta D. verduras, se inici hace 10 aos junto a su esposo, fue muy difcil porque tenan poco capital. Cuando sus hijos fueron creciendo los gastos eran mas grandes, Elsa usar su prstamo en incrementar su negocio.

Edeliza Q., se dedica a la venta D. ropa en las ferias D. Yauli, Ascoria e Izcuchaca, su esposo trabaja en la chacra, as solventa su hogar D. sus 7 hijos, ellos se iniciaron con poco capital, pues los bancos les pedan muchas cosas y era difcil solicitar un prstamo. Con el apoyo D. FINCA a comprado mercadera, ahora desea invertir porque se vienen las fiestas naviD.as y el negocio es bueno en esa poca.

Ana Antonia, tiene una bodega, antes venda hojas D. coca y gaseosas, ella desea con el prstamo incrementar su negocio para ayudar en los estudios D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Tayta Espritu Communal Bank is located in the community of La Mejorada, district of Mariscal Cceres in Huancavelica.

Elsa C. has a business selling vegetables. She started 10 years ago with her husband and it was very difficult because they had little capital. As her children were growing up the expenses were very big. Elsa will use her loan to grow her business.

Edeliza Q. works selling clothing in the markets of Yauli, Ascoria and Izcuchaca. Her husband works on a farm and that's how they support their home and seven children. They started with little capital because the banks required a lot from them and it was difficult to obtain a loan. With the support of FINCA to buy merchandise, they now wish to invest because Christmastime is coming and business is good that time of year.

Ana Antonia has a store. Before she sold coca leaves and soft drinks. She needs a loan to increase the size of her business to help fund her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: 11 communal bank members will invest in their businesses in the community of La Mejorada

loan.name: Mara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen inici el negocio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso adicional al de su esposo que les permitiera darles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos. Comenz en el ao 2002, cuando una amiga le hizo unos adornos para la fiesta de cumpleaos de uno de sus hijos y le dijo que porque no se animaba a hacerlos; ella le explic y comenz a hacer bolsitas y adornos de navidad. Posteriormente comenz a elaborar figuras y cajitas de madera para los arreglos con la ayuda de su pap que es carpintero. Desde entonces le ha ido muy bien ya que le hacen pedidos de las escuelas sobre todo en pocas especiales como Navidad, da de las madres, da del nio, etc. En el 2006 recibi su primer crdito a travs de KIVA y desde entonces ha mantenido su negocio y sus clientes han aumentado.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $825 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materiales que le permitan cumplir con los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes y seguir dndoles un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Carmen started the business due to the necessity of having an income in addition to that of her husband that would allow them to give a better quality of life to their children. She started in 2002 when a friend made her some decorations for one of her childrens birthday party and asked her if she was interested in making them. Her friend explained how and she began to make Christmas bags and ornaments. Later she began to make wooden figurines and small boxes with the help of her father who is a carpenter. Since then she has done very well because shools order from her, especially during holiday times like Christmas, Mothers Day, Childrens Day, etc.

In 2006 she received her first loan from Kiva and since then she has maintained her business and her clientele has grown. She needs a loan for US$825 that she will repay in six month to buy materials that will allow her to fill her clients orders and continue to give them good service.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase materials

loan.name: Virgen Maria Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Virgen Maria, esta ubicado en L. comunidad D. Chaccarillos en el distrito D. Yauli en Huancavelica. Esta comunidad es una zona ganadera, L. comunidad es muy bonita porque tiene arboleda D. Eucaliptos.

Antonia S., antes venda medias tejidas, ahora con os prestamos que recibe a comprado cerditos y gallinas para vender. Con los prestamos quiere comprar mas animales para tener una granja. Su meta es comprarse una vaca para as incrementar su negocio y ayudar en el estudio D. sus hijos.

Aquilina H., esta muy triste porque uno D. sus hijos falleci, su negocio es L. venta D. quesos y cuyes que lleva a Lima, con su prestamos incrementar su negocio y con sus ahorros comprar un televisor para sus hijos.

Raymunda M., es transportista, apoya a su esposo en este negocio y aprovecha en vender queso, leche, gallinas y huevos. Raymunda antes andaba hospitalizada pues tiene cncer a las mamas, elL. se ha operado y ahora se siente mejor, tiene mucha ganas D. continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
EThe community bank Virgen Maria is located in the community of Chaccarillos, in the District of Yauli, in Huancavelica. This community is in an area with lots of livestock farming. The community is very pretty because it is forested with Eucalyptus trees. Antonia S. used to sell knitted socks. Now with the loan that she will receive she will buy pigs and chickens to sell. With the money we lend her, she wants to buy more animals in order to have a farm. Her goal is to buy a cow and so improve her business and help with the studies of her children. Aquilina H. is very sad because one of her children passed away. Her business is the sale of cheese and guinea pigs that she takes to Lima. With your loan she will increase her business and with the savings buy a television for her children. Raymunda M. is a commercial carrier. She helps her husband in this business and helps to sell cheese, milk, chickens, and eggs. Raymunda was hospitalised for breast cancer. She has been operated on and now she feels better, she has the drive to continue working in order to help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: For 13 businesses to invest

loan.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa inici el negocio porque su esposo la abandon cuando sus hijos eran muy pequeos y nunca les ayud econmicamente, inclusive dejo de trabajar para no tener que darles dinero y ella sola tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos. Comenz el 28 Mayo de 1994, es una fecha que siempre recuerdo porque ese da su esposo se fue de la casa y la dej sola con sus 4 hijos. Comenz vendiendo comidas, despus ropa usada en la banqueta de su casa y despus ya se instalo en un mercado rodante que se pone en la colonia donde vive. En la actualidad aparte de vender ropa tambin esta trabajando como empleada. El crdito anterior que le fue otorgado por KIVA le ayud mucho a resurtirse de mercanca lo cual le permiti mejorar mis ventas.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $275 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar ropa usada de temporada que le permitir tener un mejor surtido para que sus clientes sigan comprndole.
texts.en:
Teresa began her business because her husband left her when her children were very small. He never helped her economically. He even stopped working in order to not to have to give them money, and so she had to support her children by herself. She began on the 28th of May, 1994. It is a date that she will always remember because on this day her husband left the house and left her alone with 4 children. She began selling food, and later used clothing in the sidewalk of her house, and later she got a place in an open air market, that is in the district where she lives. Currently, in addition to selling clothing, she also works as an employee. The previous loan that she got from KIVA helped her very much to stock merchandise, which allowed her to improve her sales. She needs a loan of US $275 that she would repay in 4 months in order to buy seasonal used clothing that will allow her to have a better supply for her clients to buy.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Margarito

texts.es:
Margarito inici el negocio porque deseaba tener un ingreso estable ya que trabajo en varias empresas pero solo le daban contratos temporales y sus ingresos variaban mucho, motivo por el cual tuvo muchos problemas con su primera esposa y eso ocasion que se divorciara, fue por eso que decidi poner su negocio. Comenz en Agosto de 1976, cuando un amigo lo invit a trabajar en una obra en donde tena que instalar protectores de ventanas y una reja. A partir de ese trabajo le salieron mas clientes y hasta la fecha me ha ido muy bien.

El necesita un prstamo por US $275 que pagara en 4 meses para poder comprar herramienta de trabajo que le permita llevar a cabo los trabajos que tiene pendientes y no quedar mal con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Margarito began the business because he wanted to have a stable income. He already worked in various businesses, but he was only given temporary contracts and his income was extremely variable. This was the reason he had many problems with his first wife, and even caused them to divorce. Because of this, he decided to open his business. He began in August of 1976, when a friend invited him to work on a project in which he had to install window coverings and bars. Because of this work many clients came to him and from this date it has gone very well. He needs a loan of US $275 that he would repay in 4 months in order to buy tools for his work that would allow him to finish the jobs that he has waiting and not disappoint his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy tools for work

loan.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina inici su negocio para tener un ingreso y estar en su casa, hace un ao decidi poner una mesa en su patio y empez con botana, ahora venD. verdura, paletas D. hielo y tiene un mostrador con productos cosmticos.

ElL. necesita un prstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para techar su patio y poner puerta en L. entrada y que el negocio no se moje y se vea ms presentable.
texts.en:
Sabina started her business in order to have an income and to be at home. A year ago she decided to put a table on her patio and started with snacks. Now she sells vegetables, popsicles and has a counter with cosmetic products.

She needs a loan for US$550 that she will repay in six months to put a roof over her patio and a door on the entrance so that water doesnt enter and the business looks more presentable.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Remodel her business location

loan.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana inici el negocio para tener un ingreso propio, y contar con dinero propio para sus gastos personales sin tener un trabajo con un horario fijo, ya que sus hijos aun estn chicos, por eso decidi ponerse a vender cosmticos por catalogo para no descuidarlos, ya que con el ingreso de su esposo, solo alcanza para los gastos familiares. Comenz hace aproximadamente 8 aos, la invito una amiga a vender, y su esposo le financio el monto para iniciarse y poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $1025 que pagara en 6 meses para terminar el local, poner la loza y tener venta ms directa, contando con producto para vender, adems de que incluir venta de regalos para obtener ms ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana began her business in order to have her own income and to have the status of her own money for her personal expenses, without a job with a fixed schedule because her children were still little. Because of this she decided to begin selling cosmetics by catalogue in order to not neglect her children, and with the income of her husband, only had to cover the family expenses. She began about 8 years ago, invited by a friend to sell. And her husband financed the sum to begin and little by little she has managed to move ahead. She needs a loan of US $1025 that she would repay in 6 months in order to finish the location, to include china, and to have more direct sales with merchandise to sell, also to include sales of gifts in order to obtain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To remodel her business location

loan.name: Griselda Vianey

texts.es:
Griselda inici el negocio ya que siempre le han gustado las ventas y tenia a su cargo la cafetera de la escuela en donde estudiaban sus hijos la primaria, pero al terminar de estudiar, tuvo que dejar la cafetera, ya que tienen que ser padres de familia de alumnos de la escuela para poder tener ese negocio; por lo que hace 4 aos, empez con un prstamo que le hizo una hermana a vender papas fritas para ayudarse, luego al ya no poder tener a su cargo la cafetera, y con la experiencia que haba adquirido en la misma, decidi instalar un snack ambulante por las tardes y en eventos especiales (fechas cvicas, fiestas religiosas, temporada de baseball, etc. ya que por las maanas trabaja de ayudante en la cafetera de una universidad.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir mercanca para prximos eventos, y tener mercanca para vender mas y obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Griselda began her business since she has always enjoyed sales, and she had in her care the cafeteria of the primary school in which her children studied. But at the end of their studies, she had to leave the cafeteria, because you must be a parent of the students of the school in order to be able to have this business. Because of this, 4 years ago she began with a loan from a sister to sell french fries in order to help herself. After she couldnt run the cafeteria, with the experience that she had acquired there she decided to began a mobile snack stand for the afternoons and special events (Civic dates, religious festivals, baseball season, etc.) Also in the mornings she works as a helper in the cafeteria at the university. She needs a loan of US $475 that she would repay in 6 months in order to stock merchandise for upcoming events, and to have merchandise in order to sell more and obtain a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Mara

texts.es:
La Sra. Mara tiene 51 aos y esta casada con el Sr. Oscar Vega, tienen 1 hija de 15 aos que esta cursando el 9 ao de la media. La Sra. Mara y el su marido el Sr. Oscar tienen una imprenta hace 15 aos en San Lorenzo en donde hacen libretas para colegios, talonarios, recibos, etc.

Oscar, adquiri sta profesin de su padre quien se dedico a esta actividad durante mucho tiempo del cual el aprendi mucho. La Sra. Mara anteriormente tenia una librera que tuvo que cerrar por que no tenia los ingresos necesarios para mantener el negocio, y se dedico de pleno a ayudar a su marido.

Gracias al esfuerzo de ambos pudieron terminar de construir su vivienda y actualmente solventar el gasto del estudio de su hijo. En el futuro tiene pensado abrir un local con varias maquinas para una mayor produccin y venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and is married to Oscar Vega. They have a 15 year old daughter who is in 9th grade. Maria and her husband Oscar have had a printing press for 15 years in San Lorenzo. They make notebooks, receipt books, receipts, etc.

Oscar, acquired this profession from his father who dedicated himself to this business for a long time. Maria previously had a bookstore which she had to close because she did not have the necessary income to maintain the business so she now dedicates herself to helping her husband.

Thanks to both of their efforts they were able to finish building their home and pay for the expenses of their daughters education. In the future, they want to open a shop with various machines to increase production and sales of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a printing press.

loan.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia inici el negocio ya que su mama la fue iniciando en el negocio, ya que ella se dedica a la vente de ropa; comenz hace varios aos, vendiendo afuera de su casa y en casa de su suegra, ella le compraba la ropa a su abuelita, quien traer ropa usada para vender; fue as como poco a poco logro clientes y ahora ya tiene mayores ingresos.

Ella necesita un prstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar ropa nueva, y tener ms ingresos para apoyo de los gastos de su casa.
texts.en:
Claudia started the business because her mother, who sells clothing, got her into it. Several years ago, she started selling clothing both outside her house and her mother-in-laws house. She used to buy clothing from her grandmother, who had used clothing to sell. This was how little by little she was able to obtain customers. Now, she has greater earnings.

She needs a loan of $750.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase new clothing and earn more income to help with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise (clothing)

loan.name: Nora

texts.es:
La seora Nora tiene 4 hijos todo menores de edad, es separada, ante de dedicaba a la venta ambulante de mercera por el interior del pas. Luego vio la necesidad de quedarse con sus hijos y como esfuerzo logro abrir su negocio. Hace 1 ao , ya que tiene una escuela frente a su domicilio

El crdito otorgado por la Fundacin, ser utilizado en las compras de mercadera varias para vender en su negocio tales como juguetes de todo tipo para nios y nias, cuadernos, libros, lpices, tiles varios de oficina, etc.

En el futuro suea con ampliar su negocio y abrir un ciber, fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Nora has 4 young children and is separated from her husband. She used to sell merchandise in the interior of the country as a traveling salesperson. She then saw the need to stay at home with her children and, with great effort, was able to open her business in her home which faces a school. She has had her business for one year.

The loan she receives through Fundacion will be used to purchase a variety of merchandise for her business such as all types of toys for boys and girls, notebooks, books, pencils, and various office supplies.

Her dream is to expand her business to provide internet services and photocopying services.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise.

loan.name: Ramn

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramn tiene 45 aos, esta casado con la Sra. Fidencia Gmez con quien tiene tres hijos, uno estudiante de nivel secundario y otros de nivel bsico.

El Sr. Ramn se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, tambin vende golosinas y bolsas de polietilenos de forma ambulante hace ya 10 aos. Empez con una motocicleta y luego con su ganancia compro un automvil ya que fue creciendo la cantidad de cliente y ampliando su zona de venta.

El Sr. Alejandro solicita este crdito para la compra de mercaderas varias para incrementar su stock de venta.
texts.en:
Ramon is 45 years old and he is married to Fidencia Gomez with whom he has three kids, one who is in secondary school while the others study at a lower level.

Ramon has been a wandering salesman, selling medicines, as well as sweets and polyethylene, for ten years. He started with a motorbike and then with his earnings he bought a car as his amount of clients increased and he enlarged the zone that he sold in.

Alejandro would like this credit to buy merchandise to increase his stock to sell.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy medicines, sweets and polyethylene/Compra de medicamentos ,golosinas y polietilenos

loan.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Reinaldo tiene 45 aos, esta casado con la Sra. Elva y tienen 3 hijas todos menores de edad.

El Sr. Reinaldo se dedica a la compra y venta de telfonos mviles nuevos y reacondicionados, y accesorios para los mismos. Anteriormente era empleado en una empresa y hace ocho aos tiene su puesto en el mercado de San Lorenzo.

El Sr. Reinaldo solicita este crdito para la compra de nuevos aparatos celulares y accesorios, ya que la tecnologa avanza cada da y la demanda de aparatos nuevos y ms modernos es cada vez ms alta.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is 45 years old and is married to Elva with whom he has 3 kids who are all young.

Reinaldo buys and sells new and reconditioned cellular phones and accessories. He used to be employed by a company and he has now had his stall in the San Lorenzo market for eight years.

Reinaldo would like this credit to buy new cell phone parts and accessories, as technology advances each day and the demand for new and more modern parts is higher all the time.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy cell phones and accessories/Compra de telfonos celulares y accesorios.

loan.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El seor Rolando N. tiene 32 aos es soltero, l se dedica a la venta de filtros de aceite para autos y motos, al igual que lubricantes y aceites de distintas marcas. Su negocio est ubicado sobre una avenida muy importante y con este trabajo esta construyendo para su casa en el terreno de su madre.

Suea con tener algn da un taller mecnico en el mismo pueda realizar los cambios de filtro y aceites.
texts.en:
Rolando N. is 32 years old and is single. He sells oil filters for cars and motorbikes, as well as different types of lubricants and oils. His business is on a very important road and with this job he is building his house on his mother's land.

He dreams of one day having his own mechanics garage where he could carry out oil and filter changes.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: To buy oils, filters and lubricants/Para la compra de aceites, filtros y lubricantes.

loan.name: Amancio

texts.es:
El Seor Amancio 41 aos de edad est casado hace mas de 20 aos con la Sra. Catalina Martnez de 35 aos de edad, tienen hijos todos en edad escolar, viven en casa propia en la compaa Simbrn de la ciudad de Roque Gonzlez.

El seor Amancio es hijo de un agricultor muy conocido de la zona, a los 26 aos de edad se cas con Sra. Catalina quien proviene de una familia humilde y que se dedicaba al tejido de mantas de algodn a mano. Toda la familia de Catalina se dedicaba a este oficio y es as que ella adquiri el oficio de tejedora de artesanas.

Amancio, buscando una salida al desempleo, decidi dedicarse a la venta ambulante de las artesanas que su esposa hace, y ya lleva ms de 15 aos que se dedica a esta actividad que ambos realizan con mucho xito, recorriendo varias ciudades.

Con el ingreso que le genera dicha actividad lograron construir su casa propia, comprar comodidades y as mejorar su calidad de vida. Solicita el prstamo para la compra de hilos de colores varios para que su esposa pueda tejer mayor variedad de mantas, pues sus clientes demandan en mayor cantidad en esta poca del ao.
texts.en:
Mr. Amancio, 41 years old, has been married for more than 20 years to Mrs. Catalina Martnez, 35 years old, and they have school-going children. They live in their own house in the Simbrn company in the town of Roque Gonzlez.

Don Amancio is the son of a very well-known farmer in the area and at the age of 26 he married doa Catalina who is from a modest family and who made hand-woven cotton blankets for a living. Catalina's entire family were weavers so she was trained in the artcrafts weaving trade.

Amancio,being unemployed, decided to become a street vendor selling his wife's handcrafts and he has been doing this for the past 15 years and they are both very successful selling in different towns.

With the earnings they have been able to build their own house, buy comforts, and thus improve their quality of life. The loan requested will be spend on purchasing different colored yarn for his wife to weave more varied blankets as demand grows this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: purchase cotton yarn in a variety of colors.

loan.name: Las Fantasticas Group

texts.es:
Juliana inicio el negocio para prosperar, cuando le dieron su casa nueva y no tena suficientes ingresos para sostenerse. Comenz surtiendo mercanca poco a poco hasta que fue haciendo crecer su negocio. Ahora requiere un prstamo para comprar mercanca y comprar un exhibidor.

Aglaeth porque no completaba con el sueldo de su esposo la falta de ingreso y el nacimiento de uno de sus hijos empez vendiendo productos para el hogar por catalogo entre sus vecinas y ellas misma la fueron recomendando con mas gente, ahora necesita un prstamo para comprar mercanca.

Olinda inicio el negocio por los escases de trabajo ya que no podia dejar a sus hijos pequeos para irse a trabajar, fue entonces que empez vendiendo quesos con sus vecinas hasta que hizo una pequea ruta y fue surtiendo en las tiendas de las colonias vecinas. Ahora requiere un prstamo para comprar un enfriador donde poner su mercanca.

El Grupo Fantsticas requiere un prstamo por US $700 que pagaran en 3 meses. Con tu apoyo ellas saldrn adelante.
texts.en:
Juliana started her business in order to get ahead when she received her new house and did not have sufficient income to support herself. She started carrying merchandise gradually until her business grew. She needs a loan to purchase merchandise and to purchase a display case.

Aglaeth started selling catalog home products because her husband's income was not sufficient after the birth of one of their children. She sells to her neighbors who themselves started recommending more people to her. She needs a loan to purchase merchandise.

Olinda started her business because work was scarce and she could not leave her young children alone while she was at work. This is when she started selling cheeses to her neighbors. She eventually established a small route and started supplying the stores in the neighboring neighborhoods. She needs a loan to purchase a refrigerator for her merchandise.

"Grupo Fantasticas" is asking for a loan in the amount of $700 which it will repay in 3 months. With your help they can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase merchandise.

loan.name: Rosa Julia

texts.es: Rosa tiene 35 aos. Ella tiene una tienda en la que vende ropa. Ella empez este negocio hace ocho aos. Anteriormente venda ropa en un puesto ambulante, sin embargo, los ingresos que obtena eran insuficientes, por lo que decidi poner una tienda en una galera de ropa. El ltimo crdito que Rosa recibi lo invirti en mercadera para su negocio. Ella cuenta que necesita un crdito adicional que le permita comprar una mquina de confeccin de prendas de vestir, as podra expandir su negocio y empezar a vender la ropa que ella misma disea.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old. She has a store where she sells clothing. A business which she started eight years ago. Previously she sold clothing at different stalls. Even so, the income she obtained was not sufficient which is why she decided to open a store. Rosa used the last loan that she received to purchase merchandise for her business. She needs an additional loan to purchase a sewing machine so that she can expand her business and start selling clothes that she designs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Purchase a sewing machine.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora por su negocio, vende productos de dulcera (rosquillas, suspiros, pan casero, entre otros), ella los prepara en su domicilio, su esposo Javier la apoya mucho y es l quien se encarga de hornear estos dulces. A sus 45 aos, es madre de 8 hijos, de los cuales 3 son independientes, quedando a su cargo 5 de ellos, que estudian y son sus ganas de seguir adelante, diariamente ruega al Todo Poderoso que siempre los proteja y los gue por el buen camino.Doa Julia quiere seguir superndose, y mandar a construir habitaciones en su casa para alquiler, es por eso que requiere del prstamo que solicita para cumplir con su propsito.
texts.en:
Juliana is an enterprising woman and works hard in her business of selling candies and baked goods. She prepares these in her home with the help of her husband who is in charge of baking. At her 45 years of age, she is the mother of eight children three of whom are independent and five of whom are in her charge and in school hoping to get ahead. She prays daily that they be protected and be guided down the right path. Julia wants to keep getting ahead and wants to build rooms in her home to rent out which is why she needs the loan she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Build rooms in her home to rent out.

loan.name: Gesarela

texts.es: Gesarela a sus 54 aos es madre 5 hijos que ya son profesionales e independientes. Se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante, ahora vive solo con su esposo Octavio quien es albail.Ella se dedica a la venta D. bebidas heladas (gaseosas, nctar y cerveza), es una mujer prometedora y luchadora cuando dice algo lo cumple y eso lo aplica en la mejora D. su calidad D. vida. Quiere implementar su negocio con otros productos, as como tambin ampliar y mejorar los ambientes donD. venD. sus productos, sin embargo, para lograr este propsito requiere D. esta cantidad D. dinero que solicita.
texts.en:
Gesarela is 54 years old and the mother of five children, who are all working professionals and living on their own. She now lives alone with her husband, Octavio, who is a contractor. She sells cold drinks (sodas, juices and beer), and works very hard to get ahead. She is a very promising woman and a fighter; she always keeps her word, especially when it comes to improving her own quality of life.

Gesarela would like to stock her store with different products and would also like to expand and improve the space in which she sells her drinks. She needs this Kiva loan to accomplish these goals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Buy a wider variety of products to sell, improve and expand store

loan.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 26 aos y es madre de 2 hijos quienes son el significado de vivir y seguir luchando por salir adelante, tambin tiene a lado a su esposo Walter quien es rematista de pltanos y siempre le da la mano en lo que puede.Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, este negocio es el que apoya en el sustento econmico de su familia, y para brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario para sus estudios, esperando que en un maana lleguen a ser personas de bien.Delia desea ampliar su negocio, comprar ms productos comestibles y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, por lo que necesariamente estima de un capital que la llevar a cumplir con su objetivo. Gracias a tu ayuda la seora Delia lograr su propsito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Delia is 26 years old and mother of 2 children who are her reason for living and continue fighting to be successful. She also has her husband, Walter, at her side, and he is a banana harvester and always gives a hand when he can. She sells groceries and basic needs products, and this business is what supports this family economically and provides the children whats needed for their education, hoping that one day they will be successful. Delia wishes to expand her business, buy more food products, and above all improve the structure of her home, so she needs capital to complete these goals. Thanks to your help Delia will be able to achieve her goals in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Increase the merchandise in her business and improve the structure of her home where her store is located

loan.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela es propietaria de dos motocarros, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches, tiene dos hijos menores. Su esposo Sergio es el chofer de uno de los motocarros y es quien se dedica al cuidado de las motos. El dinero que solicita ser invertido en el mantenimiento y arreglo de sus herramientas de trabajo, y mejorar su negocio de venta de comida, para posteriormente mandar a construir un kiosco para vender su comida cmodamente. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicacin sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar.
texts.en:
Mayela owns two motorcycles and also dedicates herself to selling food in the evenings. She has two young sons. Her husband Sergio drives one of the motorcycles and also takes care of their maintenance. The money she is requesting will be used to maintain the motorcycles and repair Sergio's tools and to improve Mayela's business of selling food so that she can build a kiosk to sell her food comfortably. Support this mother who with effort and dedication keeps working arduously to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loan.use: Maintenance of two motorcycles and investment in food selling business.

loan.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo inici el negocio para tener un ingreso extra para poder solventar sus necesidades y la de sus hijos, ya que su sueldo en ocasiones era insuficiente y quera darles estudio. Comenz en Marzo de 2005, con la elaboracin y venta de comida cuando su esposa le sugiri participar en una Tanda de dinero para invertirlo en unas sillas y mesas en el patio de su casa el cual acondicionamos.
